Please Read Entirely

Short Summary

To all of those who don’t know me personally,

    Let me start by introducing myself.  My name is José Artemio Rodríguez García.  I graduated from Aurora University, in Illinois, during the summer of 2010 with a Bachelors in Arts in the field of English.  For two years I have pondered about what I want to do with my life and writing has always secretly haunted my thoughts.  I guess I was afraid to take the path of the writer because it is not a lucrative one, and I, like many people nowadays, have been taught that a decent job and sufficient money is essential to survival.  I have decided to begin my career as a writer no matter how grave the struggle might be.  I just need a little help from friends and family, and those who might stumble across my campaign.   

    A journey through the backroads of Mexico to find inspiration that will allow me to complete literary works already in progress.  I plan on traveling the often dangerous roads of Mexico, rather than taking the more secure tollway, to reach the less touristic towns and places in Mexico to meet their people and take in the sites.  Hopefully all this will translate into my writings and my readers will be able to live my experiences vicariously.  During this journey I will write essays and creative pieces and hopefully compile a complete philosophical work in the style of Walden by Henry David Thoreau - this is my greatest goal as a writer.  It will probably take me more than a year to complete something of this magnitude, but I also have a short term goal.  This summer I will publish two series of short stories and poems in English and Spanish.  That will be my debut as a writer.  Did I mention I will do this barefoot?

    Contributions made will allow me to travel to Mexico where I will find shelter in the homes of relatives and friends, and away from the pressure of living in the U.S.. I will then be able to start my career as a writer.  You might think that I am trying to escape the stress from having a normal job here in the States, but this is not the case.  Writing is a full time job.  I will not always be sheltered.  In fact, I plan on traveling modestly with little or no comforts.  A wise chinese man once told me (mind you, he was actually an English professor of mine but he was also chinese and elder), “great writing often comes easily to the starving writer.”  This campaign will allow me to reach my country of destiny, and it is more of a thrust into my adventures as a writer than it is a funding of my whole travels.  Once in Mexico, I will find the means to travel by the most economic means, as I intend to be less materialistic in my life and more efficient in my existence on this planet.  Please note, that if my campaign raises more than what I have set as a goal I will find that every penny of it goes towards people who need it.

What I Need & What You Get

I need only 5,000 dollars.  I have traveled from Chicago to Mexico by car in the past and 500 dollars worth of gas and tolls usually gets me to Durango, Mexico.  However, this time around I will only take the freeway, a bit more risky but it will surely make for a great adventure.  I estimate that from Santa Clara, California, and with current gas prices it will be around 400 dollars to reach Durango.  While I am in Mexico I will have no assurance of funding to pay my student loan, car loan, credit card, and phone bill while I am out of the country so I am also calculating all this bills into the 5,000 dollars.  For the three months I plan on being south of the boarder I will need a total of around 2,000 dollars.  That will leave me with 2,600 dollars to travel all through out Mexico for three months paying for gas, food, and any other hidden expenses, most likely in the form of bribes.  It is not a lot of money for the type of journey I will make, but this will only make my journey more interesting.  

    Nobody expects to give with out receiving something in return.  So let us talk about the perks.  A 25 dollar contribution will get your name mentioned in my travel log on my WordPress, Blogger, and Facebook accounts under the Mecenas de las Artes / Patron of the Arts log.  I will include these addresses underneath.  A 50 dollar contribution will get your name mentioned in my publication of short stories and poems that I will compile over the summer and send to publish over the fall, and you will also get the first perk.  A 100 dollar contribution will get you not only perks one and two but also a signed copy of the publication once it is completed - note that I plan on only publishing a very limited amount of hard copies as I would prefer my readers to enjoy my writings on electronic books in an effort to be more environmentally conscious.  If you are one of the few that rarely receives gifts for christmas, you can expect to get one from me.  

    I just want to make it clear that if I do not reach my goal of 5,000 dollars all the contributions will be returned to the contributors.  I will still try to become a writer although it will be hard and I will not have much time to devote to my writing, being that I will have to keep my job through out the summer.  This is something that I have chosen to do, and I would like to feel the support of anyone who is willing to show it.  To know that I am not alone in this journey will assure me of the purpose in my choice of life. 

The Impact

There is value in what I propose to do for the contributors and the world.  First off, this summer I will complete my first work of creative writing (my short stories and poems) of which I have already started.  Secondly, and just as important, I will begin my research into topics that interest me and will surely interest my readers and provide insights that are of worth to us all.  These topics range from studies in indigenous people from mexico to the organic produce trade between the U.S. and Mexico.  The common place between these topics, and others, is mainly the human body and the human’s relation to the environment.  At the moment, I am waiting for a response regarding a scholarship to enter a Master’s program either in biology or environmental studies.  I am serious about these studies and my attraction to them is innate.  

    Either way, readers are sure to find my travel logs an amusing read.  Even if these subjects do not interest you perhaps the accounts of my journey will give you pleasure.  People always find me interesting, and I have been told that I always end up talking about myself.  I find this awkward because I am an introvert and I have always thought myself to be quiet and humble.  In my defense, if it seems like I talk too much about myself it is because when I am asked a question about myself I want to give a complete answer otherwise I feel like I am cutting the conversation short, and that is just not polite.  I tend to give people a little bit a history as to where my answer is coming from, and that usually turns into a story in itself.  This is my first campaign and I do not intend to let my contributors or my readers down!


Other Ways You Can Help

    For those of you who have read my campaign and are interested but cannot afford to make a contribution, I thank you for taking interest in my campaign and I would very much appreciate that you spread the word and do a little campaigning on your own on my behalf.  You are welcome to visit my sites and read my travel log, and participate by commenting and saying “hello!” from time to time.  

    For those of you who have read my campaign and have contributed, let’s hope that we meet our goal and that I am able to start my journey.  You wont be disappointed!    You are also welcome to partake in the adventure by participating with any advice or comments.  Perhaps we have already talked, and if we have not then I hope we can have a conversation either virtually or in person.  I hope you enjoy my writings and my travels.  One more thing, thank you for your contribution!  
    
Sincerely,

José Artemio Rodríguez García

story:
Hi.

My name’s Liz Green.   Maybe you already know me through some context—work, poetry shows, grad school, the Brass Liberation Orchestra, nebulous friend networks, etc. but I want to let you know about my background as a writer as you may not be familiar with all of it.  I have been accepted at the Tin House Writers’ Workshop in Portland this summer. It’s quite an opportunity, and I hope you will consider helping me reach my goal of attending.

ABOUT MY WORK AS A WRITER

I’ve been contributing to the Bay Area literary scene since I moved here from New York almost ten years ago.  In 2003, I had a one-act play produced at the San Francisco Fringe Festival called “Airtight Security.”  In 2004 my full-length play about Mumia Abu-Jamal was given a staged reading by the Playwrights’ Center of San Francisco.  Later that year I went on to become the San Francisco Poetry Slam Co-Champion and competed at the National Poetry Slam with the SF Team.   Since then, I have featured as a performance poet and prose writer at numerous shows, national theater festivals, schools, and colleges throughout California up through the present day. In 2007, I earned an MFA in Creative Writing from Mills College.   In 2010 I was a Lamba Literary Foundation Emerging Writer Fellow in Fiction.  I have published my poetry and prose in several journals, anthologies, and in online media. I do my best to keep my writing life alive while I teach English at local colleges.   Programs like Tin House are a chance for me to keep progressing as an artist and in my writing career.

If you click on the video above you can see me performing my "signature" spoken word poem, "Apples and Oranges" at Lambda in 2010.

Some more examples of my work can be found online:

www.lizdemigreen.com

As some of you know, I have been working on a YA science fiction novel of political ideas since 2008.   It’s pretty much Little Brother by Cory Doctorow meets Woman on the Edge of Time by Marge Piercy.

The Ella Verse 

www.ellaverse.com

ABOUT TIN HOUSE

Tin House would offer me a precious opportunity to develop my skills as a writer and gain invaluable feedback from luminaries like Aimee Bender and Dorothy Allison.   I’d also be able to form more community with writers from across the country and network with literary agents. From a friend and colleague at De Anza who went last year:  “It was amazing and worth every penny.”

THIS CAMPAIGN

The total cost of the workshop is $1100 (tuition and room and board).   I am prepared to pay for travel expenses.  My adjunct salary is modest.   My debts are challenging.   I hope that you will consider donating.  Every little bit helps!

If you ever have enjoyed my writing in the past, if you have felt it made a contribution to your life by amusing you or moving you or making you think, please consider making a contribution to get me to Tin House this summer.  Or if you just know me and want to help me out, by all means! 

THE PERKS!

If you do decide to donate, you can receive chapbooks of my work and/or a CD and/or a DVD:

Chapbooks*

*also available in pdf form

Flinging Singing Things: Poetry and Short Prose 2010-2011

This Bitter, Accidental Grace: Poetry and Prose 2003-2008

Chapter One of The Ella Verse (also available online)

Chapter Two of The Ella Verse (exclusive!) :)

“The Pursuit”—a short story that is an alternate history of the future in which 9/11 didn’t happen, Gore was elected, and hipsters staged their version of revolution.

The Best of My Geek:  Rants, Raves, Reviews and More.  I wrote for the online magazine Geek Girl on the Street from 2009-2010.  This is a collection of the articles on geek culture (scifi/fantasy/comic book etc.) of which I am most proud. 

CD of my spoken word poetry (both live and studio recorded), “Nectar and Venom”

DVD (and/or script) of my one-woman show Shoot the Moon 

More Than a Name: The Life and Words of Mumia Abu-Jamal (script)

“Airtight Security” one act play (script)

THE BOTTOM LINE

If I don’t reach my goal of $1100, I may still be able to scrape up the money to go, so please remember that every little bit helps.  Indiegogo is particularly awesome in that even if I don’t get every last dollar raised, I will still at least get to be subsidized by my awesome and supportive community—that is, you, and I will still get to share my work with you, which I find equally exciting about this process.

If you can’t contribute at this time, thanks for reading!  If you have a minute, please help me promote this campaign through facebook, twitter, email, or good old-fashioned word of mouth.

story:
*NOTE: I've updated my goal, take a look!

The Gist

Once, We Were Stolen is the contemporary tale of a brother and sister who live with their kidnapper for a year. By spending time before, during and after that year, the reader learns the ways in which the three characters are forever changed, and the ways they remain the same.

As a journalist for the Ottawa Business Journal, as well as previously for the West Carleton Review (with various freelance pieces published in the Metro daily newspaper, the Landowner rural magazine, as well as acting as Dan Gardner's research assistant for his book "Future Babble" published in 2010), I am constantly writing. My real passion, however, lies in creative fiction. I wrote this novel on an Australian beach in Coolangatta, NSW over the span of three months in 2010. I've been editing it (slowly) ever since and am nearly ready to publish.

My plan is to publish it as an e-book, with the hopes of eventually printing hard copies. This Indiegogo campaign will help me to give this book some wings. I believe that my background in journalism, women studies and psychology adds many layers to my story-telling, and I would love to share a copy with you as soon as it's published so you can read it for yourself.

The UPDATED Goal

Now that I've achieved more than my goal, I've revised my plan to include an element that I've always wanted and hoped for but didn't think would be possible: A hard copy; a real hold-it-in-your-hands book. 

The end result of this campaign will be a published e-book, and as many physical copies as I can afford to print. The money will be used to:

  • Hire a graphic designer to help me develop a cover page
  • Help me to develop my website as well as promotional material for the book including business cards and bookmarks
  • Have my document converted into an e-book, potentially hiring an editor as well
  • Print a small amount of hard copies to be sold in local bookstores

Why It's Important

I have been writing ever since I was a little girl. It's the thing I'm best at. I am confident that, with some help, I can produce a book worth reading. I hope to continue publishing in the future, while continuing my career as a journalist. I would be honoured if you helped me on my path to becoming a novelist.

Other Ways You Can Help

I will be updating my website with the link to my e-book for online purchasing when I'm able. Even if you can't contribute, or don't want to purchase the e-book when it's available, tell a friend! Start a debate about whether someone could ever learn to love their captor, and if it gets heated, send them my way.

Contact me with questions at courtney-symons@live.ca, or visit my website-in-progress at www.courtneysymons.com.

Read some of my work as a technology and business reporter for the Ottawa Business Journal.

Also, take a look at one of the pieces I wrote while working as a community reporter.

Stay tuned for updates -- I'll post some super old high school fiction I wrote that doesn't make me squirm (a rarity), as well as excerpts from Once, We Were Stolen.

Please feel free to ask any questions about the writing process, character development, self-publishing or what my favourite book(s) is/are.

story:
Short Summary

My father was in a grave mood when he learnt 10 years ago that I want to be a poet. He knew that it is well-nigh impossible to survive being a poet. However, I was determined to do it and with the grace of God has been able to do it with some means.

About Me

I am a Mechanical Engineer graduate and I have ventured into writing career. This would be my 3rd poetry book in English. I write in open meter and my poems have received encouraging reviews from the readers across the world. 

This book will also contain photos taken by me. So, overall, it will be a coffee-table book.

My Previous Book

I have been fortunate to have many friends who are musicians. They shared their work and I have written poems based on their music. The book named 'Odes to Gitanjali' was received well and whoever read it mentioned that it was unique and uplifted their moods.

What We Need & What You Get

I need the funds to self-publish the book with a reputed publisher and also to market it. With my earlier book, I was limited due to marketing budget though whoever read the book mentioned that it was outstanding.

The Impact

In India, it's is almost next to impossible to write poetry and live. I want to prove the point that if your poetry has the substance, you can still make it.

Once again, inspired by the music of my friends, I am writing poems and will include their names in the book.

In India, it's is almost next to impossible to write poetry and live. I want to prove the point that if your poetry has the substance, you can still make it.
Once again, inspired by the music of my friends, I am writing poems and will include their names in the book.

story:
Passionately in favour of Britain’s membership of the EU, we want to see the UK engaging positively in the EU, and stop damaging Britain’s interests by threatening withdrawal. If Britain does hold a referendum on EU membership Pro Europa will call for a ‘yes’ vote. We are convinced that the benefits of EU membership far outweigh any disadvantages. Inside the EU Britain can be a force for positive change, outside Britain isolates itself.


Aims and objectives

In order to achieve these goals Pro Europa will encourage a wide range of prominent British and non-British figures to speak out about the positive benefits of EU membership and the negative impacts of the UK leaving the EU – and organise 10 meetings in Brussels for them to do so. So far we have had the Chief Operating Officer of the European External Action Service, the Director of Europol and a European Commissioner come to speak to us – but we want to organise more meetings and have even more prominent speakers..


Impact

The pro-European messages and arguments will be shared with pro-European organisations and individuals in the UK through direct contact with our members as well as through our website and social media. The meetings are one important part of a wider effort to grow Pro Europa,as a network and resource – providing information and expert opinion to pro-Europeans in the UK. Pro Europa supports ALL pro-EU bodies and think-tanks in the UK and encourage all pro-Europeans to engage now in the debate about the UK’s membership.


Your support will help to deliver:


  • Rooms for 10 meetings: (4,000 EUR) 
  • Flyers, posters and marketing materials: (1,000 EUR)
  • Production of 10 short event/campaign videos: (5,000 EUR)


Target: 10,000 EUR


Donate now and help secure Britain's future in the EU.

Due to current technical difficulties, if you wish to donate please go to :
http://proeuropa.org.uk/membership-account/membership-levels/

Thank you !

story:
The Opportunity

Hi. My name is Jason Schroeder and  for over two years I've been studying all about the nature of Hell and Final Punishment. Lately, I've been blogging a lot about it and there has been great support and interest from friends, colleagues, and abroad. 

Recently, I was approached by a member of rethinkinghell.com to join their Facebook group because he had found my blog and enjoyed it. Within minutes of joining, another member offered to pay my fee for their upcoming conference if I could make it. I am honoured to have this recognition and endorsement and want to accept the offer..

As far as I know, this conference is unprecedented in the history of the church. The theme is 'Conditional Immortality and the Challenge of Universal Salvation.' It will be held at Fuller Theological Seminary in Pasadena California June 18-20 and include speakers from each of the three major views on hell. 

The goal is to raise $500 CAD to cover the cost of my flight and accommodation. In return, I will be writing blog posts about each plenary session, breakout session, and the conference as a whole. It is an amazing opportunity and I hope you can contribute to help me get there.

The Blog and The Book

As many of you know, I have been blogging a lot about the subject and plan to continue to do so. But what you may not realize is how far reaching my blog actually is. Although my primary readership is from Canada and the USA, in last month I have had readers from the UK, Russia, France, and Mexico as well as occasional hits from Malaysia, Australia, Indonesia, and India. By blogging about the conference many people will have access and feedback they may not otherwise have had.

What I also hope to achieve in attending this conference is to find inspiration, further material, and networking for the book I plan to write and have published on the nature of hell. The working title is 'Hell and Ice Cream: The Current Flavours of the Last Judgement." The theme and tone will be light and disarming to help readers engage the difficult and often controversial subject. My plan is to present the topic and all three views clearly, without rebuttal, and with as little bias as possible. Meeting key thinkers, writers, and speakers on the subject is invaluable in accomplishing my goal of getting this book printed and in your hands.

Your Support and Your Help

Any financial contribution you can make is appreciated, but I can also use help getting the word out. Send emails, tweet, share on facebook, and more.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about this campaign.

story:
A writer?

Jamás me imaginé that I'd ever be here.  As a child I spoke of being a dog catcher, though I couldn't tell you why other than at that point I liked dogs and wanted to save them porque desde que era niño I felt that I wanted to help.  Then at some point I talked of being a doctor.  That I did more out of family pressure than my own desire, though, again, there arose a desire for me to return to the valley someday after years of education to give back for all of the gifts I'd received.  Becoming a writer never crossed my mind. 

 

Beginnings...

Es chistoso, I remember as a child my older sister called me the Lindsay Gazette teasing me that I would run around telling others family business, que era chismoso.  And maybe I was but there were still so many things that remained inside.  I began writing in my 20s as a means of survival.  Había tantisimo adentro and so much inside me and no one around to speak to.  I filled papers with notes and poems written only to myself.  Some were lost.  Some were found.  Some remain.

 

Palabritas

One day I found myself sitting for three hours during a First Communion Ceremony of what felt like hundreds in the South Bronx.  Entre bostezos, I pulled out a piece of scratch paper to write a poem when my friend reprimanded me.  Al rato, she told me of a writers' group she'd been involved with at Mano a Mano.  That was four years ago.  I continue there today.

 

¡VONA!

This is a milestone.  I know that much.  Sé que al final de cuentas I won't be the same.  I've been here before.  When I went away and graduated college.  Cuando me mude desde California a New York.  That same anticipation.  Those same butterflies.  That same uncertainty.   Y el conocimiento que in the end it'll be both good and bad. Agridulce.  And neither.  It'll simply be.  But I know that this is also a part of my journey.  Es algo por lo cual pasaré and something I need to experience. 

I am truly humbled and honored to have been selected.  The selection process for Voices of Nation's Arts (VONA) is extremely rigorous.  Writers of color from all over the US, as well Belgium, Nigeria, Ireland, India, South Korea, Canada applied for 70 spots in various workshops.  To have been chosen to share my writings with Junot Díaz, Pulitzer Prize winner and MacArthur Genius is much more than a dream come true.  I intend to share with Junot a selection of short stories that I would like to fashion into a manuscript for my first short story collection.

Con tu ayuda the journey to this reality will be a bit easier.   The cost of VONA is $1,350, including workshop and room and board due by June 6th (it does not include travel from New York, NY to Berkeley, CA).  I am asking for contributions for this alone. Las cosas están difíciles, I know in this economy things are extremely tough.  Contribute what you can, no amount is insignificant.  Whether it be $5, $10 or $100, all is appreciated!  Any and all funds raised will go toward the cost of VONA I am grateful for your consideration in reading this far (especialmente because of my insistence on writing interlingually, pero asi escribo; my voice is hybrid, weaving p'aca y p'alla).  Any funds exceeding my goal will go towards travel expenses.  I thank you in advance not only for showing your support for me and my work pero tambien al trabajo de VONA in creating safe spaces for writers of color to meet and share their writing.

Thank you!

De veras, I embrace the significance de lo que he logrado.  Estoy muy muy muy agradecido and so extremely grateful to my ancestors and elders without whom I wouldn't be here.  To my friends who have been there with me, from when I was a child until today, te juro y te juro that I truly believe that this accomplishment reflects upon you as well, because without you all, I would not be who I am.  ¡Muchisimas gracias!  L@s adoro so much more than I can ever express!

Now, por favor, pass the word along!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Becka. Ever since I was eight years old, I have had a passion for books and storytelling. And after three decades of writing stories for myself, I finally began sharing my stories with The Dragon Wars Saga.

I started posting Dragon Wars online as a fantasy serial back in January of 2010, posting a new part twice a week. Now, after three years without a single missed update, the archive is large enough that it can be intimidating for new readers.

That's why I decided to release the story arcs as individual ebooks. Last year I ran a campaign to publish the first book and raised enough to release it in May of 2012.

Now, it's time for the second!

What We Need & What You Get

Where will the money go?

  • Proofread: Approx $80
  • Cover: $20 (Already paid. This was a reduced price from the normal $45 as it took the designer longer than usual to turn it around).
  • Hiring the Blurb Doctor: $50
  • Paperback formatting: Approx $80
  • Non-fixed costs such as proof copies and postage.

These are the necessary costs and will be more than covered by $500.

I'd also like to fund proper paperback distribution to online retailers, rather than just selling it through Lulu. That would require a block of ISBNs and distribution fees, adding an additional $300. That's far above my expected goal but hopefully with your help I can reach it!

If I don't reach my target the book will still be produced and all monies will still go towards it but it may take slightly longer due to having to pay some of the costs myself.

What Do You Get?

Perks include:

  • Your name in the book
  • A shoutout on twitter
  • A copy of the book
  • A story about your favourite character
  • And even a chance to name a character in book three!

The Impact

As I mentioned above, I did a campaign last year in March to fund Book One. What I said then still stands today.

  • New readers can read through the story's archive (at least the first two arcs) without clicking through the web pages.
  • Established readers can own a copy of the story they've been following all this time.
  • And last but not least, I won't have to hock the family silver to make a decent book for you. (This is a good thing as I don't have any family silver.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't contribute financially, there are still several things you can do to help!

  • Use the share tools below the video to share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter and G+.
  • Pin the video on Pininterest.
  • Post about it on your blog or other website.
  • Tell your friends.
  • Leave a comment here. Comments help raise the GoGoFactor of the campaign and make it more likely that it'll be featured.

story:
Story of My Book

Titanborn is a hard-science fiction story about an extraterrestrial colony on Saturn’s moon, Titan, automation and AI’s influence on work, and genetically-modified humans. It is also a story about Meera and her dear friend Torvram who feel trapped by their world. When Torvram disappears, Meera leaves the safe yet suffocating walls of their colony to save his life and, as she roams the golden dunes, her life changes forever.

My name is Brian Schutter and I am the author of Titanborn. I grew up on good science fiction and I wrote this book to fulfill a lifelong dream: to write the kind of story that inspired me when I was young. Titanborn was created in the midst of a personal crisis. I was jobless and struggling with trauma, fear, and had just had a business collapse after leaving a degree program with far less than what I’d planned to get out of it. Meera’s journey is, in a way, an attempt to move beyond my past and my fear through her.

I hope, if nothing else, this book helps you find newfound courage to go after what you want next: whether its a dream you’ve had since childhood or something you’ve just discovered. Science fiction instilled a passion in exploration and discovery in me as a child. After being knocked down, I’ve come back to the stories that first inspired me to pick myself back up again and write one of my own. With Titanborn, I want to pass that inspiration to you.

This book explores a number of topics, including:
  • Moving forward in the face of an uncaring world
  • Automation and artificial intelligence, and where humanity might sit alongside the robots and silicon brains of the future
  • The genetic engineering of humans, what these future humans might be able to do and what happens to those who are left behind
  • Survival and isolation on an alien world, and how humans might survive on a frozen, oxygenless moon


If you aren’t a science fiction fan, I hope this book makes you one! That said, you will love this book if you are a fan of speculative sci-fi, especially the works of Masamune Shirow, N.K. Jemisin, or Carl Sagan.
It includes technological and body horror, drawing from Alien, Silent Hill, Neuromancer (William Gibson), and Autonomous (Annalee Newitz).

Titanborn is targeted at adults, but I would put it's minimum age range at 12+. It's the sort of adult-oriented science fiction book I used to sneak into my bedroom in middle school! That said, this is not a book for young children! (See the FAQ for more details on the age range and content warnings!)

The Book - Titanborn

The book is written in three Parts...

In the beginning, Meera is stuck in her home colony of Shangri-La, Titan. She’s worked the same job since fourteen, fixing the brains of robots. Meera was born for this, her genetics carefully designed and her artificial implants all geared towards her place in the Titan colony. Yet she’s miserable, barely able to keep up, and with little to look forward to other than the fight for continued survival. As Meera copes with her troubled life, her close friend and fellow neuroengineer Torvram goes missing.

In the middle, Meera fearfully joins a team of old friends and current enemies, including her ambitious, unempathetic boss Lakshmi and a foul-mouthed man with unaltered genetics and a noticable lack of any cybernetic-implants named Case. This dysfunctional team leaves the warm walls of Shangri-La and travels north, towards the drumbeat of a beacon atop Torvram’s heart.

In the end, Meera must face the mysterious, implacable entity responsible for Torvram’s disappearance. Far from home and further from safety, Meera must stand up to her old boss, challenge the limits of her own abilities, and put the sanctity of her mind at risk to save Torvram from a cold, lonely death, or something even worse.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy & Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in the Spring of 2020
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the first chapters of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Brian Schutter is an author, researcher, and creator of random things in Seattle, Washington.

Brian wrote this book for two reasons: The first was to explore a possible future, and how modern technologies may result in fantastical circumstances for our descendants (if a kid born on Titan from a vat of genetic slurry can trace their lineage back to you someday, that’d be pretty cool) not too far in the future. The second was to explore the process of growing and moving forward in life.

Brian lives with his starry-eyed partner in Seattle, where they spend the days petting as many dogs as physically possible. In his free time, Brian codes small video games and writes a prodigious amount of absolutely unpublishable fanfiction.

For more information you can connect with Brian at brian.c.schutter@gmail.com, @BrianSchutter on Twitter, and @Bernanigan on IG.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #titanborn and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Brian Schutter

As Meera copes with her troubled life, her close friend and fellow neuroengineer Torvram goes missing.In the middle, Meera fearfully joins a team of old friends and current enemies, including her ambitious, unempathetic boss Lakshmi and a foul-mouthed man with unaltered genetics and a noticable lack of any cybernetic-implants named Case. This dysfunctional team leaves the warm walls of Shangri-La and travels north, towards the drumbeat of a beacon atop Torvram’s heart.In the end, Meera must face the mysterious, implacable entity responsible for Torvram’s disappearance. Far from home and further from safety, Meera must stand up to her old boss, challenge the limits of her own abilities, and put the sanctity of her mind at risk to save Torvram from a cold, lonely death, or something even worse.

Brian Schutter is an author, researcher, and creator of random things in Seattle, Washington.Brian wrote this book for two reasons: The first was to explore a possible future, and how modern technologies may result in fantastical circumstances for our descendants (if a kid born on Titan from a vat of genetic slurry can trace their lineage back to you someday, that’d be pretty cool) not too far in the future. In his free time, Brian codes small video games and writes a prodigious amount of absolutely unpublishable fanfiction.For more information you can connect with Brian at brian.c.schutter@gmail.com, @BrianSchutter on Twitter, and @Bernanigan on IG.

story:
Story of my book

I'm Denise Durgin and I'm the author of Empowered Proton Survivors, Overcoming Cancer & Insurance  Denials.

In 2018 I was diagnosed with Stage IIB breast cancer. Through a routine mammogram my main tumor was found. One week later I had an MRI and two more satellite tumors were found by the main tumor that weren't seen on my mammogram.  The span of the three tumors meant I needed to have a mastectomy, and reconstruction surgery. The area was too big to opt for a lumpectomy. Then after surgery, more cancer was found in my lymph node that wasn't detected on the MRI so I needed radiation treatment.

When my doctor told me I needed radiation, I didn't know a thing about it. I thought radiation was just...radiation. It turns out there's different types of radiation. After an initial consult for photon (X-Ray) radiation, my doctor  prescribed proton radiation  as it's a more targeted form of external beam radiation that targets the tumor, treated area and spares healthy tissues, structures and organs (like the heart) in it's path. Unlike X-rays that pass through the body, proton radiation stops at the targeted site so there's less radiation exposure to the body.

And if all of this wasn't stressful enough. I started working through the insurance process with my doctor and this is where my pain became my purpose.

My Radiation Oncologist submitted my prior-authorization, the process for insurance to approve or deny payment for treatment. My insurance company declined payment for my case. My doctor appealed my case and they denied it again. Upon a third try, my doctor submitted a nine page comparative case of medical necessity for my proton treatments to be approved.  My case was overturned and insurance approved it, yet my cancer treatments were delayed as we submitted for approval.

It turns out this process of prior-authorization, denial, appeal, denial, appeal and either approval or a final denial happens to so many patients seeking proton radiation from their doctor's recommendation. Many times as patients we hear, "proton treatment is medically unnecessary"  but then sometimes our cases are overturned and insurance pays for treatment.  And sometimes our cases aren't approved. It's so stressful and unnecessary.  I knew when I was ready I needed to do something to help others.

So, I'm writing this book for three reasons:

  • Educate patients, families and care partners about proton radiation.
  • Help patients advocate for themselves through insurance denials.
  • Help patients with options of what to do if their cancer treatments are denied  by insurance. 

In my book you'll learn and hear from:

  • 16 patient stories, including Head Coach Ron Rivera of The Washington Football Team, plus my own story of how we found out about proton radiation.
  • Many of us patients who fought and appealed to our insurance companies through the support of our physicians and cancer centers.
  • Courageous patient stories who fought pediatric brain cancer, breast, prostate, lymphoma, thymus and other disease types. 
  • 8 Radiation Oncologist physician interviews plus the Chief Medical Officer at Varian, one of the manufacturers of the proton radiation machines.
  • Jason Wolf the CEO of The Beryl Institute and other  leaders in the field of patient experience and proton radiation. 

I'm not a doctor and I'm not prescribing proton radiation. I'm a cancer survivor,  passionate about helping patients, families and care partners.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August of 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

The Impact

Once I'm able to fundraise to pay for publishing, I want to donate proceeds of my book to cancer organizations and initiatives like "With Grace Initiative"  founded by Grace  and her family, a pediatric brain cancer patient who shares her courageous story in my book.  Nikki and the Schindler family fundraise for pediatric cancer. Nikki was treated at Mass General Hospital in Boston.  I want to  make a donation on her behalf to Mass General with the proceeds of my book.  Read Nikki's inspiring and triumphant story of Stage IV brain cancer from Nikki's Dad Jerry, “They told us Nikki had about a 10% chance to live. Proton therapy saved Nikki’s life.” 

 

About the Author

Denise Durgin worked as a Patient and Family Advisor at The Beryl Institute, the Inova Schar Cancer Institute, and The Alliance for Proton Therapy Access. She's become so passionate about helping support and create meaningful patient experiences that focuses on what matters most to each patient. Now she works full time in patient experience as a Patient Experience Performance Advisor.

Before her time in patient experience, she spent 28 years in sales and marketing leadership in the hotel industry at Marriott, The Ritz-Carlton and Host Hotels & Resorts. She also launched her own executive coaching business and three months later she was diagnosed with breast cacner.

Through Denise's career she's demonstrated that she has a soul of being in service to others. She shares this value of wanting to help others as the reason she wrote her book.

Denise earned her master's degree at Georgetown University McDonough School of Business, and her undergraduate degree at UMASS Amherst.  

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish (expected August of 2021) You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ProtonSurvivors and tag me on Twitter @advocate_cancer as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

I want to help other cancer patients.

Thank you so much for of all of your support! 

Denise Durgin

story:
Story of My Book

Hola Miss is a book about how I changed my mind about immigration. It is memoir-esque and tells the story of my experience working with Central American immigrants.

My name is Mellie Napolitano and I am the author of Hola Miss. I wrote this book to start a conversation among political conservatives like me about reframing immigration policy.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be able to put a human face on the topic of immigration and immigration policy. I want you to see this book as a tool to help you question your own beliefs about immigration.

In this book, you'll learn:
  • Why Central Americans immigrate to the U.S.
  • What their lives are like here
  • How current immigration policies hurt Americans and immigrants
  • How seeing immigrants as people first can lead to reform

You will love this book if you are interested in learning about immigration in the U.S., told through the lens of someone who worked with Latino immigrants and later voted for Trump.

Hola Miss is a non-fiction book that speaks to political conservatives and liberals with conservative family members and friends who are looking at Central American immigration and immigration policy for possibly the first time.

 

The Book - Hola Miss

The book is written in 2 Parts....

Part 1 describes how my experience working with immigrants showed me that conservative immigration policies don’t achieve their intended results.

Part 2 is about how to craft immigration policies that recognize the dignity of immigrants while maintaining our borders and strength as a nation.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor that I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish the paperback edition. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

Listed below are the exclusive perks for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and will also get:
  • Your name listed in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • Involvement in selecting my cover
  • An invitation to a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Mellie Napolitano is a Compliance Specialist at the Technical College System of Georgia, which oversees the state’s technical colleges, adult literacy programs, and a host of economic and workforce development programs.

She wrote her book, Hola Miss, to give a human face to the immigration debate by sharing her experience of working with Latino immigrants.

She is a middle child peacemaker, wife, and mom.

For more information you can connect with Mellie at mellienapolitano@gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/mellie-corrigan-nap....

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not able to contribute financially, there are other ways to help me publish Hola Miss:
  • Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #HolaMiss and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press.
  • Share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! I’m excited to experience this journey together.

Thanks again,
Mellie Napolitano

story:
THE OBSIDIAN STAFF

[Watch the video for background on the making of The Obsidian Staff!  There are live-action scenes as well as a sneak movie preview starting at minute 6.19.]

[Artwork by Nathan Hansen]

Harkimer is stirring. A distant and foreboding kingdom tucked away in the Southern Mountains, it is home to the dark wizards, who were banished after their defeat in a war against the other kingdoms of Ilian centuries before.

Now a clever, despotic leader has emerged, one who can end the dark wizards’ exile.  He is the wizard with a rare obsidian staff of unparalleled magic and power.  But even as he plans his attack on the land, he is haunted by a prophecy and will stop at nothing to prevent it from coming true...

​Sixteen-year old Kate Smith would give everything to regain her memories.  Orphaned by a fire and sent to live with her Aunt Millie, a wealthy, eccentric art dealer in the suburbs of London, Kate is determined to unravel clues about her past and the family she lost.  Kate soon discovers she has powers she doesn't understand and can't control.  When she summons a magical flames and ice to protect her best friend from bullies, Kate realizes she needs to learn more about the magic.  But who can teach her? 

When Kate escapes an attack in London, she finds herself transported to a world where her powers are common - the mystical land of Ilian.  She has friends sworn to protect her - men, elves and wizards not joined with the dark wizards of Harkimer.  But her greatest threat comes from Diamantas, the leader of the dark wizards and the possessor of a rare obsidian staff of unequaled power.   Kate is forced to quickly learn the truth about her identity to battle the wizard who hunts her - and to how to master her powers.  For Kate has a secret that terrifies her allies and enemies alike, one more dangerous to the kingdoms of Ilian that Diamantas himself. 

 

HOW I FOUND KATE SMITH

I’m Jaz, author of The Obsidian Staff and the follow-on three books in The Lost Legacy Series!  I’m as devoted to writing as a die-hard Star Wars fan who drives hundreds of miles cross-country to attend a Comic-con convention in a Stormtrooper outfit.

The Obsidian Staff started as an accidental venture in 2012.  I was sitting in my cubicle, lights dimmed, typing a succinct memo, the standard sort that was strictly limited to five, adjective-free bullet points.  I was fully unaware that these cookie-cutter communications could cause irreparable damage to my imaginative story-telling.

Except that Kate decided to intervene.

I was jolted out of my colorless, cubicle world by a character who surfaced from the recesses of my mind.  It was a teenage girl sitting at the edge of a cliff in the moonlight, wistfully contemplating her place in and impact on her world.  Envisioning the girl, I realized she was reaching out before I was beyond creative redemption. 

I started rabidly typing as Kate began to narrate her story to me.

One year later, voila!  The Obsidian Staff was born.

 

HELP RESCUE KATE FROM LITERARY PURGATORY!

If you think blocking magical explosions is hard, you haven’t tried becoming a published author!

Right now, Kate is still trapped between two worlds – the Word document in my five-year old computer and a published book nestled comfortably on a bookstore’s prominent “New Fiction” table. 

How can we rescue Kate from literary purgatory?

With Indiegogo!

With your support, I will pursue three avenues: obtaining an editor, copywriter, and other services necessary to polish the writing; use a publishing company to format the novel to be an eBook (the least-expensive way to offer you, the reader, immediate access to Kate’s story); and then, while offering the eBook, find an agent or agency as passionate about The Obsidian Staff and committed to the long term author-publisher relationship to make all four books in the series a success.

 

THE COST OF PUBLISHING 

According to the Editorial Freelancers Association, the cost for a developmental editor – whose job is to review content and story flow, not proofread for grammar or punctuation – can cost between $40-$60/hour (reading up to 6 manuscript pages/hour).  

I’ve researched the average prices for the basic services needed to publish the book, which are:

  • Editor, substantive or line: 1–6 ms pgs/hr, $40–60/hr, 420 pages: The actual cost of the developmental editor I used: $3.000 USD/read.
  • Editor, basic copyediting: 5-10 ms pgs/hr, $30-40/hr, 420 pages: $1,680 USD
  • Cover artist: $200 USD
  • Formatting (eBook conversion): $149 USD

Minimum total (approximately): $

I initially intended to raise looking to raise a minimum of $6,000 USD.   With your help, we were successful!!  However, the cost of the developmental editor was $3,000 USD.  She was worth every penny, reading through the novel with a fine-toothed comb and greatly enhancing the quality and logic of the material.  As I submit a second read-through, the cost will likely be the same.  This means that I will need more than the initial estimate of $6,000 USD.  For the remaining costs, I need to raise at least an additional $2,000 USD.  If this money can't be raised, I will continue to use my savings and whatever else it takes to make the novel available to you as an eBook and eventually hardcopy!

 

THIS NOVEL IS FOR YOU IF YOU’VE EVER HAD ‘ONE OF THOSE DAYS’…

Have you ever had a day where your boss was critical of a project you worked long weeks and overtime to accomplish?  Have you ever been so nervous about speaking in front of your class that you barely stumbled through your presentation?  Have you felt your personal life was so upside-down no one could possibly understand what you were going through? 

It’s in these moments that you are craving the solace of a good book.  You want to lose yourself in a story with characters like you, ones who are facing their own hardships, insecurities, and self-doubt but have to still find a way to move forward.

 

THERE ARE NO SUPERHEROES OR SUPER-VILLAINS (MOSTLY)

The Obsidian Staff offers heroes and villains both who are satisfyingly complex in their personal struggles and triumphs.

Kate’s protector, Hayden, is a resolute hunter who is burdened by a sorrowful past.  Her childhood companion Talis isn’t the stereotypical stoic and flawless elf but loves banter and shows imperfections of his own.  You can’t help but delight equally in the villains, such as the charming but ruthless bandit leader Kegg; or sympathize with Diamantas’s ally, the dark but hapless wizard Janus, who can’t seem to get a spell right.

If you’re like me, you’ve already read the latest fantasy fiction and are craving more.  By supporting The Obsidian Staff, you are taking action to end your suffering from fantasy fiction withdrawal and are bringing new novels to your fingertips!

 

TIMELINE

I plan to have The Obsidian Staff as an eBook in 2017.  Once this first novel is published, I hope to find a publisher who can take the electronic novel and make it accessible as a hard copy in bookstores everywhere.  I plan to have the sequel, The Dragon’s Eye published as an eBook and then again put in stores soon thereafter.  The third book in the series will beThe Seventh Talisman, and the fourth and final book will be The Lost Legacy.

 

GIFTS FOR YOU! WHAT’S ON YOUR WISH LIST?

The perks are tokens of gratitude you will receive for your generous contributions to The Obsidian Staff!  But I want to know what you enjoy!  Send me your “wish list” of perks you would want to see on this site at TheLostLegacySeries@yahoo.com.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can have as much of an impact by sharing this campaign, the video (also on YouTube) and The Lost Legacy Series website with your friends and family. 

Thank you for your enthusiasm and support!

THE OBSIDIAN STAFF
[Watch the video for background on the making of The Obsidian Staff!  There are live-action scenes as well as a sneak movie preview starting at minute 6.19.]

[Artwork by Nathan Hansen]
Harkimer is stirring. A distant and foreboding kingdom tucked away in the Southern Mountains, it is home to the dark wizards, who were banished after their defeat in a war against the other kingdoms of Ilian centuries before.
Now a clever, despotic leader has emerged, one who can end the dark wizards’ exile.  He is the wizard with a rare obsidian staff of unparalleled magic and power.  But even as he plans his attack on the land, he is haunted by a prophecy and will stop at nothing to prevent it from coming true...

​Sixteen-year old Kate Smith would give everything to regain her memories.  Orphaned by a fire and sent to live with her Aunt Millie, a wealthy, eccentric art dealer in the suburbs of London, Kate is determined to unravel clues about her past and the family she lost.  Kate soon discovers she has powers she doesn't understand and can't control.  When she summons a magical flames and ice to protect her best friend from bullies, Kate realizes she needs to learn more about the magic.  But who can teach her? 
When Kate escapes an attack in London, she finds herself transported to a world where her powers are common - the mystical land of Ilian.  She has friends sworn to protect her - men, elves and wizards not joined with the dark wizards of Harkimer.  But her greatest threat comes from Diamantas, the leader of the dark wizards and the possessor of a rare obsidian staff of unequaled power.   Kate is forced to quickly learn the truth about her identity to battle the wizard who hunts her - and to how to master her powers.  For Kate has a secret that terrifies her allies and enemies alike, one more dangerous to the kingdoms of Ilian that Diamantas himself. 

 
HOW I FOUND KATE SMITH

I’m Jaz, author of The Obsidian Staff and the follow-on three books in The Lost Legacy Series!  I’m as devoted to writing as a die-hard Star Wars fan who drives hundreds of miles cross-country to attend a Comic-con convention in a Stormtrooper outfit.

The Obsidian Staff started as an accidental venture in 2012.  I was sitting in my cubicle, lights dimmed, typing a succinct memo, the standard sort that was strictly limited to five, adjective-free bullet points.  I was fully unaware that these cookie-cutter communications could cause irreparable damage to my imaginative story-telling.
Except that Kate decided to intervene.
I was jolted out of my colorless, cubicle world by a character who surfaced from the recesses of my mind.  It was a teenage girl sitting at the edge of a cliff in the moonlight, wistfully contemplating her place in and impact on her world.  Envisioning the girl, I realized she was reaching out before I was beyond creative redemption. 
I started rabidly typing as Kate began to narrate her story to me.
One year later, voila!  The Obsidian Staff was born.

If you think blocking magical explosions is hard, you haven’t tried becoming a published author!
Right now, Kate is still trapped between two worlds – the Word document in my five-year old computer and a published book nestled comfortably on a bookstore’s prominent “New Fiction” table. 
How can we rescue Kate from literary purgatory?

With Indiegogo!

we are the Trench Mouth Medicine Show, two hardworking and extremely broke poets from the San Francisco Bay Area. we're gearing up for our first tour, and we need some help to get going. the Trenchmobile is old and needs some tune-ups, and printing books and such is expensive.

story:
Our campaign ends at 9pm on Saturday 12th of September, so don't miss out! 

About TransBareAll - 10 Years, Still Here:

 

Against the roar of destructive noise, the minds behind TransBareAll decided to mark ten years of work by speaking for themselves, on their own terms, at a time when trans voices are rarely allowed to be heard. 

 

This book is a collective endeavour of words and artwork. The contributors within followed the path dug by the few trans writers who are now starting to get some recognition, and took inspiration from the knowledge that within the trans community there is a huge wellspring of talent, knowledge and experience. The result is something quite extraordinary.

 

Within these pages you will find faith, and passion, and struggle. You will find anger and you will find laughter. You will find strategies for surviving a racist misogynist world. Strategies for navigating parenthood. You will find sex (because this is not a children’s book) and reckoning. You will find mountains and moorland, a cigarette scraped across the wall of a pub and a size 9 stiletto. You will find pieces of Lego that make sense of the world and a haircut at the best barbershop in London. Most importantly, you will find a range of experiences and a wealth of trans voices, each different, speaking loud, and proud, and together.

 

Who is TransBareAll?

TransBareAll is a trans led, volunteer-run organisation that works with trans people to explore feelings around bodies, sexual health and intimacy. 

In that time, the organisation has grown from two friends wanting to share their experiences to a steadily growing management team organising 3 - 4 residential events each year in the UK. 

TBA has thrived over the last ten years. We felt we needed to mark this milestone in a way that raises our voices, representing the diversity within our community and our stories.

 

Our writers and artists have created an incredible book - and now we need your help:

 

The good news is that the book is ready to print! We have managed to secure some funding towards our production costs but we still need to raise another £5100 to make this happen.

We have a variety of tiers and rewards for donations, and we appreciate every donation made to help bring this book out into the world. 

Any additional funds raised will go towards our ongoing commitment to strengthening our inclusion of People of Colour at TBA events.

_________________________________

More About Rewards

 

Digital Thanks

We'll send you a digital Thank You from the team to thank you for your support.

Thank You and Sticker Set

We'll send you a Thank You Postcard and a Set of 3 Stickers using artwork from the book

10th Anniversary Set

Along with a Thank You Postcard and Sticker Set, you'll also get a limited edition TBA 10th Anniversary Pin and a 10 Years, Still Here Bookmark

Transbareall - 10 Years, Still Here Ebook and Digital Thanks

Want to keep it all online? We'll send you a digital Thank You and a copy of the 10 Years, Still Here on ebook.

Copy of the Book: Transbareall - 10 Years, Still Here

Along with the 10th Anniversary Set, Stickers and a Thank You postcard, you'll also get a physical copy of the book.

Your Name in the Book

Want to show your support in the Thank You pages of Transbareall - 10 Years, Still Here? With this reward your name will be listed in the Thank You pages of our book, you'll also get a copy of the book, the 10 Year Anniversary Set, Stickers and a Thank You Postcard.

Please Note: If the name you use on Indiegogo is different to the name you want listed in the book, please contact us by midnight on 12th September 2020 either through the campaign or by emailing contact@transbareall.co.uk

Unbound Print of Proof

LIMITED! ONLY 1 AVAILABLE!

You'll receive a signed,  limited edition proof copy of the book, before it goes to its final print. This will be an  unbound copy, allowing you to frame pages if you wish. Alongside this, you will also receive a 10 Year Anniversary Set, Stickers and a Thank You Postcard.

*SOLD OUT* Bound Print of Proof

SOLD OUT!

You'll receive a signed,  limited edition proof copy of the book, before it goes to its final print. This will be a bound copy and will look like the final book but with notes inside. Alongside this, you will also receive a 10 Year Anniversary Set, Stickers and a Thank You Postcard.

Queer Resistance Print & Book

LIMITED! ONLY 40 AVAILABLE!

You’ll receive an a4 print of Queer Resistance by one of our artists in the book, Apu. You will also recieve the 10 Year Anniversary Set and a copy of the book. Click here to see a bigger version of the artwork.

And Through It All Print & Book

LIMITED! ONLY 40 AVAILABLE!

You’ll receive an a4 print of And Through It All by one of our artists in the book, Simon Williamson. You will also receive the 10 Year Anniversary Set and a copy of the book. Click here to see a bigger version of the artwork.

Moor Man Print & Book

LIMITED! ONLY 40 AVAILABLE!


You’ll receive an a4 print of Moor Man by one of our artists in the book, Louis Bailey. You will also recieve the 10 Year Anniversary Set and a copy of the book. Click here to see a bigger version of the artwork.

Tree Dreaming Print & Book

LIMITED! ONLY 40 AVAILABLE!

You’ll receive an a4 print of Tree Dreaming by one of our artists in the book, Connor Rose. You will also receive the 10 Year Anniversary Set and a copy of the book. Click here to see a bigger version of the artwork.

Creative Workshop & Book

LIMITED! ONLY 3 AVAILABLE

As well as your copy of the book, you'll get a one-on-one creative workshop with writer and editor Michelle Green, who will work with you to develop your poetry, fiction, life writing or spoken word. The two-hour session will take place on Zoom, and will be tailored to your experience level, be it beginner or seasoned writer. See Michelle's work at www.michellegreen.co.uk.

Events Package

LIMITED! ONLY 3 AVAILABLE!

“SPEAK THE TRUTH EVEN IF YOUR VOICE SHAKES” 

A bespoke two-hour creative workshop (hosted on Zoom) for up to 12 people, plus each participant will receive a 10 Year Anniversary Set and £10 voucher towards the book.

Workshop description: There is truth, there is fact, there is fiction - and between them the whole world lives. Join us for a creative writing workshop that explores the spaces between. Writer and editor Michelle Green will tailor the workshop to the particular focus of your team or group, guiding participants through a creative exploration that will inspire reflection, imagination, and accessible collaboration. The workshop is suitable for people at all stages of writing experience and is open to all forms of writing i.e. life writing, fiction, poetry, hybrid forms etc.

Michelle has 17 years of experience designing and leading award-winning creative work with groups across a wide range of sectors, including education, palliative care, and mental health care, with a speciality in working with LGBTQ, disabled, low-income and mixed-literacy groups.

For more details, contact us at contact@transbareall.co.uk. See Michelle's work at www.michellegreen.co.uk
