story:
*** Update, 9th July 2012 ***

We've now made it possible to pre-order a copy of the book through the Dark Mountain shop on our own website. Please click on this link if you want to reserve a copy.
 

*** Update, 1st July 2012 ***

We did it! Thanks to a wave of generous support, we've exceeded our funding target for book three! Thanks so much to everyone who helped us over the line, by pre-ordering a book or spreading the word or in any other way. 

The book will be posted out to those who have pre-ordered a copy in early August. In the meantime, if you want to pre-order a copy, you can still do so here even though the deadline has passed. Soon we'll transfer this facility to our online shop - we'll update you here when we do that. 

Thank you again!

The DM team

***

The Story

We are Paul Kingsnorth, Dougald Hine and Adrienne Odasso, editors of the third Dark Mountain book.

Over the last two years, with the generous support of many people around the world, we've been able to raise the publishing costs of our first two books by pre-selling copies through this site. Now we're aiming to do the same for Dark Mountain: Book 3.

Three years after the Dark Mountain project began life, our work seems more relevant than ever. As economies crumble and nature rebels, our call for the 'uncivilising' of writing, art and culture, and our search for better stories to help us navigate unfolding realities, have taken on, it seems to us, a more urgent note. 

So we're very excited about this book. Like its two predecessors it will be a beautifully designed hardback, with a specially-commissioned cover and several dozen colour plates, typeset by our artisan friends at Bracketpress and printed on ecologically responsible materials. It will contain our trademark mix of essays, poems, stories, flash fiction, photography, art and the entirely indefinable, all intended to shake up the stories of our civilisation and make space for new stories to emerge. 

The Book

Highlights of the book's contents include:

  • James Hester on the Three Lessons of History;
  • Conversations with Dmitri Orlov, Doug and Kris Tompkins and Sajay Samuel; 
  • New fiction from Margaret Irish, Nick Hunt, Chris TT, David Kernohan and Gregory Norminton;
  • Caspar Henderson on our barely imagined prehistory;
  • Andrew Taggart takes apart Descartes in the latest in our 'myths of civilisation' series;
  • Bridget McKenzie explores orchards and Phil Brachi searches for faeries;
  • New poetry from Em Strang, George Roberts, Roselle Angwin, Eleanor Rees and many others;
  • Plus: photo essays, stained glass, paintings, illuminated poetry and a unique, specially-commissioned cover.

What We Need & What You Get

As with our previous two books, we are working with Christian Brett at Bracketpress to design and publish the book. To cover his work, the printing costs and the cost of the editorial team, we are looking to raise $9,800 (around £6,100) through pre-orders between now and the end of June.

This is not a call for donations - everyone who contributes will get a copy of the book as soon as it's published. For $30, we'll send a copy to you, wherever you are in the world. For $60, we'll also add your name to the 'roll of honour' in the back of the book, if you'd like us to. And anyone who can pledge $150 will get a copy of the book, their name in the roll of honour and a limited edition print of the cover, signed by the artist, Mattias Jones.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're grateful for any help you can give us in spreading the word about the book.

Here are some suggestions, in case they are relevant:

  • post a link to this page on your Facebook or Twitter;
  • write a post about Dark Mountain on your blog;
  • give us a mention in your organisation's newsletter.

We are also available for interviews about the book and the project. You can contact us (about that or anything else) by posting a message here, or by emailing info AT dark-mountain DOT net.

If you want to find out more about what the Project is up to, take a look at our new website. 

What people have said about Dark Mountain

‘The Dark Mountain project tells us the things we don’t want to hear, and it is a no-nonsense Zen-like response to the ‘age of ecocide’ that our civilisation is causing.’ - Huffington Post

'The dystopian take on the environmental movement provided by Dark Mountain's second anthology, is a wonderful, if disturbing, read.' - The Ecologist

'The stimulus of Dark Mountain transports many of us into a deeper paradigm of seeing and being’ - Alastair McIntosh, author of 'Soil and Soul.'

‘The Dark Mountain Project, whose ideas are spreading rapidly through the environment movement, is worth examining.’  George Monbiot, The Guardian

‘It’s time.’ – Naomi Klein, author of ‘The Shock Doctrine.’

‘A root-and-branch challenge to the foundations of a culture of consumption.’ - Boyd Tonkin, The Independent

'Much in contemporary thought is made up of myths masquerading as facts, and it is refreshing to see these myths clearly identified as such.' - John Gray, reviewing the Dark Mountain manifesto in the New Statesman

'Dark Mountain asks us to question the fundamental assumptions of our everyday life.' - Irish Times

'Usually we must go to the mountain; very occasionally, the Mountain comes to us.  Dark Mountain is perambulant towards public (un)consciousness.  In the terrain of ecological ideas and challenge, she might turn up just about anywhere.' - Mario Petrucci, award-winning poet

‘There are aspects of the Dark Mountain manifesto I cannot support. And that is precisely why it is a brilliant manifesto: it is provocative, difficult, troubling, and uneasy, and I salute the spirit of it wholeheartedly, in its untameness, its wilful, searching fury.’  Jay Griffiths, author of ‘Wild’
story_txt:
*** Update, 9th July 2012 ***
We've now made it possible to pre-order a copy of the book through the Dark Mountain shop on our own website. Please click on this link if you want to reserve a copy.
 
*** Update, 1st July 2012 ***
We did it! Thanks to a wave of generous support, we've exceeded our funding target for book three! Thanks so much to everyone who helped us over the line, by pre-ordering a book or spreading the word or in any other way. 
The book will be posted out to those who have pre-ordered a copy in early August. In the meantime, if you want to pre-order a copy, you can still do so here even though the deadline has passed. Soon we'll transfer this facility to our online shop - we'll update you here when we do that. 
Thank you again!
The DM team
***
The Story
We are Paul Kingsnorth, Dougald Hine and Adrienne Odasso, editors of the third Dark Mountain book.
Over the last two years, with the generous support of many people around the world, we've been able to raise the publishing costs of our first two books by pre-selling copies through this site. Now we're aiming to do the same for Dark Mountain: Book 3.
Three years after the Dark Mountain project began life, our work seems more relevant than ever. As economies crumble and nature rebels, our call for the 'uncivilising' of writing, art and culture, and our search for better stories to help us navigate unfolding realities, have taken on, it seems to us, a more urgent note. 
So we're very excited about this book. Like its two predecessors it will be a beautifully designed hardback, with a specially-commissioned cover and several dozen colour plates, typeset by our artisan friends at Bracketpress and printed on ecologically responsible materials. It will contain our trademark mix of essays, poems, stories, flash fiction, photography, art and the entirely indefinable, all intended to shake up the stories of our civilisation and make space for new stories to emerge. 


The Book
Highlights of the book's contents include:

James Hester on the Three Lessons of History;
Conversations with Dmitri Orlov, Doug and Kris Tompkins and Sajay Samuel; 
New fiction from Margaret Irish, Nick Hunt, Chris TT, David Kernohan and Gregory Norminton;
Caspar Henderson on our barely imagined prehistory;
Andrew Taggart takes apart Descartes in the latest in our 'myths of civilisation' series;
Bridget McKenzie explores orchards and Phil Brachi searches for faeries;
New poetry from Em Strang, George Roberts, Roselle Angwin, Eleanor Rees and many others;
Plus: photo essays, stained glass, paintings, illuminated poetry and a unique, specially-commissioned cover.



What We Need & What You Get
As with our previous two books, we are working with Christian Brett at Bracketpress to design and publish the book. To cover his work, the printing costs and the cost of the editorial team, we are looking to raise $9,800 (around £6,100) through pre-orders between now and the end of June.
This is not a call for donations - everyone who contributes will get a copy of the book as soon as it's published. For $30, we'll send a copy to you, wherever you are in the world. For $60, we'll also add your name to the 'roll of honour' in the back of the book, if you'd like us to. And anyone who can pledge $150 will get a copy of the book, their name in the roll of honour and a limited edition print of the cover, signed by the artist, Mattias Jones.


Other Ways You Can Help
We're grateful for any help you can give us in spreading the word about the book.
Here are some suggestions, in case they are relevant:

post a link to this page on your Facebook or Twitter;
write a post about Dark Mountain on your blog;
give us a mention in your organisation's newsletter.

We are also available for interviews about the book and the project. You can contact us (about that or anything else) by posting a message here, or by emailing info AT dark-mountain DOT net.
If you want to find out more about what the Project is up to, take a look at our new website. 
What people have said about Dark Mountain
‘The Dark Mountain project tells us the things we don’t want to hear, and it is a no-nonsense Zen-like response to the ‘age of ecocide’ that our civilisation is causing.’ - Huffington Post

'The dystopian take on the environmental movement provided by Dark Mountain's second anthology, is a wonderful, if disturbing, read.' - The Ecologist

'The stimulus of Dark Mountain transports many of us into a deeper paradigm of seeing and being’ - Alastair McIntosh, author of 'Soil and Soul.'
‘The Dark Mountain Project, whose ideas are spreading rapidly through the environment movement, is worth examining.’  George Monbiot, The Guardian
‘It’s time.’ – Naomi Klein, author of ‘The Shock Doctrine.’
‘A root-and-branch challenge to the foundations of a culture of consumption.’ - Boyd Tonkin, The Independent
'Much in contemporary thought is made up of myths masquerading as facts, and it is refreshing to see these myths clearly identified as such.' - John Gray, reviewing the Dark Mountain manifesto in the New Statesman
'Dark Mountain asks us to question the fundamental assumptions of our everyday life.' - Irish Times
'Usually we must go to the mountain; very occasionally, the Mountain comes to us.  Dark Mountain is perambulant towards public (un)consciousness.  In the terrain of ecological ideas and challenge, she might turn up just about anywhere.' - Mario Petrucci, award-winning poet

And that is precisely why it is a brilliant manifesto: it is provocative, difficult, troubling, and uneasy, and I salute the spirit of it wholeheartedly, in its untameness, its wilful, searching fury.’  Jay Griffiths, author of ‘Wild’

story:
My Story

So a little about me! I began my self-publishing journey in October of 2016. My first self-published book is titled "A Beautiful, Wonderful Me", which is a positive affirmation poem book for young girls. That book was the stepping stone towards my other published books. I have then gone on to self-publish 4 other books that aim to transform the minds of our youth. 

I strongly believe that words have power and it is my goal to inspire and transform minds with each book I create. In a world full of negativity, I aim to inspire self-love, creativity, & positivity. This movement is so important to me that I created my own business around it called A Beautiful, Wonderful Me (ABWM). ABWM creates products and content that will inspire, motivate, and ignite the next generation.

 I hope you can assist me by helping me bring this book project to life!

What I Need 

Self-publishing is no cheap task! I am aiming to raise $750 for this project. This will cover fees for the graphic designer, book creation software, and book printing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate financially, that's ok! Share this project with family & friends! I appreciate your support! Interested in checking out my other books? Check out my website! www.abeautifulwonderfulme.com

story:
Story of My Book

Hi everybody! I wrote a book! That is not a sentence I ever thought I would type out. Your support will help me turn my book into an actual reality over the next several months. 

My name is Morgan Edwards and I am the author of An Outlier's Tribe: Growing Up Torn Between Trump's Appalachia and the Liberal Coast. An Outlier's Tribe is centered around my experience growing up in Appalachia as a progressive outlier and my reflections and commentary on this dynamic. I wrote this book because I wanted to grapple with my experiences growing up in a region where I often felt out of place. The further I am physically and temporarily removed from the place in which I grew up, the more I anticipate feeling disconnected — unable to meaningfully grapple with that era of my life. Further, in currently attending a school that represents the antithesis of home, I look back from a unique vantage point on the first 18 years of my life spent in Appalachia.
Combining research and personal anecdotes, I shed light on the widely misunderstood Appalachian region and polarized state of this country as a whole. My hope is that my own personal introspection may spur you to self-reflect, critically think about your own upbringing, and consider the current political moment.
In this book, I’ll touch on what it was like to grow up in two differing environments, particularly as a progressive outlier within deeply conservative Appalachia. Some stories include:

  • Discussion of coal’s importance in the region
  • My mom’s tales from her time on city council
  • Organizing a school walkout to protest gun violence

Whether you are an outsider in some way — perhaps politically, socially, or culturally, are concerned about increasing political divisions in this country, or are simply interested in learning more about Appalachia, I hope you will be able to find value in the book.

The Book - An Outlier's Tribe

The book is written from three frames of thought:
  • I am writing about a region that is oft-misunderstood and forgotten about
  • I, myself, often struggled to understand Appalachia as an outlier in the region
  • I am now writing from the perspective of one who attends an institution that represents the complete opposite of Appalachia

It contains 5 parts:

  • Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters that lay the groundwork of the region and where my family fits in.
  • Part 2 sets up the dynamic of being an outlier & how it manifested in my daily life.
  • Part 3 grapples with the implications of growing up in the region as an outlier, especially now from from the vantage point of a college student.
  • Part 4 contains reflections and commentary on some of the issues facing the region.
  • Part 5 is an epilogue with final reflections.

How Your Funding Helps & What You'll Get

Your support will allow me to fund the publishing costs that will turn my book into a physical reality. The book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer 2020

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish! When I pre-sell 150 copies, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

Built into my campaign are the mailing and shipping costs of signed copies within each pre-order tier. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date for your signed copy. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone in the publishing process. You will know when your pre-ordered copies are expected to ship.

About the Author

Morgan Edwards is a student-athlete at Bowdoin College where he is a member of the varsity basketball team, sketch comedy group, and Bowdoin Public Service Initiative, among other clubs and organizations. He was a 2018 Maryland delegate to the United States Senate Youth Program, hosted a political podcast on several major streaming platforms, and spent a summer working on peace building and reconciliation in Belfast, Northern Ireland.

Morgan wrote this book because “why the hell not!” He realized that he’d always be busy and there would never truly be a good time to write a book, so the time was now. He wanted to use the book as a way to meaningfully consider his upbringing and the place that shaped him.

When he’s not writing, Morgan can be found on the basketball court, doing a Bernie Sanders impression, or planning a trip to check places off his bucket list.

For more information you can connect with Morgan at medward2@bowdoin.edu and 

LinkedIn. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my crowdfunding campaign, there are other ways to help:

I would very much appreciate if you could share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #outlierstribe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts. You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

If you can, please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Sharing as a text message or direct message on social media is much appreciated!

Writing a book is an incredibly daunting task, especially at the age of 20. Thanks for all your support during this process and I can’t wait to get you your copy! 

Thanks again,
Morgan

story:
Project Summary

The research and creation of my first book “Sky Pilot of the Great Lakes” took over 4 years from inception to publication. Along the way I learned many things about the researching and publication process. The biggest lesson I learned is that while there is a wealth of archival information out there to be researched, access to these archives is neither simple nor free endeavor.  When researching a single subject or event with the goal of telling a complete story I had to comb through archival documents scattered around the world in the hopes of finding even the smallest bit of information that would help fill in the gaps of the overall story.

While the effort to digitize and create searchable indexes of these documents in recent decades has helped researchers immensely, the vast majority of documents remain in their original form or on microfiche in a file cabinet at some library or museum. Access to these files requires a personal visit during established hours or paying fees to have the staff find what you need for you. In the event they do find something there are even more fees to make copies and ship them to you. Even some of the largest online resources are not accessible without purchasing a subscription.

A conservative estimate of the cost associated with the research of Sky Pilot of the Great Lakes is approximately $5000. This included subscriptions, fees associated with research at various libraries and collections throughout the United States & Canada and travel costs to collections where there was no other option but to appear in person.  Since I didn’t have $5000 up-front to use for this research, expenditures had to be budgeted over time which in turn lengthened the time to actually write and bring the book to publication.

What I’m Asking & What You Get In Return

I am currently working on three follow-up books, 2 non-fiction historical books like Sky Pilot of the Great Lakes and a semi-fictional book of humorous short stories based on travels around the state of Michigan. One of the historical books will be a biography of Capt. Albert Ocha, one of the most-celebrated men in the United States Life-Saving Service. The second will be a companion book to Sky Pilot of the Great Lakes that will (hopefully) feature transcriptions of every yearly book that Rev. William H. Law mailed to every Lighthouse and Life-Saving station in the United States from 1900 to 1928.

While I have the drive and passion to complete these books, once again the costs associated with research are determining the length of time required to complete the stories for publication. So I decided to try my hand at some crowdfunding the project to attempt to inject some capital into the project, thus shortening the timeline.

This is where you can help.  By helping to fund my project  you can help expedite my ability to access these historical archives which will allow me to tell a more complete and robust story.  Just as every little bit of information comes together to tell a complete story, every dollar contributed by a single person to this campaign can help to progress the research to find those little pieces of information.

In return for contributions I am offering a few perks in the sidebar right over there ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------->

Please note that any perks related to future publications do not have a guaranteed publication date as they are dependent upon the research you are helping to fund as well as the length of time for the publication process.

Why History Matters

My goal with these projects is to piece together the fragmented stories of the people, places and deeds of those who came before us. It is my hope that my effort in bringing these stories to the public will inspire and teach future generations about who we were on our way to becoming who we are, and possibly help shape who we become along the way. 

By documenting these stories there is also the possibility that a reader may become inspired enough to help preserve some of the remaining historical locations such as the lighthouses and the few remaining Life-Saving Stations that dot our shores. There are many organizations dedicated to preserving these pieces of history and making them available to the public. There’s also an economical aspect to our historical heritage.

There’s a possibility that if the story is compelling enough a reader may travel to these historical locations to stand where the subjects of these stories once stood, the by-product of this being an economical boost, no matter how slight, to the local economies.

Risks & Challenges

As with any project there are known risks and challenges. Some of the challenges for this project include:

  • There is no set date or cost to the research. I will be researching until all sources of information have dried up and/or I have uncovered enough information to do the story justice.
  • While I have a publisher for my current book, there is no guarantee that I will be able to secure a publisher for these projects. However there is always the option of self-publishing them.
  • I am setting the goal for this campaign lower than the anticipated costs in an attempt to set a goal that I believe can be met. Any costs accrued beyond the funds received in this campaign will again have to be budgeted over time as stated earlier, thus lengthening the time to print.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and this is ok. But that doesn't mean they can't help. Here’s what you can do to help:

  • Help me spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link to people you know via email, Facebook, Twitter and any other social media you may use.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.

story:
Language learning starts early

I'm Anu Anand, a BBC and Guardian journalist currently based in New Delhi with two young children. Ever since my son was born six years ago, I've been determined to teach him Hindi, in which I'm fluent. But I soon realized that even living in India, he wasn't going to pick it up unless he heard it constantly. I'm sure as a parent, this is a familiar scene: it's bedtime, your child is clean and in their pajamas; a hectic day is coming to an end. You desperately want to read him or her a story in Hindi, either by making it up, or translating an existing favorite English title. But by the time you sit down, ticking over all the chores waiting for you, you can barely keep your eyes open.

Wouldn't it be such a gift to find simple, original, beautifully produced books suitable for toddlers in English and Hindi: with lines in Devanagri for those parents who can read Hindi and in 'Roman' for those who only understand spoken Hindi? What if these books had beautiful and imaginative hand-made illustrations that were a joy for you to savor, as much as for your child?

A tiny dose of beautiful India at bedtime, no matter where you might be...!

Maybe you've looked for these books, but can only find bilingual titles in French, German, Spanish, and the odd one in Chinese? Or if you've picked up a few books while in India, they're either too complex for babies and toddlers, or badly produced?

They say babies begin to discern languages when they're only a few months old. What better intellectual gift can you give a child than his/her native language right from the start?

What I Need & What You Get

I've already produced the first book, 'Meri Bindi' or 'My Bindi'. A bindi, of course, is that iconic Indian symbol of adornment worn on the forehead. Everyone loves bindis, and in this book, young readers can follow along as the bindis turn up in enchanted places!

The illustrations, created by Lavanya Karthik in Mumbai, are sumptuous, detailed, whimsical and charming! You've got to see the way they pop off the page - computer screens don't really do them justice. Each detail on each page, from the boy's curls to the tiny dots on the ladybug's back are individual pieces of paper, torn or cut to size by hand!

I've also got a highly reputable children's publisher interested in distributing the book and in creating a series called 'Meri Duniya' (My World). However, because it is an untested market, I have to pay for the first print run of a thousand books. My aim is to start a new movement in bilingual children's literature. Wouldn't it be wonderful to see books in Indian languages from Assamese to Urdu and every wonderful language in between? Imagine being able to share your love of Punjabi, or Bengali, even if you're raising your child in Arizona or Birmingham? 

  • All donations fund the first, high-quality print run of Meri Bindi. I personally get no money, just the satisfaction of seeing these books in print finally.
  • Donations of $8 or more get a free, signed copy and a packet of bindis!
  • Donations of $30 also get an artwork print from the book
  • Donations of $100 also get you an acknowledgment in the next volume

That's it! This book is 20 pages (including two pages of easy Hindi vocabulary with pictures). With your help, children all over the world will be able to cuddle up with  a beautifully produced book in a language spoken by at least 1.2 billion people. I'd also like to develop a YouTube channel with original content, as well as expand to other Indian languages... and who knows, if all goes well, the next step will be Hindi/Spanish books. ¡Qué ilusión!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but want to help:

  • Spread the word to interested parents.
  • Read to your own baby/child in Hindi (and other native languages).
  • Have a 'Hindi only' day at home, once a week.
  • Make a YouTube playlist of favorite Hindi kids songs to play for your child.
  • Have a Hindi play date with other children, with songs and stories.

Ever since my son was born six years ago, I've been determined to teach him Hindi, in which I'm fluent. story:
Newsnet is the oldest independence supporting news site. Since we first launched in March 2010 there has been a growing number of independence-supporting websites. They are our companions, not our competitors. The competition is the unionist owned, foreign owned media.

Newsnet is moving and relaunching

Now is the time, in the lead up to indyref2, for a new phase in our development .  

After publishing over 10,000 articles and engaging with so many readers, the database is massive and cumbersome with over 250,000 comments and 10,000 readers logged to post comments. The sheer scale of the database means a major clean up is required before the new site goes live. Newsnet is not a simple blog.

With our increased capacity to make more use of images and graphics in stories, mirroring major online news development, the amount of data stored will only increase. It’s organisation needs to be more sophisticated so the editorial team can quickly locate images held on file.

We now need our own dedicated server, upgraded software packages, to resolve issues with out-dated plug-ins and essential coding written for the new site. The present site will continue until the launch of the new site.

The entire contents of the present site will move to an offline server while the new site is constructed and tested.  

Who am I 

I have been writing on politics and the economy for Newsnet for the last 7 years and in recent months I have become the face behind the Newsnet Newsroom - sourcing writers, writing, editing and producing images and graphics. I have a background in advertising, PR,  graphics, publishing, print and event management. For 8 years I was a board member of Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park Authority. The first among five members, ever elected to a public board.

The editorial prospectus

I will continue to bring you news and analysis not to be found in the MSM. Newsnet is not just about providing news to independence supporters but also aims to reach out to those who did not vote Yes in 2014. We want to engage with, and help readers engage with our fellow citizens, encouraging them to join us in building a better Scotland - a Scotland free from the antiquity of Westminster, austerity free, outward looking, working with our European neighbours and those further afield, willing to learn from their experiences, sharing aspirations and involved in cross-border collaboration.

In the run-up to 2014 National Collective brought together artists, poets, writers and musicians to provide months of inspirational events to highlight Scotland’s diverse culture and keep our spirits buoyant. I would like Newsnet to become something of a News Collective - a space where the growing army of independence bloggers could share an occasional article, adding diversity of opinions for our mutual advantage.

What we need the funds for

We are only too aware of the demands on the generosity of Independence supporters so have kept this fundraiser to the minimum to invest in the new site, cover server and allied costs for the next 12 months. Newsnet has not run a fundraiser in the last 4 years. So please donate what you can towards our revamp.

The budget is split down as follows: £1200 is allocated to web development, coding and associated cost; £900 to cover monthly server charges, SSL fee and domain charges for the next 12 months.

The Newsroom needs fast and powerful connections and internal storage capacity. Some hardware bits and bobs and updated software comes to £500. The editorial support budget of £650 covers subscriptions, misc research charges, expenses, etc. £350 is allocated to a small promotional budget, £200 for any incidental design work and £180 for subscriber perks.

So our total spend budget comes to £3,980 but we need to add Indiegogo fees and card payment charges of around £520, bringing the amount sought up to £4,500.

Our writers are not paid. There is no budget for that.  They are all treated equally unfairly. By supporting this fundraiser you will ensure their voices are heard, their arguments, analysis, reporting and insights are published for others to benefit from. For now, reward enough on the road to Independence.

Should we meet target we have a stretch budget item we are excited about

Like everybody else involved in the online media, Newsnet is in the news business and we want to reach the parts online does not reach - so we are planning a pilot tabloid edition of Newsnet that will reach out to groups outside the online community and social media - especially older voters and those who have moved to Scotland from south of the Border.  The intention of the tabloid edition is to engage and inform with lively and accessible content. 

The additional budget requirement for the development of this pilot tabloid print edition is £525. Enough for a short print run of 8,000 to 10,000. The intention would be to distribute supplies to Yes groups through our existing links with ayeMail and the National Yes Registry. Yes groups would pay ayeMail for distribution logistics and carriage, as was done with the Keep Scotland the Brand and the current leaflets and posters on tax, which include analysis by Newsnet showing how taxes and charges are lower in Scotland for the vast majority of the population.

That’s it folks

Exactly what we plan to do if we reach target and a little extra if we meet the stretch budget. 

Newsnet Scotland is in this for the longterm and we envisage a future beyond independence. Achieving independence is a gateway to Scotland’s future in the world. Thereafter, what really matters it is what we do with it to deliver our nation's aspirations.

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

Somos Kampio,

Somos 7 socios con una meta en común: cambiar la innovación. Desde el comienzo, hemos querido ofrecer productos que en México simplemente son muy caros o no existen. Nuestra meta es proveer productos accesibles que cambiarán la  forma de ver al mundo.

KeVR es nuestro primer proyecto, se trata de unos lentes de realidad virtual basados en Google Cardboard que sirven para viajar a muchos lugares; desde el interior de una célula, hasta el espacio exterior. La realidad virtual, es la representación de escenas o imágenes fotorrealistas de objetos producida por un sistema informático, que da la sensación de su existencia real.

 

A comparación de otros lentes de realidad virtual como el gear VR que cuestan alrededor de $3,000 MXN, KeVR costará menos de $200 MXN.

 

¿Qué necesitamos?

Necesitamos una inversión inicial para empezar a producir y vender nuestro producto, y con esto desarrollar muchos más. En vez de ir con un inversionista convencional, acudimos a nuestra familia y amigos para conseguir los fondos. Todo apoyo es bienvenido.

 

Pedimos $10,000 USD para las siguientes cosas:

1. Compraremos los materiales necesarios para producir los KeVR. Nuestro objetivo es producir por lo menos 1,000 visores para poder proveerlos a escuelas, instituciones y personas. Esto incluye:

  • Costos de manufactura de las cajas para los visores.
  • Impresión de diseño sobre las cajas para los visores.
  • Compra e importación desde China de los lentes biconvexos y cinta conductiva.
  • Ensamblaje del visor.
  • Smartphones para ofrecerlos en paquete con los visores a instituciones.

2. Parte de nuestro proyecto será crear contenido para KeVR, con esto, Kampio brindará una nueva manera de aprender y acercarte al conocimiento.   

  • Necesitaremos cámaras de 360 grados de alta resolución.
  • Software de diseño.
  • Equipo de audio.
  • Desarrollo de una aplicación para contenido VR.

3. Hace alrededor de un año, nos registramos ante el IMPI. Ahora que ya estamos cerca de vender nuestro producto e incorporarnos al mercado, nos registraremos ante Hacienda, lo cual tiene un costo de alrededor de $12,000.

  • Registro ante Hacienda.

4. KeVR es sólo el comienzo, anteriormente habíamos invertido en una impresora 3D, que obtendremos en los siguientes meses. Uno de los siguientes proyectos de Kampio es la manufactura de nuestros propios drones; cuando esta sociedad era tan sólo una idea, desarrollamos un prototipo, sin embargo por diversas fallas técnicas y faltas de capital, este mismo falló. Con tu ayuda, queremos y haremos, mediante el uso de la impresión 3D, drones con acceso a un mayor sector de la población y de alta calidad. Para lograr esto:

  • Compra e importación de unidad de procesamiento.
  • Compra e importación de controles de larga distancia.
  • Compra e importación de GPS, giroscopios, acelerómetros, entre otros.
  • Importación de impresora 3D.
  • Software de diseño.

5. La impresión 3D está iniciando una revolución en la manera en la que creamos. Sin embargo, como lo ha planteado nuestra campaña, la realidad virtual, los drones y las impresoras 3D, están fuera del alcance de la mayoría. Mientras que KeVR se trata de experimentar, nuestra impresora se trata de crear y esta misma está limitada a los más privilegiados. Kampio está comprometido con el ideal de distribuir a un precio mas accesible estos productos, por lo cual construiremos nuestra propia impresora.

  • Manufactura de impresora.
  • Compra de materia prima de producción.

Nuestra aportación al mundo.

Para nosotros es de suma importancia sacar este proyecto adelante ya que todos los días experimentamos la desigualdad en nuestro país, experimentamos como se le niega a la mayoría el acceso a tecnología de vanguardia. Es simplemente injusto. Los jóvenes somos agentes del cambio, es nuestra responsabilidad hacer algo al respecto. En Kampio buscamos mejorar nuestra comunidad y ofrecer nuevas oportunidades a través de tecnología innovadora y accesible a tanto quienes quieren sólo disfrutar de ella como los que pueden usarla como herramienta para mejorar su vida diaria.

 

Nosotros creemos en la democratización de la tecnología y sentimos una responsabilidad con nuestro país, brindándole tecnología a los que no tienen acceso a ella. Por eso mismo, al realizar ventas con escuelas privadas nos comprometemos a donar Kits de KeVR a escuelas públicas, de esa manera podemos ayudar a expandir el potencial educativo de la realidad virtual sin importar el perfil socioeconómico.

 

Otras maneras de ayudar.

Si no estás en posibilidad de donar a nuestra campaña, aún puedes apoyar nuestra causa. Puedes compartir nuestra campaña con tus conocidos para que puedan tener acceso a un KeVR y a quien consideres que pueda aportar. ¡Recuerda, todo el apoyo es bienvenido!

 

El Equipo.

Fernando Hurtado - C.C.O. de Kampio

Estudio en el Churchill College, voy a estudiar arquitectura, pero me encanta el emprendimiento y el debate. Mi puesto consiste de muchas cosas; principalmente dedico al desarrollo de proyectos, pero también me dedico a cosas creativas como el diseño del logo de Kampio y la página web. Soy el líder y creador del proyecto de KeVR, ya que siempre he estado fascinado por la realidad virtual.

 

José L. Salsamendi - C.T.O. de Kampio

 

Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, planeo estudiar ingeniería mecánica. Mi función en Kampio es manejar el desarrollo de las tecnologías nuevas y de la creación de los productos, también la parte informática como la página de internet, el funcionamiento de los correos y el servicio a cliente.

 

Emilio Llop - C.T.I.O. de Kampio

 

Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México y voy a estudiar física e ingeniería aeroespacial. Mi puesto de C.T.I.O. es poco conocido, pero significa Chief Technological Innovation Officer y como buen científico (o aspirante a serlo), soy naturalmente curioso y con una sed de conocimiento constante, lo cual me ayuda a saber mucho sobre las tecnologías emergentes y los nuevos mercados. Mi función en Kampio es, entre muchas otras cosas, siempre tener las últimas noticias en innovación y productos de vanguardia para que siempre haya un nuevo proyecto innovador en la empresa. La razón por la que estoy en Kampio es para intentar llevar la tecnología más moderna a la sociedad mexicana e intentar de reducir la inequidad existente en nuestro país.

 

Santiago Monge - C.O.O. de Kampio y Director de Incubator

 

Actualmente estudio en el Tecnológico de Monterrey, seré un financiero. Yo creo que todos los seres humanos tenemos un potencial y valor intrínseco. Tristemente, vivimos en un país que no lo aprovecha, ni sabe apreciar. Es mi labor encontrar a individuos dispuestos a cambiar su entorno y a México para bien. Mi puesto consiste en evaluar todos los proyectos que Kampio, como empresa, emprenda, logrando su realización exitosamente. 

 

Iñigo S. Gómez - Ventas

 

Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, siempre he sido un soñador y anhelo mejorar, en comunidad y cual sea el ambiente, a nuestro mundo.

Me dedico a la mercadotecnia y a los ámbitos sociales de la compañía. Kampio es la puerta que me da la posibilidad de brindar nuestros ideales al exterior y poder plantar el cambio que queremos ver en nuestro entorno.

 

Pablo R. Brouwer - C.E.O. de Kampio


Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, voy a ser matemático abstracto y economista. Mi función en Kampio es colaborar con todos los demás directores para asegurar el cumplimiento de todas las funciones de la compañía y asegurar el progreso próspero de la empresa.

 

José P. Ballesteros - C.F.O. de Kampio

 

Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, voy a ser economista y practicaré en la función pública. Mi motivación es disminuir la brecha de la desigualdad en México, brindando las herramientas necesarias para que cada individuo pueda desarrollar su máximo potencial. Mejorar a México.

Mi trabajo es el manejo de los ámbitos financieros de la compañía.

En Kampio buscamos mejorar nuestra comunidad y ofrecer nuevas oportunidades a través de tecnología innovadora y accesible a tanto quienes quieren sólo disfrutar de ella como los que pueden usarla como herramienta para mejorar su vida diaria. Nosotros creemos en la democratización de la tecnología y sentimos una responsabilidad con nuestro país, brindándole tecnología a los que no tienen acceso a ella. Por eso mismo, al realizar ventas con escuelas privadas nos comprometemos a donar Kits de KeVR a escuelas públicas, de esa manera podemos ayudar a expandir el potencial educativo de la realidad virtual sin importar el perfil socioeconómico.
 
Otras maneras de ayudar.
Si no estás en posibilidad de donar a nuestra campaña, aún puedes apoyar nuestra causa. Puedes compartir nuestra campaña con tus conocidos para que puedan tener acceso a un KeVR y a quien consideres que pueda aportar. ¡Recuerda, todo el apoyo es bienvenido!
 
El Equipo.
Fernando Hurtado - C.C.O. de Kampio

Estudio en el Churchill College, voy a estudiar arquitectura, pero me encanta el emprendimiento y el debate. Mi puesto consiste de muchas cosas; principalmente dedico al desarrollo de proyectos, pero también me dedico a cosas creativas como el diseño del logo de Kampio y la página web. Soy el líder y creador del proyecto de KeVR, ya que siempre he estado fascinado por la realidad virtual.
 
José L. Salsamendi - C.T.O. de Kampio
 Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, planeo estudiar ingeniería mecánica. Mi función en Kampio es manejar el desarrollo de las tecnologías nuevas y de la creación de los productos, también la parte informática como la página de internet, el funcionamiento de los correos y el servicio a cliente.
 
Emilio Llop - C.T.I.O. de Kampio

 
Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México y voy a estudiar física e ingeniería aeroespacial. Mi puesto de C.T.I.O. es poco conocido, pero significa Chief Technological Innovation Officer y como buen científico (o aspirante a serlo), soy naturalmente curioso y con una sed de conocimiento constante, lo cual me ayuda a saber mucho sobre las tecnologías emergentes y los nuevos mercados. Mi función en Kampio es, entre muchas otras cosas, siempre tener las últimas noticias en innovación y productos de vanguardia para que siempre haya un nuevo proyecto innovador en la empresa. La razón por la que estoy en Kampio es para intentar llevar la tecnología más moderna a la sociedad mexicana e intentar de reducir la inequidad existente en nuestro país.
 
Santiago Monge - C.O.O. de Kampio y Director de Incubator
 Actualmente estudio en el Tecnológico de Monterrey, seré un financiero. Yo creo que todos los seres humanos tenemos un potencial y valor intrínseco. Tristemente, vivimos en un país que no lo aprovecha, ni sabe apreciar. Es mi labor encontrar a individuos dispuestos a cambiar su entorno y a México para bien. Mi puesto consiste en evaluar todos los proyectos que Kampio, como empresa, emprenda, logrando su realización exitosamente. 
 
Iñigo S. Gómez - Ventas
 Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, siempre he sido un soñador y anhelo mejorar, en comunidad y cual sea el ambiente, a nuestro mundo.
Me dedico a la mercadotecnia y a los ámbitos sociales de la compañía. Kampio es la puerta que me da la posibilidad de brindar nuestros ideales al exterior y poder plantar el cambio que queremos ver en nuestro entorno.
 
Pablo R. Brouwer - C.E.O. de Kampio

Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, voy a ser matemático abstracto y economista. Mi función en Kampio es colaborar con todos los demás directores para asegurar el cumplimiento de todas las funciones de la compañía y asegurar el progreso próspero de la empresa.
 
José P. Ballesteros - C.F.O. de Kampio

 
Estudio en el Colegio Ciudad de México, voy a ser economista y practicaré en la función pública. Mi motivación es disminuir la brecha de la desigualdad en México, brindando las herramientas necesarias para que cada individuo pueda desarrollar su máximo potencial. Mejorar a México.
Mi trabajo es el manejo de los ámbitos financieros de la compañía.

story:
Update 12/13/16: If Indiegogo won't let you pay... 

... just PayPal us directly at "Publisher@americanbystander.org." I've got a support ticket into them.


Issues #1, #2, and #3 are still available!

Every issue, there are tons of people who missed our initial Kickstarter but still want the magazine. We offer these rolling campaigns on Indiegogo, so everybody who wants a copy of Bystander can get it from us, at a 20% discount off retail.

Original Campaign Text Below:

In Fall 2015, we asked: is there still an audience for a classic print humor magazine? Will people pony up their hard-earned for comics, cartoons, parodies and prose backed by beautiful design? Funny the way they used to make it, at places like The National Lampoon, Punch, and SPY?

The answer is YES.

For #1, we made our goal in four days. Bystander #2 was even more successful -- we got twice as many backers on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. In July 2016, COMPLETELY UNBRIBED, The New York Times raved over our first two issues, saying that we were a "delightful publication, an essential read for comedy nerds." Our moms were very proud. 

So we're doing it again. 

(Some of) THE PEOPLE IN #3: Cover by Drew Friedman; Merrill Markoe (Late Night With David Letterman), Gahan Wilson (Playboy, National Lampoon), George Booth (The New Yorker), Billy Collins, Sam Gross (Lampoon), MK Brown (Lampoon), Howard Cruse (Stuck Rubber Baby), Mallory Ortberg (The Toast, Slate), Steve Young (Letterman), Jack Handey (SNL, The New Yorker), Ron Barrett (Lampoon), Charles Barsotti (The New Yorker)...and many more!

Michael Gerber (Editor & Publisher): The American Bystander is the culmination of over 25 years as a writer, editor, and magazine consultant specializing in humor. I've written for The New Yorker, SNL, and many other places (which is how I know all these people!). My books have sold 1.25 million copies in 25 languages. In 2003, Barry Trotter and the Shameless Parody fried the brains of a generation of English kids, and probably led, somehow, to Brexit. Sorry.

Brian McConnachie (Head Writer): Brian began his comedy career as an editor at National Lampoon and the Lampoon's "Radio Hour." From there, he went to Saturday Night Live, and SCTV, completing the Holy Trinity of Seventies Comedy. In the 80s and 90s, Brian amassed the coolest bunch of cameos in the history of cinema. In more recent years, he has written for The Simpsons and recorded pieces for NPR.

Alan Goldberg (Senior Editor) has been making non-fiction television and radio for more than 35 years. His work includes biographies ranging from Fidel Castro to the Beatles; science programs with Dr. Richard Leakey; programs on drugs and epidemic diseases; histories of American railroads, diners, The Forbidden City and the Golden Gate Bridge -- and even live rock and roll and gospel concerts. Alan will be overseeing The Bystander's podcasts and live-event programming.

story:
I Need Your Help to Finish!

Hi! I'm Kerry Rego and I'm a social media consultant, educator, author, columnist, and speaker. My passion is to teach people to use technology to, not only improve their lives and bottom lines, but to help them change their world. My credentials for your consideration:

  • County of Sonoma social media consultant
  • Sonoma State University social media instructor
  • Santa Rosa Junior College community education instructor
  • North Bay Business Journal columnist
  • North Bay Woman (Marin Independent Journal) contributor
  • Vistage speaker
  • My full LinkedIn profile
My clients and students have been asking me for a long time to provide them with "all they need to know" when it came to social media. Well, it's impossible to include everything but I can provide them (and you!) with an easy to understand step-by-step process on how to deploy smart social media as if I was right beside them. So I wrote this book just for you and now I need your help to go the extra distance.

"The Social Media Starter Kit"

This book is your guide to establish your social plan, how to set up a system for success, and will provide you peace of mind because at the end you'll know what's important to a great social media presence. The book covers: 

  • strategy
  • the tools to use
  • crisis plans
  • policies
  • how to hire the right person for the job
  • measuring return on investment
  • templates for getting started
  • value added digital content
  • and so much more. 

Anyone that wants to get started and understand what social media is about, what's important, and what to watch out for can read this book quickly and have a guide to return to when they need it. Low cost, value-based education on social media is very hard to find, trust me, educating is what I do.


It's Low Risk!

The awesome part for you is, the book is already written. I'm doing my edit now and will be sending off to my editor a couple days after this campaign starts. I'll keep you up-to-date on it's progress. The funding period ends on 9/28/14, the next day is my 8th business anniversary, and the official day the book is available for sale  [I timed it that way ;)] so you will get your perks lickety split. This campaign is setup with Flexible Funding so even if I don't meet my $5,000 goal, I still get what you help me raise minus costs to Indiegogo and transfer fees.

All that's left:

  • Editor review
  • Formatting finishing
  • Inserting images
  • Inserting videos
  • Creating the workbook
With your support, I can pay all the bills listed below. Your book is almost ready to be printed!

The Budget

I independently published my first book and the cost was tough to swallow as a small business owner. This time around, I decided to crowdfund so that it's not so difficult on me to get it on the shelves. If you are so generous, here is where your donations will go:

  • $118 - ISBN (International Serial Book Number) registration
  • $20 - Bar code
  • $25 - Expanded distribution for sales to schools
  • $107 - Template for paperback & digital book formatting
  • $29 - Domain purchase, 2 years plus tax
  • $300 - Copyediting
  • $700 - Graphic design (cover, interior art, workbook, collateral)
  • $1500 - Video production for interior of book
  • $400 - Printing of collateral and workbooks
  • $900 - Photography for cover and promotional, digital copies
  • $20 - Preview copy
  • $880 - First run, 300 copies of the book includes shipping
$4999 - TOTAL

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, and that's cool, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this with your friends, family, and colleagues
  • Send this to anyone that needs this book!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What are Black Box Stories?

The Black Box Stories project is a community-based funding campaign to help an unpublished aspiring writer publish their first novel. The current author of the project (that would be me at this moment in time) will pass the project on to the next aspiring writer once their Black Box Story is completed. It's a funding/mentoring project to help writers get published.  

 

What’s unique about this project?

The project takes a bit of “mad libs” and mixes it with “choose your own adventure” stories. Each person who supports this project is inherently part of the story because they will give me an idea (Mad Libs input) which the author then develops into a full blown novel (the choose the adventure element). 

The community fuels its development, completion and success. If the project is a success, it’s because the community believed in it and was a part of it; they will in turn be immortalized in the story through ideas and words. 

 

How will the money be used?

Originally, I aimed high on this project based on the research available online - maybe a little higher than I could realistically get. On the plus side, I've been given great advice and assistance with the project. I have been able to cut costs and make the money stretch as far as possible. So, any money that is contributed will be first put to use in these three catagories:

1. Printed Paperback and E-book (includes layout, formatting and shipping)

2. Copy Editing (grammar corrections and content analysis)

3. Cover Artwork (by local artist)

I have applied for a Writing Grant from the Canada Council for Arts. So, fingers-crossed I get it and I will be able to write full-time for 4 months in a remote cottage. 

I will utilize the GoDaddy Website Builder service and set-up my own author website to promote my work... all for under $15/year... wicked!

 

Why are these items important to complete the project?

These items will allow me to publish an original Black Box Story and provide my contributors with a tangible result.  I promised my contributors that I would provide them with a paperback copy and/or an e-book and that’s just what I’ll be able to do with this support. 

  • The website development is essential to marketing this project, creating a community around it, and providing a social media type of interaction for the community. This professional website will also not only provide information and sales of future publications, it will also keep readers current with upcoming events and insight into what I’m currently working on.
  • Copy editing is essential to any writers’ success. We get so wrapped up in our work that we fail to notice minor spelling errors or grammatical inconsistencies. Our completed work would not be as successful if a copy editor didn’t mark it all up first.
  • Every printed novel needs an eye-catching cover to draw in the interests of potential customers. For this aspect of the project, I would support an emerging local artist by commissioning them to design the cover and help them launch their career.

 

How can you help?

Get involved directly by donating on one of these levels:

You want to support but you don’t have a lot to give, these levels are right up your alley... $5, $10 & $ 20 perks. Check out the tabs on the sides for more info.

You’ve got more funds to fuel the project or maybe you just want to get more involved in the process… check out the $50, $100 & $200 levels.

You really believe in the project and want to commit to funding more… these final levels take the project to a whole new level of success... $750 & $1000 perks give the ultimate experience.

If you want to spice up your donations, mix and match your support on multiple levels.

You want to support the project but don’t have any extra funds to spare – don’t worry, you can still help.

  1. Spread the word! Share this project with other people you know. The more the merrier.
  2. Like the Black Box Stories on Facebook.
  3. Keep yourself in the loop with updates posted right here on Indiegogo, Facebook and at www.blackboxstories.com.

 

Need more reasons to donate??

Can’t find that perfect gift? Give someone the gift of immortality through words. Create a character based on or for them.

Is there someone in your life making it a living hell? Use the world of fiction to seek retribution. I’ll ensure justice is served on your behalf.

Maybe you really love your best friend... the cute, cuddly, always there when you get home best friend... your pet! Characters are not limited to humans.

Pay it forward! I’m a big fan of this concept. Ideally I would like to keep the project going in the future on an annual basis. New donors, new story and new emerging writer to help get noticed.

 

Remember... if you contribute to the project financially you're connected to the project literally ;)

story:
I am Therese Hummel, a mother of 4 children and 2 grandchildren from Victoria Australia. I am a taxi driver and enjoy the communications between all my passengers and myself. I have always dreamed of Sponsoring a Seminarian now my dream is coming to a reality. To Sponsor one requres a lot of fundraising for studies and flights etc.

I am happy to be a part of Deacon Simon's  life to help him to achieve his Priesthood. Normally a Study Time Frame is 9 years but he has been Studying now for 12 years due to lack of funding in his country to carry him through to his Ordination to Priesthood. He is with the Franciscan Order of Our Lady of the Poor. story:
IGNORANCE, HATRED AND MADNESS IN 'BAD EUROPE'.

Come with Mike Stuchbery on a road trip through Europe's awful, squalid history. You will reel at the tales of murder, insanity and bigotry across the great cities of Europe, but Mike's lashings of black humour and grand guignol stylings will have you turning from page to page into the wee hours, laughing at the ignorance, admonishing the hatred and marveling at the madness that was BAD EUROPE.


Mike reveals the IGNORANCE - We journey through the Medieval mindset and watch it burst an aneurysm as it crashes into the Renaissance. We look at medicine that killed more than it cured, the ideas that killed brilliant minds and marvel at the bizarre theories that the now long dead Europeans thought explained the world around them.

Mike shows their love of HATRED - Join Mike in the muddy and bloody trenches of sectarian strife. From the Roman massacres in the Harz Mountains of Germany to the chaos of White Mountain in the Czech Republic, we learn how hatred has torn Europe apart again and again.

Mike takes a sane look at the MADNESS - When the world is a chaotic, bloody dungheap, minds crack. Just look at the flagellants in Germany or the murderous artists in Rome! Join Mike as he reveals the fever-dream psychoses of historical Europe.

Over 200 pages in length, BAD EUROPE will be released after March 2015, available immediately to your ereader in digital format - PDF, iBooks and Kindle, expected to be completed in April 2015.

And depending upon the funding love level, Mike's book will be made available in hard copies for supporters.

In this short year ahead that Mike has available to visit the BAD sides of EUROPE to research and to write the book, he will be blogging the whole process, recording the trip findings and providing detailed listings for other travellers who dare go where only Mike dares to go.

BAD EUROPE seeks out the mud and the pus, grinning through cracked lips and blows grave-breath into your face. It lifts the lid on a market crowded with sunshine and trysts with swarthy orange-pickers and pesto.

It's a travelogue for the warped, broken and morbid.

When Mike scoured high and low to fulfil his own urge to read such a book, he found that nobody seems to be writing it.

Over the last five years Mike has written on history for Crikey and ABC's The Drum. He also writes for The Local in Germany. Mike is a teacher of a decade's experience who enjoys teaching students and sharing his writings about the past with an even wider audience.

Now with your financial assistance, Mike looks forward to writing a whole book for you about the wonderful history of BAD EUROPE.
