¿Por qué ultra-pasteurizar la leche materna donada?/Why to ultra-pasteurize donated breast milk?
Todos los recién nacidos tienen el sistema inmunológico inmaduro, especialmente los bebés prematuros, quienes además tienen el aparato digestivo inmaduro también. La naturaleza ha diseñado la leche de la madre adecuada a la edad gestacional del bebé, para ellos es importante recibirla, sin embargo, existe un alto número de madres que por alguna razón no pueden alimentar a sus bebés con su propia leche. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------All newborn babies have immature immune system, especially premature
babies, who also have immature digestive tract. Nature has designed the
appropriate mother's milk depending on the gestational age of
the baby, so it is important for them to
receive it; however, there is a large number of mothers who, for some reason, are unable to feed
their babies with their own milk. Durante los últimos años el uso de bancos de leche ha incrementado, aumentando también el uso de leche donada para alimentar infantes enfermos y prematuros. Sólo la madre natural del bebé hospitalizado debe proveer la leche para éste,  en los casos en los que la madre no pueda proveer de leche al recién nacido, se puede utilizar leche materna donada pero esta debe ser pasteurizada debido al riesgo de posible transmisión viral de citomegalovirus (CMV). El CMV se encuentra distribuido mundialmente y la infección depende de varios factores como: los inmunológicos, económicos y sociales. La incidencia de seropositividad de CMV en la población adulta en los países en vías de desarrollo se encuentra entre 80 y el 100%, mientras que en los países desarrollados es menor y oscila entre 60 y 80%. Los pacientes inmunosuprimidos son los de mayor riesgo de morbi-mortalidad y este grupo incluye a los inmunológicamente inmaduros como los recién nacidos,  siendo en este grupo los recién nacidos prematuros, un grupo de alto riesgo de contagio de CMV. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------During the last years the use of milk banks has increased, increasing also the use of donated milk to feed premature
and sick babies. Only the biological mother of the hospitalized baby must
provide milk for him.
In cases when the mother cannot
provide milk for the baby, donated breast milk may be used, but it
must be pasteurized due to the risk of possible viral transmission of Cytomegalovirus
(CMV). CMV is distributed globally and infection depends on several factors
such as: immunological, economic
and social. The incidence of CMV seropositivity in the adult population in
developing countries is between 80 and 100%, while in the developed countries
is less and ranges between 60 and 80%. Immunosuppressed patients are in high risk of morbidity and
mortality. This group includes to the immunologically
immature as the newborn, and newborn premature
babies, who are in high risk of
transmission of CMV. Si bien la infección de CMV suele cursar sin ningún tipo de síntomas, entre 10 y 15% de los casos puede dar lugar a enfermedad clínica en el recién nacido, incluye problemas de audición en el 30-65% de los casos sintomáticos, y constituye así la causa más frecuente de sordera neurosensorial de origen no hereditario. Incluso, en aquellos sin enfermedad evidente al nacer, el CMV puede ser responsable de algún tipo de secuelas a largo plazo.La pasteurización Holder de leche materna es un método ampliamente recomendado para evitar la transferencia de infección por CMV en leche obtenida en bancos de leche. Son varias las evidencias que muestran los efectos benéficos en la seguridad de la leche materna pasteurizada, sin embargo, está perfectamente documentado que este método de pasteurización también inactiva componentes biológicos, así como propiedades nutrimentales  y  anticuerpos, entre ellos anticuerpos Anti-CMV, que los recién nacidos requieren o podrían requerir.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------While CMV infection tends to pursue without any symptoms, between 10
and 15% of the cases may result in clinical disease in the newborn, including hearing problems
in 30-65% of symptomatic cases, thus it is the most frequent
cause of non hereditary
sensorineural deafness. Even in those without apparent disease at birth, CMV
may be responsible for some kind of long-term damages.

Holder
pasteurization of Breastmilk is a widely recommended method to avoid the
transfer of CMV infection in milk obtained from milk banks. There are several
evidences that show beneficial effects on the safety of pasteurized breast milk;
however, it is documented that this method also
inactives biological
components, as nutritional properties and neutralizing antibodies thatnewborns require.



Por lo anterior, es necesario fabricar un equipo de ultra-pasteurización de leche materna que inactive el CMV pero también que preserve los nutrientes y anticuerpos que los bebés necesitan. Actualmente, hemos diseñado un equipo ultrapasteurizador de leche materna, sin embargo, necesitamos de tu apoyo para poder realizar el prototipo y demostrar que este método es mucho mejor que el método tradicional.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Therefore, it is necessary to create an ultra-pasteurization of breast
milk device that not
only inactivates the CMV, but also that preserves nutrients and
antibodies that babies need. Currently, we have designed the device; however,
we need your support to make the prototype and demonstrate that this method is
much better than the traditional one.





¿Cómo funciona el equipo ultrapasteurizador? /

How does ultra-pasteurizer equipment work?
Todo funciona mediante un sistema robótico controlado y cerrado que proporciona choques térmicos a temperaturas extremas en un tiempo muy corto. El choque choque térmico es controlado mediante un sistema que en ningún momento tiene contacto con la leche por lo que no es contaminada durante el proceso. Durante el procedimiento se utiliza como referencia y retroalimentación de temperaturas al sistema, un fluido con densidad, punto de ebullición y fusión igual a la leche materna para no desperdiciar el líquido.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Everything works using a
controlled and closed robotic system that provides thermal shocks to extreme
temperatures in a very short time. The thermal shock is controlled by a system which
never has contact with the milk, so it is not contaminated during the process.
In the procedure, a fluid with density, and boiling and melting point
same as those of the breast milk are used as a reference and
feedback of temperatures of the system for not to wastthe liquid.




Ultra-pasteurizador: Uno de los principales obstáculos es la financiación / Ultra-pasteurizer: One of the major obstacles is funding



El ultrapasteurizador de leche materna es una iniciativa que hemos emprendido egresados del Instituto Politécnico Nacional en México en colaboración con expertos en el tema y ha sido financiado con recursos propios a través de "freelance", sin embargo, nos encontramos en una etapa en donde es necesario invertir más recursos para fabricar el primer prototipo piloto.
Hemos planeado tanto como sea posible para el exito de este proyecto. El siguiente paso importante es recaudar los fondos necesarios para adquirir los dispositivos y material necesario para el prototipado y realizar las primeras pruebas beta para evaluar el desempeño y la calidad de la leche materna después del proceso.
Para el primer prototipo requerimos recaudar $40,000 dólares que serán destinados para materiales, herramientas y pruebas clínicas microbiológicas, virológicas, entre otros estudios.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The
ultra- pasteurizer breast milk is an initiative that we, graduates from the
Instituto Politécnico Nacional in Mexico, have undertaken in collaboration with
experts in the field. The project has been financed with our own resources through
"freelance"; however, we are at a stage where it is necessary to invest
more resources to manufacture the first pilot prototype.
We
have planned as much as possible to the success of this project. The next important
step is to raise the necessary funds to acquire the devices and equipment for prototyping
and make the first beta testing to evaluate the performance and quality of
breast milk after the process.
For
the first prototype, we need to raise $40,000 dollars which will be used for materials,
tools, microbiological and virological clinical tests, among other studies.

Ayudar donando / Help by Donating

Dona cualquier cantidad que puedas. Este es un proyecto innovador que cambiará el curso de la alimentación de los bebés en el mundo. ¡Se parte de ella!
¡Ayudemos a que los bebés enfermos y prematuros puedan consumir leche materna donada de calidad para su crecimiento y desarrollo!
Nota: Si eres de cualquier otro país que no sea Estados Unidos, al momento de hacer la donación automáticamente hace la conversión de tu moneda nacional a dólares.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Donate whatever amount you can. This is a ground-breaking project that will change the course of feeding babies in the world. Be a part of it!
Let's help to sick and premature infants can consume quality donated breast milk for their growth and development!
Ayudar compartiendo / Help by Sharing
¡Comparte esta compaña con tus amigos, familia y colegas en todo el mundo a través de email y redes sociales!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues around the world via email and social media!
Ultrapasteurizador en los medios / Ultra-pasteurizer in the media
¡El ultra pasteurizador de leche materna ya ha generado ruido e interés! /The breast milk ultra-pasteurized has generated considerable buzz and interest already!
México:


CONACYT Prensa: Mexicanos desarrollan primer ultrapasteurizador de leche materna


Noticias MVS: Buscan ultrapasteurizar leche materna 


Investigación y Desarrollo: Buscan desarrollar primer ultrapasteurizador de leche materna


Fundación Carlos Slim: Researchers Work on Ultra-Pasteurization Equipment for Breast Milk





Nuestro equipo / Our Team


Somos un equipo de ingenieros mexicanos egresados del Instituto Politécnico Nacional y del Tecnológico de Orizaba conformado por dos ingenieros mecatrónicos (Mario Alberto Camilo y  Andrés Leal), tres ingenieros en robótica (Alejandro Hernández Pérez, Nathán Martínez Castelán  y Victor Arellano Quintana), un ingeniero en Sistemas Computacionales (Miguel Cortés Sarmiento), un ingeniero en informática (Luis Gustavo Miranda) y un Doctor que actualmente es Jefe del área de Neonatología del Hospital de la Mujer (José Luis Cruz). Somos un equipo multidisciplinario con experiencia en procesos de manufactura, desarrollo de hardware, firmware, control, sistemas y área médica.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
We are a team of Mexican engineers graduated from the  Instituto Politécnico Nacional and Tecnológico de Orizaba formed by two Mechatronics engineers (Mario Alberto Camilo and Andrés Leal), three Robotics engineers (Alejandro Hernández Pérez, Nathán Martínez Castelán and Víctor Arellano Quintana), an Computer Systems engineer (Miguel Cortés Sarmiento),  an Informatics engineer  (Luis Gustavo  Miranda) and a Doctor who is currently Head of the department of Neonatology of the  Hospital for Woman (José Luis Cruz). We are a multidisciplinary team with experience  in manufacturing processes, development of hardware, firmware, control, systems and medical area.

***Update: Thank you for helping me reach $4,000! Thanks to all of you, I will be able to move forward in publishing! ***

 

The Story of My Book

 

Fired up about the next ten years of climate activism? 

Amused or frustrated at #OkBoomer? 

Looking for unity in what is proving to be a challenging decade? 

 

Growing Up in the Grassroots: Finding Unity in Climate Activism Across Generations is my take on “Generation Greta” and what it means to be a climate advocate in the 21st-century’s New Environmental Movement. I wrote it to share why all generations are needed at the table to contribute meaningful solutions to climate change. With your help, the book will publish in July 2020. #GrowingUpInTheGrassroots

My name is Joy Reeves and I am the author of Growing Up in the Grassroots. I wrote this book because it is my peace offering — my personal contribution to the widespread, exasperated push for unity we’re seeing in the divided United States right now. There is a lot of rightful anger coming from my generation, Gen Z, towards other generations on the topic of climate change (“Ok, Boomer”), as well as frustration directed back at us for our hypersensitivity (“Ok, Snowflake”). Neither one of these generalized attacks accurately captures how most of us want to work together... or how little time we have to do so.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that there are vast opportunities for older and younger generations to find common ground, and room for mentorship, to move forward collaboratively on climate change. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for climate advocacy in you. Much of it comes from a comprehensive understanding of U.S. environmental history which is unfortunately skimmed over in many primary-classroom settings. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you master science communication for audiences of all ages and backgrounds.

In this book, you'll learn about climate advocacy and how different generations are involved in it:

  • Chlöe Swarbrick - a New Zealand parliamentarian, and Millennial, who challenges older politicians on climate action and inadvertently sparks an online movement.
     

  • Bob Inglis - A 61-year-old Republican politician and father who radically changed his views on climate change after a spiritual experience in nature and a conversation with his son.

  • “The Raging Grannies” - A troupe of elderly activists across the globe that you may stumble across singing hilarious protest songs...but completely defying the “little old lady” stereotype in the rest of their story.
     

You will love this book if you are an environmental geek like me...or if you’re simply a teen or adult who considers yourself at least a little bit “woke” to environmental activism. Whether you’re hitting the ground chasing social media fame as a Gen-Z/Millennial, reflecting on a lifetime of environmental science work as a Gen-X/Baby Boomer, or are still a little confused about why there are kids blocking the street, this book is great for you if this planet’s future has been on your mind.


Growing Up in the Grassroots is a non-fiction book that speaks to anyone who thinks about the next 50 years of climate change and gets mildly worried, particularly impassioned students and supportive adults interested in looking at climate activism and intergenerational unity for the first time.
 

The Book - Growing Up in the Grassroots


The book is written in three parts:

Part I: Planting the Grassroots
Introduction + Chapters 1-3 give an overview of the “How We Got Here.” From the first Earth Day to the latest #FridaysForFuture strike, this chapter explores the progression of not only climate change but of the larger Environmental Movement as it reawakens in the image of courageous youth.

Part II: Common Ground
Chapters 4-10 delve into the common environmental values that have always united Americans. These include care for our children, pride in our National Parks, excitement towards outdoor recreation, stewardship of nature, love for meaningful music, empathy towards loss, and many more topics that transcend generational and partisan divides. Part II integrates the voices of climate academics as well as bipartisan leaders to unpack where successful communication lies.

Part III: How to Talk With Others About Climate Change
Chapters 11-14 provide talking points and applicable strategies to have the most productive conversations on climate change. How do I bring up the environment to different generational audiences? How do I learn to depolarize myself when I feel there are so many urgent issues at stake? Part III addresses these questions and features advice from science communication experts as well as my personal encounters to demystify the art of productive climate communication.

 

What Would Help Me & What You'll Get
 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.

  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook!

​I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Invite to join me at my Launch Party event later this year!
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...
     

About the Author

Joy Reeves is a climate advocate, author, and student of Environmental Science and Policy at Duke University. Trained in science communication as part of a Science & Society Huang Fellowship, she has explored the art of scientific storytelling and has used creative media to share her research on saltwater intrusion from sea level rise in North Carolina and beyond. Joy will spend this summer working on the campaigns team at League of Conservation Voters, a non-profit organization dedicated to advancing innovative climate policies and supporting pro-environment candidates in the framework of electoral democracy.

In her first book, Growing Up in the Grassroots, Joy wanted to get to the root of the generational and partisan misunderstandings she witnesses regularly in her environmental science and policy career. By extrapolating on the legislative victories of the 1970s and the legacies of protest that proceeded them, she speculates on how to mimic the same environmental progress in today’s polarized climate and hopes to share her passion for empathetic communication with the world.

When she is not pondering the “bigger picture” of climate change, Joy devotes her time to cartooning, hiking, distance running, and tackling her academic workload. As a Gen-Zer, she admits that she is also overcoming a healthy addiction to reading webcomics on Instagram.

For more information you can connect with Joy at joy.reeves@duke.edu or on her LinkedIn page.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GrowingUpInTheGrassroots and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

I appreciate all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Joy

story:
Inside Gamergate

Hello there.

My name is James 'Grim' Desborough. I was involved in Gamergate since before it was Gamergate and remained involved all the way through - right up until it began to sputter out.

I am a tabletop game designer and writer with a keen interest in history, politics and the story of what you might call 'geek media'.

I'm old enough to remember The Satanic Panic and the PMRC, old enough to remember Jack Thompson's crusade against violent video games. I've researched and read about previous moral panics, such as Wertham's 'Seduction of the Innocent' in the comics world, and I see the conflict between 'SJWs' and 'Gamergate' (and its legacy) very much in the paradigm of these previous panics and fights.

Having been part of Gamergate, through all its highs and lows, I am worried - now - with censorship on platforms like Wikipedia and with books and campaigns by the 'victims' of Gamergate that this event will go into the history books with a very one-sided, lopsided and biased view of what happened - and why.

As a historian this concerns me, as a Gamergater this concerns me, as someone who cares about truth that concerns me. It's important to me, and it should be important to everyone, that this event goes into the historical record with a complete and rounded view.

You can help make that happen.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm after a base amount of money to, basically, pay my 'wage' for two months to complete this project. This will give me the space and security to pursue writing this, along with enough room for people to suggest contributions and to help with aspects of research. That's the other, main thing I need - community buy in.

What you get is a chance to help me enter into the record a comprehensive - but personal and approachable - guide to the events of Gamergate from Gamergate's perspective.

I think it's important to have a personal and perspective-led view as a counter to 'Literally Who's' forthcoming book which will have its own, extremely biased perspective, well divorced from reality, but fitting the existing media narrative.#

Journalist Brad Glasgow is working on a Gamergate book himself, but it promises to be more of a statistic-led, neutral viewpoint. I think we need something else to counter the perspective of the anti-Gamergate people.

Additional funding will go towards art and editing, to create a better final product.

If we get to $1,500 I'll commission an original cover. If we get to $2,000 I'll shell out for a full, professional edit.

The Impact

This is a real opportunity to tell the story of Gamergate from inside Gamergate. To record its perspective, through me, on key events and controversies. To explain why gamers were so pissed off and to place it in its proper context. To explain to 'normies' (reeeee) how Chans work, what Trolling actually is and the value of rare Pepes.

Do you want Gamergate to continue to be a black mark against people, even though it 'dindu nuffin'? Do you want to be dismissed as a bunch of 'internet thugs' and to be gamedropped every time someone wants to say something bad about the internet space? Do you want to be used as an excuse to censor and control online spaces or do you want an alternative out there that explains our point of view? Do you want people to ignorantly call you racist, sexist or whatever else, because they can't detect irony, sarcasm or keep up with memes?

This isn't my first rodeo on crowdfunded projects and I have a 100% success rate - sometimes late, but never failed. This book WILL happen, especially since it's all on me. It just needs you to help fund it

Risks & Challenges

There's a number of things that could get in the way of immediate success and it's good to be up front about them.

1. I suffer from depression. This means, sometimes, I can be knocked out for days, weeks, even a month at a time. This hasn't happened in a couple of years now - the months - but I do still have low days and even suicidal ideation. This is not to elicit sympathy, but just to warn you that it can cause delays. I am medicated but medication for depression is a two-edged sword, while it can make you functional it can dent creativity, so you're always adjusting to try and maximise both. It sucks. As it happens, that depression is another reason I really want to write this, I had a bout of suicidal behaviour during Gamergate and it was people within Gamergate who came together to make sure I was OK. They may have saved my life.

2. The more time passes the harder it is to find and filter information about the events of Gamergate. With so much of it happening on ephemeral social media such as Twitter and with censorship running rampant, many accounts - and their interactions - are deleted. This will make research etc rather challenging. While I'm going for a 'gonzo' PoV style, I'd still like to back up with information and links where possible. I'll need community help on research.

3. Attempts to publish material about Gamergate, games for example, have met with censorship and downlisting before. This shouldn't happen on a platform like Amazon - where we would likely, ultimately, be selling the book but it is a potential issue on other sales platforms.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.

Help me research.

With other books coming out, while I'm passionate about this project I'm going to be busy for a while and unable to really promote this fundraiser. That means it's down to you if you want to see it happen. Share the shit out of it, talk about it, talk to me if you believe in the project and feel me out about it.

Given the sheer scope of Gamergate and the difficulty from so much of it happening on social media I'm also going to need help researching the various events and parts of it. That's another important way you can help - even if you can't donate.

Given that there are other books on this forthcoming it won't be the absolute end of the world if this book doesn't happen, but I do think it's important that we have a personal viewpoint from within the movement alongside the other material that's forthcoming.

I may not be the absolute best person to do it, but I'm up there. I have the writing chops, I have the historical and political perspective, I understand how it fits into a broader social and historical framework.

I think I can do you proud.

Inside Gamergate
Hello there.
My name is James 'Grim' Desborough. I was involved in Gamergate since before it was Gamergate and remained involved all the way through - right up until it began to sputter out.I am a tabletop game designer and writer with a keen interest in history, politics and the story of what you might call 'geek media'.
I'm old enough to remember The Satanic Panic and the PMRC, old enough to remember Jack Thompson's crusade against violent video games. I've researched and read about previous moral panics, such as Wertham's 'Seduction of the Innocent' in the comics world, and I see the conflict between 'SJWs' and 'Gamergate' (and its legacy) very much in the paradigm of these previous panics and fights.
Having been part of Gamergate, through all its highs and lows, I am worried - now - with censorship on platforms like Wikipedia and with books and campaigns by the 'victims' of Gamergate that this event will go into the history books with a very one-sided, lopsided and biased view of what happened - and why.
As a historian this concerns me, as a Gamergater this concerns me, as someone who cares about truth that concerns me. It's important to me, and it should be important to everyone, that this event goes into the historical record with a complete and rounded view.
You can help make that happen.

What I Need & What You Get
I'm after a base amount of money to, basically, pay my 'wage' for two months to complete this project. This will give me the space and security to pursue writing this, along with enough room for people to suggest contributions and to help with aspects of research. That's the other, main thing I need - community buy in.
What you get is a chance to help me enter into the record a comprehensive - but personal and approachable - guide to the events of Gamergate from Gamergate's perspective.
I think it's important to have a personal and perspective-led view as a counter to 'Literally Who's' forthcoming book which will have its own, extremely biased perspective, well divorced from reality, but fitting the existing media narrative.#
Journalist Brad Glasgow is working on a Gamergate book himself, but it promises to be more of a statistic-led, neutral viewpoint. I think we need something else to counter the perspective of the anti-Gamergate people.
Additional funding will go towards art and editing, to create a better final product.
If we get to $1,500 I'll commission an original cover. If we get to $2,000 I'll shell out for a full, professional edit.

The Impact
This is a real opportunity to tell the story of Gamergate from inside Gamergate. To record its perspective, through me, on key events and controversies. To explain why gamers were so pissed off and to place it in its proper context. To explain to 'normies' (reeeee) how Chans work, what Trolling actually is and the value of rare Pepes.
Do you want Gamergate to continue to be a black mark against people, even though it 'dindu nuffin'? Do you want to be dismissed as a bunch of 'internet thugs' and to be gamedropped every time someone wants to say something bad about the internet space? Do you want to be used as an excuse to censor and control online spaces or do you want an alternative out there that explains our point of view? Do you want people to ignorantly call you racist, sexist or whatever else, because they can't detect irony, sarcasm or keep up with memes?

story:
Problem Statement

For reasons I can't quite locate or explain, my awakening on the climate crisis occurred slowly and relatively late in my political awakening.

I am indeed part and parcel of the mainstream of generations since the US civil rights movement, whose political concerns encompassed deep awareness of social injustice.  And I share Gen X, millennial, and Z generations' regard for the environment and concerns about a changing climate.  Through work in sustainable city planning at the Mayor's Office of Operations in New York City and reading about accumulating dangers, I began to see the signal to act with even more urgency than I had in the past to dislodge our domestic politics and the international system's stagnancy. 

As David Wallace-Wells describes artfully in his book The Uninhabitable Earth, in just the last 30 years, or about the entirety of my life, over half of the humanities' contributions to greenhouse gases were emitted.  That is, in all the hundreds of millennia before, and again in the last thirty years, we have shifted the earth's planetary system drastically off balance and onto a dangerous and lethal course.

Indeed, as he writes:  "Global warming, in other words, is more than just one input in an equation to determine carrying capacity; it is the set of conditions under which all of our experiments to improve that capacity will be conducted. In this way, climate change appears to be not merely one challenge among may facing a planet already struggling with civil strife and war and horrifying inequality and far too many other insoluble hardships to iterate, but the all-encompassing stage on which all those challenges will be met—a whole sphere in other words, which literally contains within it all of the worlds' future problems and all of its possible solutions." (Wallace-Wells p. 53)

What also accompanies this personal awareness is the collective awakening of the precarity of our already troubled present with crises in democracy in the US and racism and moral disregard. This book project prompts us to take the challenges revealed by the coronavirus crisis and concurrent tests to US democracy as fuel to meet the still possible opportunities to divert our future climate and democratic courses.

This book will be a vehicle for seeing the obstacles that threaten climate progress in American politics and the international system, based in my perspective shaped by many years of graduate research, policy planning, reading, and writing. In a time of racial unrest, it is also a chance to invest in a first-time author of color, whose intention is to make his hand accessible to those who do not have a completed college education.

Through its accessible reading level considerations and Spanish language translation, the author hopes to shape the book's content presentation for the broadest range of audiences of interested readers.

The book will also be a primer for understanding US politics in the 2020s because no intimate knowledge of climate change, US culture, or international politics is presumed. After reading Marathon, I hope the audience of readers will better see and have the transnational frameworks to contextualize systems of governance and domestic political opportunities for climate and democratic progress.

 

Short Summary: Author

  • Author, Darius Callier, 30, threads together cultural theory, developments in American politics, climate science policy, political economy, social policy, and international relations. His writing agenda is hybridized in two senses: its interdisciplinary reach and its language stylization at a broadly accessible reading level. Both dimmensions connect an audience of those who read journalism regularly and those who follow politics as a hobby to academics engaged in data analysis, research and theory.
  • Darius works as a freelance writer, education consultant, writing coach, and health and economic policy research assistant at Georgetown Law School Center's Economic Security and Opportunity Initiative. Previously, he served as a policy analyst for project management at New York City's Mayor's Office of Operations, and performed policy analysis, improved management processes, implemented local legislation, liased with state and federal government, and shaped policy implementation on initiatives pertaining to public health, housing and homelessness, economic development, sustainability, and climate adaptation.
  • Darius holds a B.A. from Lehigh University in Philosophy and Political Science, studied in the Development Management and Policy dual graduate program at Georgetown University, Universidad Nacional de San Martin (Buenos Aires, Argentina), and is preparing a graduate thesis in international political economy and comparative social policy for defense in December 2020. Concurrently, Darius is also a predoctoral affiliate of the Institut Barcelona d'Estudis Internacionals in Barcelona.

Short Summary: Marathon: The World's Jagged Race to 2030

  • The Marathon book will be a broad survey of the international politics of climate change, and seeks to contribute novel insights on the administrative, social, and political  burdens that subnational governments inherit when national governments fail to meet or intentionally shift critical priorities from climate mandates, which are growing more pressing with each passing year.
  • The book seeks to drive a compelling narrative about the world's marathon effort to divert most catastrophic potentials of the global climate crisis through the world's waves of authoritarianism and yawning wealth and income inequality.

What I Need & Where Your Investment Helps

  • As a first time author, who intends to self-publish, I need the following to write the full 90,000 word manuscript, as there is no book advance in self-publishing. However, I will retain creative rights, which might ultimately be more valuable.
  • Online Certificate Program (to structure writing pacing and research yet to be done): $1,905
  • Building online platforms (to implement book’s business plan): $2,027
  • Writing Retreat and Lodging: $4,876
  • Associated Traveling Costs: $761
  • CISI International Health Insurance (COVID-19 precautions): $623
  • Editing and fact-checking services: $999
  • I am committed to taking the next year to running this “marathon” to a finished book manuscript, building on prior writing and research from graduate school, and structuring my yearlong writing plan alongside a certificate program’s assignment prompts.  What is more, the book project is so high a priority that I, the author, am moving from the United States in October 2020, in order to sit right on the edge of its society and to have the ability to focus to see it all more clearly from outside of its current chaos!
  • If I don't reach the entire fundraising goal the collected funds will go to a more limited set of writing projects.

 

Book Proposal:

Manuscript: 90,000 words, 360 pages double-spaced

Writing Period: Manuscript from October – April 2021

Release August 2021

Target audience: Avid reader, partial or completed college education, 20s - 80s, who might have an interest in sustainable development, climate crisis, American politics, Global Cities, or international affairs, but no prior urban planning, political science, or economics training.

Topics: Climate crisis, race, gender, sustainable development, international politics, international system, relations of global cities, competitive authoritarianism, political economy, transnational regulation, coronavirus pandemic, inequality

Area studies: 

Primary focuses with specialization: EU, US, Latin America

Secondary focuses without specialization: Middle East, China, Africa, South East Asia, Artic, Antarctic, and Pacific

Risks & Challenges

  • My graduate school and freelance experiences demonstrate my ability to tackle subject matter from many different disciplinary lenses, as well as my writing endurance and discipline to apply sustained effort, but I have never yet written a book length manuscript. Still, the book project rests on the research momentum of my graduate thesis, which means the writing process benefits from that work.

  • For pacing my writing and for completing research yet to be done: I plan to enroll in an online Certificate Program, in order to fill my writing outline with research and inspiration from assignment prompts at the Institut Barcelona d’Estudis Internacionals (IBEI), Barcelona, Spain: November 2020 – April 2021.

Other Ways You Can Help

In the midst of crisis, I want to be especially cognizant that many will be eager to but can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help get the word out about my book project and me as a first time author of color.
  • Indiegogo is connected to a number of share tools to help publicize my fundraiser.
  • Share Author's Twitter: @lamontllier
  • Share Author's Instagram: @lamontllier
  • Share Author's LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/darius-l-callier-11...
  • Share Author's Medium page: https://medium.com/@dariuslamontcallier

And that's all there is to it. Thank you for your consideration and potentially for your investment.

WANT TO BUY THE BOOK IN £GBP? CLICK HERE

New Routes to Funding - THE Crowdfunding guide for Business Advisers & Mentors, Business Owners & Startups

"The combination of the theory and all the data was a real eye-opener for us. So we can see it becoming more and more a mainstream option for business advisers."
Steve Carroll, Professional Business Advisor, on the Crowdonomic MINT




We’ve written a new, much needed, book. It's based on a new, crystal-clear, model that explains how crowdfunding works and how to use it in ways never before possible.

But it’s not just us saying this. We’ve asked some of the most renowned experts in their field for feedback, and they’re telling us – with big grins on their faces – that this is "The 'Handbook' of Crowdfunding". So...

We want to make sure that New Routes to Funding lands on the desks of every adviser working with business owners, and works its way to the very heart of business fundraising across the world. Because we want entrepreneurs everywhere to benefit.

And to do that we need your help.
(...and.. Yes, we’re crowdfunding a book on crowdfunding. How cool is that?)

"The Handbook of Crowdfunding"

Kathleen Minogue, Crowdfund Better

Written By Barry E James



How We Got Started? - Watch The Video...

We want to raise $5,000 to help fund this venture, which will ultimately help you fund your own venture. We’re offering some great perks - INCLUDING early access to the book – plus some with extra special, unique features from our conference coming up in November.

All with the knowledge and new insights that comes from our research into more than 400,000 crowdfunds, across a variety of platforms and 40 categories, across the world.

Share This & Win An Exclusive 1-1 With The Author

Simply share this campaign page using #NRTF and you will have a chance of winning a consultation with author, Barry E James. At the end of the campaign we will select a shared post from Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn and each will receive a 30 minute phone / skype conversation with Barry.

> SHARE THIS ON TWITTER

> SHARE THIS ON FACEBOOK

> SHARE THIS ON LINKEDIN

Based on Years of Research and Over 400K Campaigns
 

We all know that crowdfunding has the potential to help people launch and grow their businesses and to help people create more jobs and livelihoods, to boost the economy and to change lives.

But crowdfunding not only helps those who need it to raise funds, but crucially it can unlock more traditional sources of funding.

The truth is that the much of the phenomenal potential of crowdfunding is being wasted: Our research tells us that four out of five campaigns fail, almost always for lack of crowdfunding know-how and basic insights into what makes a successful campaign. We want to turn that around.

After years of research, involving more than 400,000 campaigns and their outcomes, we've worked out how to remove the obstacles, so that many more people can benefit – New Routes to Funding will transform what has often been a daunting, hit-and-miss approach to crowdfunding with a unique crowdfunding, clear, framework that everyone can understand and follow.

Crowdonomics MINT

Why Did You Create The Crowdonomics MINT? - Watch The Video...

We’ve called this The Crowdonomics MINT model - a unique, clear crowdfunding framework that leads to a deeper understanding of the intricacies of crowdfunding and guides you through the process, every step of the way. MINT is new tool for understanding crowdfunding's dynamic and how to harness and use it, alone and in combinations, providing the means to unlock more familiar sources of funding.  

New Routes to Funding explains in plain terms:

  • How it really works
  • Who can use it - and how
  • How it can be used to transform a venture, large or small
  • And how crowdfunding can unlock other sources of finance

New Routes to Funding will also:

  • provide the means for innovators and entrepreneurs to hone their skills
  • prove the worth of their proposition 
  • and accelerate their venture 

So we hope you'll join us on our quest to transform the funding landscape. 

"We've barely scratched the surface of the potential so far. Now that we understand, in depth, how the engine of crowdfunding really works we are ready to go mainstream - and put to full use the experience, insights and learning from all the big-data and research we've accumulated and analysed".  

The Background
 

This new book from Barry E James, Founder and CEO of The Crowdfunding Center, and acknowledged authority on Crowdfunding uncovers the dynamics and mechanics - and so the true potential of this vital force for business creation and innovation.

CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD THE BACKGROUND TO THE BOOK

About The Author
 


Barry E James, founder and CEO of The Crowdfunding Center and The Crowd Data Center, is a serial entrepreneur, business mentor and consultant who’s ‘seen it all’ when it comes to investments, from both sides of the table, as well as being an acknowledged authority speaking and writing around the world on crowdfunding, fintech and alternative finance. 

Founder and instigateur of...

  • TheCrowdfundingCenter and TheCrowdDataCenter
  • Crowdfunding DeepImpact Conferences
  • UK Crowdfunding Week
  • TheSocialFoundation
  • FundingHubs

 

 

If you have any questions at all or would like further information about any of the perks, please contact us here or using the 'Ask a question' link at the top of the campaign.

Risks & Challenges
 

We're working hard on mapping out our editorial timelines to ensure that we will deliver rewards to you on time.

My team and I have great experience of publishing between us and we are comfortable working with each other and with demanding editorial deadlines. However, there can always be delays during an editorial and printing process that could result in pushing a ship date.

We will keep you informed throughout the editorial process of our progress and major milestones, as well as any delays.

The preliminary research of New Routes To Funding has been completed, but I have allocated time writing and researching the remainder of the book in order to have a manuscript ready in time.

We will ship the eBook to you soon as it's ready for release  The printing and shipping process will take another 1-2 months, approximately, and final hard copy books will ship to you in spring 2017.

We plan on working closely with the design team and printer to ensure the smoothest production possible and, if funded, will update backers regularly on each step of the process.

PLEASE CHOOSE A PERK & BACK THE CAMPAIGN NOW...

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
What is Timshel and Why I am Writing it 

Hi!  My name is Bonnie, and I am writing a new Bible translation.  Even though I have my Masters of Theology from Fuller Theological Seminary,  have been in a pastoral role for the past 5 years and am a theologian, I have always had a hard time connecting with the Bible on a personal level.  The characters of the Bible often seemed idealistic to me and many of the interpretations of the text were shallow and hard to identify with.  

Timshel translation is for those who feel spiritually homeless or on the fringes of the Christian map. It is for you and for me and for all of us who are in process and need a new way to experience Jesus.  It is for all of us who have ever picked up the Bible and wanted more context and information because it can be hard to understand.  Timshel is for those of us who believe that Scripture is alive and beautiful and want to find new meaning inside of it.  It is a new way to read the Bible that sets the stage for creative interpretation, questions, wrestling and dialogue.

The Bible is about what it means to be human and how God interacts with us along the journey.  

When I preach and speak at churches, I dive deep into the text we are discussing and look at it from every angle: the historical and cultural background, word studies in the original language, commentaries on the passage at hand, the way the passage fits within the whole Biblical narrative, and the literary genre of the book.  Looking at all these different parts of the text allows us to understand the text and the characters through a deeper dimension, by understanding how their lives and circumstances affected them on a very personal level.  

Each time I share the passages through this new lens, people always tell me it was "something they never heard before" or that it "woke something up inside of them."  I believe that the Bible has something to say to all of us, but not just how we are to live.  

The Bible is a collection of poems, letters, and stories of different literary genres that have historical data, and meaning found in the original language. Timshel translation combines these intellectual disciplines with the historical and cultural vernacular. Timshel brings out the emotions, thoughts, struggles, triumphs, and psychological journeys that the Biblical characters are going through.  These efforts create a Bible translation in which readers can find a point of connection to their own inner journeys and personhood.

The Product and the Process

Timshel translation is a collection of 20 different Bible passages translated in a whole new way.  To mirror the beauty and depth of the Bible itself, we have decided to print this translation to be beautiful and aesthetically pleasing.  

Designer and artist, Katie Noel, who designed our logo, will also be creating a limited edition book cover.  Her design will be foil stamped as seen in the mockup:

The softcover editions will include the exclusively designed book cover, foil stamped and expertly put together.  The cover and pages are of finest quality and the dimension of the book reflect that of a novel so that it is easy to carry with you. 

The hardcover edition of the book will include the exclusively designed cover foil stamped on hand-woven linen fabric.  The cover and pages are of finest quality and the dimension of the book reflect that of a novel so that it is easy to carry with you. Each book is expertly sewn and handmade. 

Each of these editions will also include limited edition 20 pieces of artwork on colored, glossy paper, that reflect the new themes of each story found in Timshel.  

If this project gets fully funded, I will be translating the following 20  passages* of the Bible:

Old Testament

 Creation: Genesis 2-3

 Tower of Babel: Genesis 11

 Binding of Isaac: Genesis 22:1-23:2

 The Exodus: Exodus 7:1-14:31

 Ruth

Psalm 23 

Proverbs 31

The Land of Dry Bones: Ezekiel 37:1-5

Death of Moses

Jonah

New Testament: 

 Parable of the Talents: Matthew 25:14-30

 Word Became Flesh: John 1:1-18

 Nicodemus: John 3:1-21 

 Jesus Anointed by a Sinful Woman: Luke 7:36-50

 Mary and Martha: Luke 10:38-42 

 Jesus and the Syrophonecian Woman

Beatitudes

Jesus Heals the Bleeding Woman

Philippians 2:5-7

 Death and Resurrection of Jesus: Matthew 27-28, Mark 15-16, Luke 22-24, John 18-21

*The exact verses of these passages are subject to change, and due to the literary genre of some passages, not all verses will be translated directly, or as in the case for the Birth of Jesus narrative, more than one book will be combined to form a more complete angle.  

I will be doing the translating, but will be working with a Psychologist and Creative writer, Kyle Horst, as well as professional editor, Jeremy Armstrong, and graphic designers to assist in the creative process as well as fine-tuning all of the writing elements.  

Our timeline is to have two passages translated on average every month, giving ourselves 10 months for the writing and editing process.  We then have up to four months in the schedule for proofing, printing, and shipping so the books will be in your hands by February 2020, one year after the completion of this campaign!

How it Will Read

In order to understand our work process as a team, as well as give you a sample of what this translation will read like, we have completed one our chosen passages from the Old Testament and provided you with the text.  Below you will find Genesis 22:1-23:1, "The Binding of Isaac" from Timshel translation.  We suggest you read this story in your standard translation first for an accurate juxtaposition.  

"The Binding of Isaac", Genesis 22:1-Genesis 23:1, Timshel

22 Years after Abraham had moved to Canaan and had the promise of his son fulfilled in Isaac, an ethereal voice called out to him in a dream. Abraham believed the summons came from Elohim, one of the pagan gods he worshiped, a god whose voice he heard when he left Ur. Yet, unbeknownst to Abraham, the pagan gods had remained silent, and it was Yahweh who spoke. Yahweh yearned to uncover Abraham’s ancestral convictions—to figure out what he still clung to and what he was willing to leave behind. He was measuring Abraham’s faith while Abraham was intent on discerning Elohim’s place in the divine hierarchy.

“Abraham, Father of Multitudes! Are you with me?” came the resounding voice. Although dreaming, Abraham responded, “Yes. All of me is here. I am not distracted or divided. I see you, and I hear you.” 2 Yahweh brought a request to Abraham, one to which He gave Abraham complete free will to accept or deny, “Please,  take your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I will tell you.” 3 On waking from the dream, Abraham, father of, actually, only one—rose with the sun and saddled his donkey. He did not question Yahweh or dispute this request. Deliberately and precisely he cut the wood for the burnt offering, and with two servants and his son, he went to the place where Yahweh directed him. 

4 The trip’s weight burdened Abraham, and despite—or perhaps because of—his free will in the matter, he moved slowly with his eyes down. His journey was equally both inward and onward. Neither Isaac nor Abraham spoke along the path; for three days they traveled in silence, each playing the impending events in their minds. While Abraham believed in child sacrifice and its ability to grant favor, the weight of its now-personal consequences clung to him while he hauled this internal conflict up the mountain. 

At the same time, Isaac dutifully took a path he had traveled many times before: the gods called, and he went. Both of them understood sacrifice as an offering of the devout, a plea for respite in times of distress—a universal acknowledgment of the gods’ rite over the first fruits of a human’s labor. All reasons justified and deserving, yet with no clarity for the rationale of the impending ceremony. On the third day, Abraham arrived at the place Yahweh had directed him.

Capitulation to the gods had plagued him his entire life up until this point. Abraham always operated within an inherited belief system, yet the voice of Yahweh was different—Yahweh asked for connection instead of submission. Never born strictly out of obedience, true righteousness is begotten from mutual and worthy expectations. Abraham followed the voice of Yahweh out of Ur and into Canan; he left his tribe and family to do what this god said. But today, with his son on the altar the unique, intimate, voice of Yahweh left Abraham wrestling.

Since Abraham left Ur, Yahweh’s interaction with him functioned in the realm of kinship—a new set of beliefs marked by partnership between God and a human being. Abraham burned with great faith, but his faith was better defined as an active movement—a journey. Since encountering Yahweh, each sacred stage of life stretched and pulled his faith. Far from the old ways, this new faith was constantly redefined as he learned what fit and what didn’t, who Yahweh was and who he wasn’t. The old system sufficed until he himself held crying parents in his arms and carried dead children to their graves. Then the ways of his ancestors faltered in his heart, but they even still had a grip on him. Abraham desperately wanted to leave these ways behind but he needed divine permission to do so.  

The place where the sacrifice would occur came into view, and Abraham feared his old convictions would outrun his new pace. All rituals eventually become predictable and unvarying, and the steps ahead were clear: he would walk, worship, and build the altar, as was expected for a sacrifice. However this time, he would be giving his own test, as well. It was a trial to both himself and Yahweh, a type of quest for identity and character. Abraham was a man too focused on righteousness and faithfulness to disobey, but he desperately needed absolution on this particular sacrifice. His faith preservation required Yahweh to speak once again and confirm the relationship, as well as the justice, love, and mercy he had suspected. 

He needed Yahweh to show up—to meet him on the mountain and stop the prevailing inequity he’d known for so long. Without Yahweh’s divine interception, he feared he would go through with the sacrifice—a choice that would unearth his darkest corners, never to be buried again. 5 Then Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey; I and the boy will go over there and worship and come again to you.” 

6 And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. And he took in his hand the fire and the knife. So they went both of them together, as one mind, like father, like son. 7 And Isaac said to his father, “Daddy!” In the midst of Abraham’s search for truth, Isaac searched for the man he knew Abraham to be: his dad. “I see you, and I hear you,” Abraham responded. Isaac revealed his own awareness when he asked the obvious question: “We have the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb?” 

8 With sorrow, Abraham answered, “Yahweh will provide for himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” Walking side by side, their steps weighted by difference, experience, and perspective, Abraham was never more aware of how alike the two had become. As modeled by his father, Isaac loyally followed him up the mountain. So they went, both of them together—like father, like son.

9 When they came to the designated place, Abraham built an altar, laid the wood in the proper order, bound Isaac, and laid him on the altar on top of the wood. Isaac did not resist because Abraham had raised him to believe his own existence was disposable if the gods demanded it. Their religion depended on this ultimate possibility. Isaac did not argue. His silence was excruciating. Like father, like son. 

10 Then Abraham reached out his hand and took the knife to sacrifice his son. 11 A combination of betrayal, horror, and blind devotion to his father rose to the surface in Isaac. Suddenly, the angel of Yahweh called to him from heaven, “Abraham, Abraham! Father of Multitudes!” Breathless and covered in sweat, Abraham could barely get the words out, “Here I am.” At the same moment, Isaac gasped and released the breath he held as if full lungs would have blunted the knife. 

12 At that moment the angel said, “Do not lay your hand on the boy or do anything to him.” The holy permission Abraham needed so desperately had come! The blessing to break ancient ways! Yahweh had seenhim and heardhim­­—heard his innermost thoughts, traced his conflicts and held them with care when they ebbed and flowed. He never left Abraham’s side. He journeyed with him, talking to Abraham in the sacrificial language he would know and understand. It was a stark contrast to the moral fiber of the pagan gods: Yahweh would never ask his worshipers for their firstborn son. 13 And Abraham lifted his eyes and saw a ram caught in a thicket by his horns. With a thud, the knife hit the ground and Abraham severed the cords that bound Isaac, who collapsed in his arms. Then Abraham seized the ram to replace his son. 

14 So Abraham named the mountain, “Yahweh will provide.” And it is called, even to this day, “On the mount of Yahweh it shall be provided.” Yahweh had provided much more than a ram that day. Abraham and Yahweh had encountered one another on the mountain, willing to put the other on trial for the sake of a new direction. Yahweh acted in a way Abraham yearned for and needed—a compassionate measure to put his former beliefs to death and raise new ones to life. Yahweh provided pardon where there once was death, forgiveness where there once was shame, and grace where there once was demand. Instantly the old ways of worship were made obsolete. The new day had arrived. 

15 And the angel of Yahweh called to Abraham a second time from heaven 16 and said, “Your character has been made clear to me, and mine has been made clear to you. I do not resemble the gods of your past. While the other gods ask for your children, I have saved Isaac and will bless you with more. 17 I will surely multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven and as the sand on the seashore. And your offspring shall possess the gate of his enemies, 18 and in your offspring shall all the nations of the earth be blessed because you have listened to my voice and heard my heart.” 19 Abraham and Isaac returned to the young men who accompanied them on their journey, and they all arose and went together to Beersheba.

Father and son had much to discuss—to forgive. Pain, betrayal, hurt, and confusion plagued Issac, and the journey home gave appropriate space.  Unraveling beliefs marked the odyssey down the mountain, which from there would spread out to the infinite. Like father, like son, they began the process of grief, evolution, and eventually celebration. Finally, freedom belonged to them! And Abraham lived at Beersheba. 

23 Upon Abraham and Isaac’s arrival, Sarah could not be found. She had gotten word of the purpose of Abraham’s trip and could not bear to live a life without her son. 2 Moving to Kiriath-arba (Hebron) Sarah grieved the loss of her son, the betrayal of her husband and the resulting state of her broken marriage. She rued the barbaric ways of the gods, and the many years she had spent in devotion to them. Her grief was too much to bear, and she died of a broken heart. Abraham received word of her death and went to weep for her. His anguish forever altered his existence. With his new faith still expanding, he had another piece to consider: Yahweh intervened on the mountain to deliver Isaac, but where was Yahweh to rescue Sarah? 

The Rewards

We are excited to give you the option of a hardcover, softcover, digital or audio edition of the book. Each one (minus the audio) comes with the exclusive cover design and 20 pieces of artwork designed specifically for Timshel.

The Cost

The first go-round of Timshel on Kickstarter covered the cost of the video, paid the editor, psychologist, designers, and all of the printer costs and the books that would be printed.  While I translated the project, I did not receive anything for the work that I did as the number we set was only to break even. 

Over the past nine months, I have received email after email about Timshel and the impact it has already has been HUGE.  In addition, I receive emails from women on the daily about learning to have courage to step out into their gifting and calling and to stop asking permission.  I have the honor of talking with these women and speaking all about equality in the church for men and women, yet, I did not make room to be paid for my own life's work.  

I realized that I would never tell any of these other women that they should do their life's work without getting paid.  

Whatever you contribute this time around will go to the cost of printing your book and then any left over will allow me to continue to do this work that I am here to do.  I have big plans for Timshel, ways to make the Bible more accessible and use my creative bones to get it done, but all of that costs money.  I am eager to keep on serving you and giving you a place and space (like a website and other resources) to look at the Bible in a brand new lens and your contribution will help make this happen.  

Thank you for your support and contributing to our  campaign! We are so excited to get Timshel into your hands!

Risks and challenges

We are on our way to print which is why this campaign has such a short run time! We want to make sure that you receive your copy as soon as possible.

Without Yahweh’s divine interception, he feared he would go through with the sacrifice—a choice that would unearth his darkest corners, never to be buried again. 5 Then Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey; I and the boy will go over there and worship and come again to you.” 6 And Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. And he took in his hand the fire and the knife. So they went both of them together, as one mind, like father, like son. 7 And Isaac said to his father, “Daddy!” In the midst of Abraham’s search for truth, Isaac searched for the man he knew Abraham to be: his dad. “I see you, and I hear you,” Abraham responded. Isaac revealed his own awareness when he asked the obvious question: “We have the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb?” 8 With sorrow, Abraham answered, “Yahweh will provide for himself the lamb for a burnt offering, my son.” Walking side by side, their steps weighted by difference, experience, and perspective, Abraham was never more aware of how alike the two had become. As modeled by his father, Isaac loyally followed him up the mountain. So they went, both of them together—like father, like son.9 When they came to the designated place, Abraham built an altar, laid the wood in the proper order, bound Isaac, and laid him on the altar on top of the wood. Isaac did not resist because Abraham had raised him to believe his own existence was disposable if the gods demanded it. Their religion depended on this ultimate possibility. Isaac did not argue. His silence was excruciating. Like father, like son. 10 Then Abraham reached out his hand and took the knife to sacrifice his son. 11 A combination of betrayal, horror, and blind devotion to his father rose to the surface in Isaac. Suddenly, the angel of Yahweh called to him from heaven, “Abraham, Abraham! Father of Multitudes!” Breathless and covered in sweat, Abraham could barely get the words out, “Here I am.” At the same moment, Isaac gasped and released the breath he held as if full lungs would have blunted the knife. 12 At that moment the angel said, “Do not lay your hand on the boy or do anything to him.” The holy permission Abraham needed so desperately had come! The blessing to break ancient ways! Yahweh had seenhim and heardhim­­—heard his innermost thoughts, traced his conflicts and held them with care when they ebbed and flowed. He never left Abraham’s side. He journeyed with him, talking to Abraham in the sacrificial language he would know and understand. It was a stark contrast to the moral fiber of the pagan gods: Yahweh would never ask his worshipers for their firstborn son. 13 And Abraham lifted his eyes and saw a ram caught in a thicket by his horns. With a thud, the knife hit the ground and Abraham severed the cords that bound Isaac, who collapsed in his arms. Then Abraham seized the ram to replace his son. 14 So Abraham named the mountain, “Yahweh will provide.” And it is called, even to this day, “On the mount of Yahweh it shall be provided.” Yahweh had provided much more than a ram that day. Abraham and Yahweh had encountered one another on the mountain, willing to put the other on trial for the sake of a new direction. Yahweh acted in a way Abraham yearned for and needed—a compassionate measure to put his former beliefs to death and raise new ones to life. Yahweh provided pardon where there once was death, forgiveness where there once was shame, and grace where there once was demand. Instantly the old ways of worship were made obsolete. The new day had arrived. 15 And the angel of Yahweh called to Abraham a second time from heaven 16 and said, “Your character has been made clear to me, and mine has been made clear to you. I do not resemble the gods of your past. While the other gods ask for your children, I have saved Isaac and will bless you with more. 17 I will surely multiply your offspring as the stars of heaven and as the sand on the seashore. And your offspring shall possess the gate of his enemies, 18 and in your offspring shall all the nations of the earth be blessed because you have listened to my voice and heard my heart.” 19 Abraham and Isaac returned to the young men who accompanied them on their journey, and they all arose and went together to Beersheba.Father and son had much to discuss—to forgive. Pain, betrayal, hurt, and confusion plagued Issac, and the journey home gave appropriate space.  Unraveling beliefs marked the odyssey down the mountain, which from there would spread out to the infinite. Like father, like son, they began the process of grief, evolution, and eventually celebration. Finally, freedom belonged to them! And Abraham lived at Beersheba. 23 Upon Abraham and Isaac’s arrival, Sarah could not be found. She had gotten word of the purpose of Abraham’s trip and could not bear to live a life without her son. 2 Moving to Kiriath-arba (Hebron) Sarah grieved the loss of her son, the betrayal of her husband and the resulting state of her broken marriage. She rued the barbaric ways of the gods, and the many years she had spent in devotion to them. Her grief was too much to bear, and she died of a broken heart. Abraham received word of her death and went to weep for her. His anguish forever altered his existence. With his new faith still expanding, he had another piece to consider: Yahweh intervened on the mountain to deliver Isaac, but where was Yahweh to rescue Sarah? The RewardsWe are excited to give you the option of a hardcover, softcover, digital or audio edition of the book. Each one (minus the audio) comes with the exclusive cover design and 20 pieces of artwork designed specifically for Timshel.The CostThe first go-round of Timshel on Kickstarter covered the cost of the video, paid the editor, psychologist, designers, and all of the printer costs and the books that would be printed.  While I translated the project, I did not receive anything for the work that I did as the number we set was only to break even. Over the past nine months, I have received email after email about Timshel and the impact it has already has been HUGE.  In addition, I receive emails from women on the daily about learning to have courage to step out into their gifting and calling and to stop asking permission.  I have the honor of talking with these women and speaking all about equality in the church for men and women, yet, I did not make room to be paid for my own life's work.  I realized that I would never tell any of these other women that they should do their life's work without getting paid.  Whatever you contribute this time around will go to the cost of printing your book and then any left over will allow me to continue to do this work that I am here to do.  I have big plans for Timshel, ways to make the Bible more accessible and use my creative bones to get it done, but all of that costs money.  I am eager to keep on serving you and giving you a place and space (like a website and other resources) to look at the Bible in a brand new lens and your contribution will help make this happen.  Thank you for your support and contributing to our  campaign! We are so excited to get Timshel into your hands!Risks and challengesWe are on our way to print which is why this campaign has such a short run time! We want to make sure that you receive your copy as soon as possible.

story:
Summary

  • Ross Cunningham has been working with children for over 40 years. Has a degree in Art and is a dedicated children's artist and storyteller and an ordained minister. He excels in mercy and kindness.
  • This Pre-launch is to help him get his book: " Mr. Ross's World" to the marketplace successfully.
  • Unfortunately, many artists never get the opportunity to release one book much less multiple. Because someone may have great creativity they still may not know how to sell or market their art successfully. Let's help Mr. Ross promote his book. So that this can be his first book, not his last book.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • It cost over $5000 to release a book like this. So selling his initial 400 copies is so important to break even, If we can help him get into profit mode by pre-buying a few books that would be awesome.
  • You get the books at a discount! And you get them autographed by the Author "Mr. Ross"...
  • If we don't reach our goal of $5000 it just means we haven't gotten in profit mode the books are already being printed but let's help Mr. Ross!

 

The Impact

  • Children are so important. This book and future books by Mr. Ross make an impact on children and reach the child in all of us.
  • This Indiegogo campaign makes a big impact on Mr. Ross too because it lets him know you appreciate him and support him and believe in him.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • If this children's book is unsuccessful it will be very difficult for Mr. Ross to continue to make more books, but I know he's just getting started
  • But I know that if we all share this campaign and take advantage of these perks this Book release will be successful and it will get to the right people.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and share this campaign on social media to make some noise about Mr. Ross's campaign!
  • Repost this link on your page and other groups on Facebook.
  • Like and Comment on this post.

 

And that's all there is to it.
