story:
Story of My Book

The Power of Pivot explores the concept of transformation through the stories of women, whether that be physical, emotional, psychological, and/or occupational. The concepts are meant to inspire the reader to realize their own ability to change themselves as well as better adapt to external circumstances that aren’t as controllable.

My name is Alli Esker and I am the author of The Power of Pivot. I wrote this book because I’ve always been fascinated by the idea of change and wanted to explore the intersection of that concept with my passion for women’s empowerment and equality.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will realize or rediscover your own ability to adapt, change, and pivot on your journey through life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for transformation and a growth mindset into your life. Ultimately, I want you to find this book to be a tool to help you find tactical means and real life examples to the changes you wish to see within yourself, your community, and the world.

In this book, you'll learn about the principles of changes that lead to success :

  • A closer look at the human condition - We’ll explore what I call ‘The Female Condition’, and dig into a historical account of women from the neolithic era to present day. She’s had her struggles, whether that be objectification or disenfranchisement, but she’s also had major victories. You’ll see that regardless of the environment, women are specifically able to realize change.
  • Grit and Tenacity - 15 year old Gitanjali Rao is on a mission to solve Flint, Michigan’s water crisis, among a plethora of other passion projects to help enhance the world. You’ll learn from her story that even through criticism and lack of respect due to her age, her never-give-up attitude is what propels her to succeed.
  • The value of curiosity - Asking questions leads to the ability to see things from a different perspective. We’ll dive into the topic of curiosity from both a present-day and historical lens and how it’s impacted the world through the fascinating story of the greatest mariners to every sail the world, the Polynesian Wayfinders, as well as through one of the world’s greatest inventors, Leonardo DaVinci.

You will love this book if you are interested in learning about some principles of change and adaption that I’ve found to be catalysts of success from the female perspective. This book tackles the concept of change from various multi-causal points of view such as biological, economical, or psychological.

The Power of Pivot is a non-fiction book that speaks to women and anyone interested in self-development who are looking at the concept of change told from the perspective of women for the first time.

The Book - The Power of Pivot

The book is written in 3 Parts....

  • Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. I break down the concept of change in an easy to comprehend framework where we’ll deep dive into the question, ‘What creates change?’, and I’ll deconstruct some preconceived notions on the subject. From their you’ll learn about the idea of “The Female Condition” (As mentioned above) from a historical perspective, and learn about the special biological and psychological abilities that women can lean into to succeed.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 2-9. In this section we dig deeper into some principles of change that catalyze success. You’ll learn from both males and females from the historical side and stories from inspiring women today who are practicing these principles, whether that be from being innovative, believing in oneself, or being vulnerable.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 10. It contains the culmination of everywhere we’ve journeyed throughout the book. I tie everything together with an overarching reminder that you yourself are the sole captain of actualizing change and provide some final universal reasons to compel you to do so.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.

  • And more...

About the Author

Alli Esker is a soon-to-be Summa Cum Laude graduate of The Ohio State University majoring in finance and minoring in economics and design thinking.

At The Ohio State University, she’s had the opportunity to expand her worldview and learn from both exceptional faculty and inspiring classmates. Outside of the classroom, Alli is an avid runner, having completed several half marathons, a full marathon, and a 50k ultramarathon. Additionally, she’s a Yoga Alliance RYT200 certified instructor, and enjoys bringing mindfulness and movement to others. Alli loves traveling and experiencing new cultures, with her last abroad experiences being in Ghana and Israel.

Most recently, Alli has been awarded Fisher College of Business’ Pace Setter Award, which is given to less than 1% of all Fisher graduates, those of which practice high levels of academic performance and leadership ability.

Today, you’re most likely to find Alli actively seeking out opportunities of challenge, which she believe to be the catalyst to her own personal development. Whether it be practicing a plant-based diet for the sake of the environment or raising tens of thousands of dollars to combat human trafficking, she hopes her life to be an example that change and impact are inextricably intertwined.

After graduation, Alli herself will be ‘pivoting’, making the move to Dallas, Texas to join Microsoft as an Associate Consultant where she hopes to continue to empower humanity as a whole.

Alli created this book so others’ can learn about various principles that can lead them to their own success, however they may define that for themselves. She hopes her book to make a positive impact on the readers’ life, both inspiring them and spurring them to personal transformation.

For more information you can connect with Alli at thepowerofpivot@gmail.com and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/alli-esker/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ThePowerofPivot and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Keep pivoting and thanks again,

Alli
story_txt:
Story of My BookThe Power of Pivot explores the concept of transformation through the stories of women, whether that be physical, emotional, psychological, and/or occupational. The concepts are meant to inspire the reader to realize their own ability to change themselves as well as better adapt to external circumstances that aren’t as controllable.My name is Alli Esker and I am the author of The Power of Pivot. I wrote this book because I’ve always been fascinated by the idea of change and wanted to explore the intersection of that concept with my passion for women’s empowerment and equality.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will realize or rediscover your own ability to adapt, change, and pivot on your journey through life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for transformation and a growth mindset into your life. Ultimately, I want you to find this book to be a tool to help you find tactical means and real life examples to the changes you wish to see within yourself, your community, and the world.In this book, you'll learn about the principles of changes that lead to success :
A closer look at the human condition - We’ll explore what I call ‘The Female Condition’, and dig into a historical account of women from the neolithic era to present day. She’s had her struggles, whether that be objectification or disenfranchisement, but she’s also had major victories. You’ll see that regardless of the environment, women are specifically able to realize change.
Grit and Tenacity - 15 year old Gitanjali Rao is on a mission to solve Flint, Michigan’s water crisis, among a plethora of other passion projects to help enhance the world. You’ll learn from her story that even through criticism and lack of respect due to her age, her never-give-up attitude is what propels her to succeed.
The value of curiosity - Asking questions leads to the ability to see things from a different perspective. We’ll dive into the topic of curiosity from both a present-day and historical lens and how it’s impacted the world through the fascinating story of the greatest mariners to every sail the world, the Polynesian Wayfinders, as well as through one of the world’s greatest inventors, Leonardo DaVinci.
You will love this book if you are interested in learning about some principles of change and adaption that I’ve found to be catalysts of success from the female perspective. This book tackles the concept of change from various multi-causal points of view such as biological, economical, or psychological.The Power of Pivot is a non-fiction book that speaks to women and anyone interested in self-development who are looking at the concept of change told from the perspective of women for the first time.The Book - The Power of PivotThe book is written in 3 Parts....
Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. I break down the concept of change in an easy to comprehend framework where we’ll deep dive into the question, ‘What creates change?’, and I’ll deconstruct some preconceived notions on the subject. From their you’ll learn about the idea of “The Female Condition” (As mentioned above) from a historical perspective, and learn about the special biological and psychological abilities that women can lean into to succeed.
Part 2 contains Chapters 2-9. In this section we dig deeper into some principles of change that catalyze success. You’ll learn from both males and females from the historical side and stories from inspiring women today who are practicing these principles, whether that be from being innovative, believing in oneself, or being vulnerable.
Part 3 contains Chapters 10. It contains the culmination of everywhere we’ve journeyed throughout the book. I tie everything together with an overarching reminder that you yourself are the sole captain of actualizing change and provide some final universal reasons to compel you to do so.

story:
Story of My Book - Take Your Turn, Teddy

Nothing has been normal for Teddy, not since discovering the harsh reality of the monster he had been living with his whole life. He and his mother left that behind to start over in a small Indiana township, but as Teddy begins to learn of humanity's monsters, he'll unveil an otherworldly evil which he calls "The Shadow." The Shadow tests Teddy's vulnerability and a growing sense of isolation, poisoning his mind, and conjuring a vile killer-in-the-making.

My name is Haley Newlin and I am the author of Take Your Turn, Teddy. I wrote this book because most people associate horror novels with the written counterpart to slasher films and miss the opportunity to expose themselves to the self-reflection horror demands. Everything we fear is personal. Horror makes us look those fears in the face and say, “Why do you scare me? Where does your power over me stem from? And how do I beat you?”
 

The Impact

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a hungry shadow that mirrors the darkness in our minds. I want you to see that each mental trial is an exercise in control—either giving it up or fighting to reclaim it. I want this book to be an opportunity to understand that the shadow lives in all of us and it wants us to believe that our control is long lost. But it’s not. The ultimate control comes from us, a lesson Teddy will have to learn in hopes of regaining his true inner self.

In this book, you will meet the protagonist and the eventual anti-hero, Teddy, and the antagonist, The Shadow figure. The world is set in a rural Indiana township, followed by a series of rural towns, in the early 1970s. The story's time and place build on a sense of isolation for Teddy as he is backed further into the control of The Shadow.

You will love this book if you enjoy purposeful horror, using fear as an ultimate control center. Also, if you are a fan of psychological horror stories like Shirley Jackson’s The Haunting of Hill House and Stephen King’s The Shining.

Take Your Turn, Teddy speaks to horror and gothic-fiction fans who want to grapple with darkness and fear to fight the inner demons we often try to bury away into the depths of our minds.

Ultimately, I hope that Take Your Turn, Teddy inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Why do I carry the fear that I do?

How does this fear shape the person I am and how I interact with others?

How do I do more to prompt mental check-ins and face trauma and change the way I view mental health issues?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers — coming together and discussing how real-world issues and trauma, in connection to the feeling of loss of control, will change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter. When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and audiobook.



Exclusive Pre-Order Rewards 

 

  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • Some spooky items from my favorite Etsy shops
  • Original Take Your Turn, Teddy and Not Another Sarah Halls bookmarks from Keegan Luna-KALO ART
  • Hand-picked horror/gothic books from the author
  • And more...

 

About the Author

 

Haley Newlin attended Southern New Hampshire University where she earned a Master of Fine Arts in English and Creative Writing — Speculative Fiction. When she isn't spinning tales of blood and terror, Newlin is likely falling victim to jump-scares and strobing torments from The Conjuring Universe or reading Stephen King.

Newlin has published two novels, Not Another Sarah Halls and Take Your Turn, Teddy. Her love of all things dark and grim inspired Newlin to share the inherent beauty of the horror genre through her writing. Newlin weaves stories of madness and curiosity that whisper, “What are you afraid of?” Horror begs self-reflection, and perhaps that is what makes these twisted tales truly terrifying.


For more information you can connect with Haley at haley.newlin22@gmail.com,
https://authorhaleynewlin.wordpress.com/ or on the following social media platforms:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/haleynewlin22

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/haleynewlin_author/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/haleynewlinwriter/

Goodreads: https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/19794206.Haley_Newlin

21 Years Of Trauma & Still Standing With C-PTSD

The story you are about to read is true- it is about my life. I would like you to take a moment to read about my sorrows and how I found inspiration to persevere I have become a voice for those that are the silent ones…….. the abused children and woman. I am opening a foundation that will provide a home for woman that have been abused  to have a place to go to get on there feet and become independent successful woman. 

 

Have a blessed day for here is my story……………                                                                                 

 

My Name is Jessica Solsona and I was a victim of abuse.

I was molested as a child by my step father ….. for years……while my own mother knew me being violated and did nothing to stop it. ……for years I did not know why she did not protect me.  she told me she hated me because she thought …… she thought he was paying more attention to me then her. He would go to my bedroom every night and take me to the sofa while he watched porn. I was so scared ………   He would tell me not to fight back or I would get beaten. I just laid there numb, wanting someone to save me. I turned to my mother for comfort and protection, there was none. She said she hated me because in her mind I was stealing the man she loved. There was no solitude, no place for me to turn .  

I never had the protection a child should have….. the protection a child needs from her parents. The very people who should have kept me safe had imprisoned me into a life sexual slavery.

When I was 15 I was married just to get out of the abuse to only get myself into another abusive 7 years! He abused me everyday. I left school to work and pay his court fees. I had a son at 16 and soon after at 17 I had a daughter. I Fought hard to make sure they were not hurt by him or anyone. He was deported back to Costa Rica and I followed thinking he would change because he told me would. my kids and I were held hostage in Costa Rica for a year because he would not let us leave. He was so abusive and even more so because we were not in the USA. In that year my 6 month old daughter at that time almost died. I fought hard to get back. I made it back to the USA with both my kids and without him! I worked so hard to get on my feet. I now I remarried and now have four children. I want to show them there mothers a solder And can overcome anything! 

 

My story is my life and through it all I had my faith in God…………….. I knew that I was brought onto this earth for a greater meaning. A meaning that eluded me. My search for peace is all that kept me going through the many uears of abuse that followed. My faith that one day I would make my way through the depair and use every ounce of my being to make sure other children and women did not endure what I had.

My dream of one day having a family of my own has come true. However the physical as well as emotional scars have remained.Like many women and children that go through what I have Ihave Complex Post Traumatic Stress D…….. or PTSD. Though my will is strong, at this time I am unable to mauntain full timeemployment. I use this time to love my children each and every day. I work to raise money for my foundation for abused children and women as well as work on my memoir so I can tell my story and hopefully help someone’s desperite dry for help. I want so much to make a difference in this world. I feel it is my obligation, my purpose.!

 

 

 I want to make a program where woman can get help to get out of abuse. Most woman stay because they are told they are nothing, they can't make it without them, and they don’t have the money to get out and be independent.

My goal is to get them out and give them support. I want to have a stable home where they can go to  and have the protection they need. I want doctors to help them with what they have beenthrough. I want to find them secure job's. I want woman to become strong successful and independent.

As for the kid's who were abused I want so much more! They never asked to live that kind of life. All they want is a mother and father who will protect them not abuse them.  I am wishing my book could help change how people see and think about child abuse! When they hear a child screraming for the person abusing a child to stop! I HOPE THEY WOULD DO SOMETHING INTSTEAD OF NOTHING!                                       

  
 
 Please donate to help me get started on helping others! 
 
 
                        Much love to you all!
 
                        Jessica Lynn solsona

All they want is a mother and father who will protect them not abuse them.  I am wishing my book could help change how people see and think about child abuse! When they hear a child screraming for the person abusing a child to stop! I HOPE THEY WOULD DO SOMETHING INTSTEAD OF NOTHING!                                       


  
 
 Please donate to help me get started on helping others! 
 
 
                        Much love to you all!
 
                        Jessica Lynn solsona

story:
Short Summary

As a corporate trainer, I've seen so many people struggle to find their life pupose and try to figure out what to do when life throws them a curve ball. 

What do you do? How do you know what decision is right? Tarot decks are vague and oracle decks don't give enough information. 

The Career Cards give you straight answers any time you need it. There are 88 cards that represent your career path, life purpose and what you're supposed to do right now, plus two special Action and Block decks that provide "yes" or "no" answers and tell you what may be standing in your way. You can use them every day, for any type of question. 

They have already been picked up by the world's LARGEST metaphysical book distributor. I have orders from bookstores all over the country, and will be doing major publicity for them later this year. 

Why I Need Your Help

I need your help to get the Career Cards printed and shipped. I had to commit to publishing 1,000 sets to get them printed, and it's expensive to produce because of the box, book and cards. I also need to print and mail out postcards to retailers in October in time for the holiday buying season. 

All donations will be used to publish and promote the project. After the initial costs are paid, donations will be used to purchase ads and promotions with the distributor and in trade magazines to teachers, trainers, therapists, career coaches, etc.

What You Get When You Contribute 

You will get your own Career Cards box set for a donation of $25. It retails for $29.95, so you're getting a discount. Other perks include personalized Career Card readings for you and your loved ones, or becoming a Certified Career Card reader so YOU can make money from your deck. You can receive the VIP Treatment at a book signing, where I will have the press interview YOU about YOUR role in helping the Career Cards get out there. For donations of $1,000 or more, I will come to your place of business and conduct an in-depth training on how to use the cards at work for better success and harmony. 

The Impact

Everyone needs help and direction right now. The Career Cards provide solid  answers. 

There is nothing like the Career Cards -- anywhere. They are endorsed by best-selling tarot authors, mainstream and metaphysical bookstores and people all over the country. No matter where I take the prototype, people want it. It makes a great coffee table book, novelty item and an eye-catching conversation starter anywhere you go. 

I've been a successful corporate trainer for over 10 years, and am known around the world as "The Media Relations Maven" (http://www.prtrainer.com) I am a publicity expert who's taught clients like Verizon, Allstate and The Red Cross how to get major coverage for their clients and campaigns. I know how to get publicity, and I know how to market effectively. I am bringing the same focus and commitment to this project as I brought to my work in the corporate world. So you can relax, knowing that your hard-earned donation is in the hands of a proven professional. Feel free to Google me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can spread the word via your social networks like Facebook, Twitter and Indiegogo's share tools.

The more people that know about the project, the better -- because everyone knows someone who could use the Career Cards!

story:
Short Summary

Did you ever consider that Jesus was God as a baby? That He entered this world the same way your child did...or mine. That he probably blew spit bubbles, cooed, smiled at Mary, slept when his mother was wide awake and stayed up when she was worn out and needed to sleep. ...just like our children did?
Did you ever lean over a park bench to catch a glimpse of a strangers' baby in a stroller because...well because babies just draw us into their little world and then they touch us?
Did you ever think that Jesus would have done the same to you...or to me...had we been there the night he was born?
That is what "A Ragamuffin Christmas" is all about.

What We Need & What You Get

My book has been picked up by Liberty University Press for a fall release. But the publishing world has changed and I have to cover all cost of production. I have to pay for editing, layout, formating, cover design, marketing, distribution and production of a hardcover plus a soft cover.
I need to raise $6000 to cover these costs, minus what Indiegogo takes, plus the costs of the perks for those who donate.

The Impact

I want to reach poeple. I want people to go back to what Christmas felt like when they were kids...or maybe what it should have felt like. I want people to find themselves in that Nativity on that scandalous night and have a face-toface, head-on-collission with Jesus Christ.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can help financially but everyone can help spread the word! Please use the links on this page and help me get the word out!

story:
I see that you're interested, but being an inquisitive person, you still have some questions. Luckily, I have anticipated this:


What Is Going On?

After three years, I have completed my novel and second work of fiction, The Albino Album (a novel as songs).

This book is currently in editing with  a New York City based small press. The small press covers the costs of editing, layout-and-design, printing and distribution, and some publicity. As you may know, literature by emerging writers is not, initially at least, the most profitable enterprise. So, there is still much work to be done.

 

What On Earth Will My Funds Be Used For?

I need your help to fund my upcoming book tour for this work of literary fiction.The more this campaign generates, the larger my book tour will be. 

O will be working on publicity for the book, as well as setting up a tour so that this book can reach an even wider audience than the first. There are magazines, newspapers, bookstores, bars and theaters to be contacted, bus tickets to buy, and where I don't have a host, motel rooms to be purchased.

 

What is this Book Even About?

The Albino Album (a novel as songs) is a 200,000 word queer epic that follows the life of a little girl who accidentally feeds her mother to an albino tiger and grows up to become a domestic terrorist. 

The Albino Album deals with issues of queer identity, polyamory, rural poverty, pop music, gender, race in America, Monsanto, the nonprofit conundrum and most importantly, the fantastic implications of albino animals bred by pseudo-Nazis. 

If this is just the book you didnï¿½t know you'd been waiting for, please donate today.

 

Can I Please Hear Just One Compelling, Albeit Slightly Unrelated, Interesting Fact?

An Interesting Fact: Only two percent of what gets published in the U.S. is literature (fiction, creative nonfiction, poetry, etc.) but Small Presses publish more than 90% of literature in the U.S  


Are There Any Other, Perhaps More Subjective Reasons to Donate?

By donating to this, you are supporting creative literature, and you can't go wrong there. 

You know how writers end up. This prolongs the time before that end, for me.

If you want to see a book like this spread itself around the country and support the work of a queer,female emerging novelist, this is a good way to do it. 

Maybe you're just in a giving mood.

Certain donation amounts get you perks, and my perks are really spectacular. 

Any amount is greatly appreciated.

Thank you for all of your support!

 

-Chavisa Woods

 

 http://www.chavisawoods.net


cover art (tiger) by Finley Coyl http://www.ardentata.net/

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Wait, Who Are You?

Chavisa Woods is the author of ï¿½Love Does Not Make me Gentle or Kindï¿½ (Fly By Night Press, 2008). This book was a Finalist for the Lambda Literary Award for Debut Fiction. Woods was the recipient of the 2009 Jerome Foundation Award for emerging writers. 


Woods has featured as a reader with a number of renowned institutions and festivals. She featured in a performance series, which ran for five days at The Whitney Museum in New York City, as a member of the Chorus of Poets (September). She has also been featured at the New York Vision Festival three different years. As part of the New York HOT Festival, she presented a multimedia reading from her first her work of fiction, ï¿½Love Does Not Make Me Gentle or Kindï¿½ at the Dixon Place Theater, 2009 and  2011. Woods has presented lectures on short fiction and poetry at a number of universities, including: Penn State, Sarah Lawrence College, Bard College, Brooklyn Tech and the New School. Woodsï¿½ poetry, short stories and essays have been published nationally and internationally in such publications as; The Evergreen Review, Danse Macabre, The Brooklyn Rail, Union Station Magazine, New York Quarterly, and many others. 


She has been featured in interviews on: WBAI, Cat radio Cafï¿½, 2009, Columbia Radio, 2009, and KDHX St. Louis, literature for the Halibut, 2009, as well as on the CBS Morning show, Iowa, 2006. In 2003, Chavisa Woods was featured ï¿½Rhapsodists,ï¿½ a documentary on young female spoken word artis.


In 2006, Woods founded the Check Your Bit reading series in Hudson New York, where she resided for eight months. This series is still active, housed in the historic Hudson River Theater Building. From 2000, to 2002 she was active in PSI, as well as Influx Art, an organization dedicated to community involvement in art. She curated interactive art events and literary readings. She was also a member of C.A.M.P. (Community Arts and Media Project), focused on integrating sustainable living, political activism and art.


In 2009, her collection of fiction received outstanding reviews in: The Brooklyn Rail, The
Short Review, The Feminist Review, The Pedestal Magazine, Go Magazine, The fiction
Circus, and others. She recently took part in a month-long collaborative exhibition and performance series combining visual artists with literary author's in Manhattan's renowned Cervantes Institute, March, 2011.

story:
Our Story

Alafia (Peace) I am Khafre K. Abif, AIDS Activist and I have been thriving with HIV for 23 years. I have compiled an anthology of inspirational prayers, poems and affirmations to support the souls and uplift the spirits of People Living with HIV/AIDS. For the last eighteen month the submissions have touched my soul, made me cry, filled me with hope, and connected me to an international community of compassionate contributors who have shared their work to empower my world.

Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS has received submission from Africa, America, Europe, and South America. Contributors have provided their work in their indigenous language with an English translation. I want to shares this anthology with the international community who created it. As you are reading this it is quite possible that you know someone living with HIV/AIDS. If you do then they have shared their status with you. Let us consider all of those who still havenâ€™t disclosed to their mother, father, sister/brother or even their faith community. What place to they go to as a source of support and inspiration?

Poets featured in the forthcoming anthology include: Nikki Grimes, Serena T. Wills, Reginald T. Jackson, Sharaledon D. Brave, r. witherspoon, Samiya Bashir, Storme Webber, Carl Hancock Rux, Timâ€™m T. West, Mose Xavier Hardin, Jr., Victor R. Pond, Cathleen Richardson Bailey, Catherine Zickgraf, Temujin Ekunfeo, Maria Hiv Mejia, Sandy Rodgers, W. Travis Wright, Vanessa German, and avery r. young and more.


The Impact

The idea for the anthology grew out of my work as an HIV Test Counselor. Each time I had to share with someone that they tested positive for HIV one of the first issues for them was disclosure. I believe that there is healing in prayer. I know that word have power. I needed to provide this collection of words that will combat the words that are so often hear spoken to someone with HIV. This is my effort to help combat HIV-related stigma. AIDS-related stigma and discrimination refers to prejudice, negative attitudes, abuse and maltreatment directed at people living with HIV and AIDS. The consequences of stigma and discrimination are wide-ranging: being shunned by family, peers and the wider community, poor treatment in healthcare and education settings, an erosion of rights, psychological damage, and a negative effect on the success of HIV testing and treatment. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funds raise will completely support a High Quality Eco-Friendly Printing and Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS to be presented in the spirit in which it has been compiled into a quilt of words that heal and affirmation the soul. I want to deliver an aesthetically attractive book that is produced, designed and printed on quality paper. I also want to ensure that each contributor regarding of continent receives two copies of our work. In addition, the cover art needs to be created developing a contract with a photographer, visual design and graphic artist to complete this gift for the souls of those infected and affected by HIV/AIDS.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this project and share it with your social network on Facebook, Twitter,direct Email and you have even choose to blog about Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS. Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

story:
Welcome to Pollyanna's Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood: A Survival Guide Against the Cynicism and the Hypocritical. Phew, what a title. I will do my best to make sure this book earns it.

ABOUT “POLLYANNA,” AND THE CAMPAIGN

Pollyanna’s Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood: A Survival Guide Against the Cynicism and the Hypocritical, written by Emmy® Award Winner Orlando Delbert, is a true-to-life preparatory tale of what to expect when attempting to make it in Hollywood. A straightforward and unapologetic offering of real-life stories and events designed to steer the reader through the many pitfalls that everyone encounters.

Whether someone dreams of becoming a blockbuster director, an award winning actor, a platinum-selling recording artist, or any of the hundreds of other professions needed to be part of a Hollywood project, the foundations for success are the same. ‘Pollyanna’ makes it clear that talent alone is not always enough to succeed.

“Very few people that come to Hollywood stumble into success and prosperity without some kind of price to pay,” said Orlando Delbert. “Many people don’t even have a realistic plan when they arrive and honestly believe they will be discovered based on hubris or good looks alone.” Leaving trivial gossip at the door, Delbert offers an honest guide to reinforce the importance of planning, nurturing your inner strength, and becoming resilient enough to succeed.

If you think you have the talent, drive, and dedication to make it in Hollywood, then this book is for you.

CLICK HERE to read an example of the book: The great façade of a perceived reality.

WHAT THE FUNDING IS FOR

The first draft of “Pollyanna” has been completed and is in need of a final pass. Our editor has done a great job, but we feel there should be one more set of eyes to go through and make one final set of notes for possible revisions if needed. Funding will be for:

            • Additional Manuscript preparation and formatting

            • Copy-editing and proofreading

            • E-Conversion and delivery

We also need to assemble a marketing campaign. This will involve a marketing strategy that includes:

            • Press Releases

            • Video Promotions

            • Video Testimonials and Reviews

            • Online Presence including Social Media and Blogs

            • Additional artwork

Depending on the money that is raised, we may be offering a paperback first edition in the future.

WHAT YOU GET FOR CONTRIBUTING

As a contributor, you are part of a project that could help reduce hardship, including saving individuals from being sexually assaulted or raped, becoming homeless or left for dead. “Pollyanna” hopes to impact the many individuals desperate to become famous that lack life experience and the resilience to truly succeed.

You are also PRE-ORDERING a first edition of Pollyanna’s Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood: A Survival Guide Against the Cynicism and the Hypocritical before the official release planned for March 2013. The book will be available as a digital download either as a PDF that can be read on mobile devices, as well as on your desktop computer, an EPUB file for most mobile devices, or a MOBI file for Kindle. 

THE IMPACT

The beta readers have all agreed to the importance of “Pollyanna” as a tool, not only for success in the trenches of day-to-day life in Hollywood, but also for our personal lives as well. “Pollyanna” offers true stories that are seen daily in and around the entertainment industry. There are many toxic and predatory individuals taking advantage of the young and naïve. The book offers a brutally honest perspective of a side of “the biz” that few know exists!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

            • Check out the official webpage: www.otkmediagroup.com

            • Preorder your copies today and spread the word

            • Tell others about “Pollyanna” and this campaign

            • Enjoy the book

REVIEWS

“I only wish I had this when I went to LA my first time all those years ago. Honest, poignant and wholly true. The "real" Good, Bad and the Ugly - The L.A. Manual.”

Visual Effects Supervisor Frank Rosowski.

“He doesn’t pull any punches (nor should he) when it comes to the ‘source material’ of life in the Hollywood trenches. His total honesty is refreshing in a sea of many sharks that populate the Hollywood landscape with their half-truths and lies just to get what they want out of the unsuspecting neophyte.”

Film Director and Producer Wendell Hubbard.

“It automatically gets you hooked. (A) book that will engage a wide audience, from students eager to jump into it -- to the people who have been there and done that -- and everyone in between.”

Founder and Artistic Director of ‘Circ X’ Diana Lozano.

“Mr. Delbert lays it all on the line and pulls no punches when it comes to dishing the dirt on Hollywood’s entertainment industry. He does so without coming off as being bitter or broken himself.”

Filmmaker Deana Becker.

“This universal book isn’t just for Hollywood; it can be used across the board for your personal life.”

Assistant Director Tharian “Ty” Dunn.

“This book is a must have for anyone ever considering going into show business! Orlando Delbert has written an amazing account of his journey through a side of Hollywood we never knew existed. Pollyanna's Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood has earned its place on my bookshelf.”

Ariel Nadav.

CLICK HERE if you want to see an animated promo for this campaign.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Orlando Delbert is a multiple National Emmy® Award-winning Graphic Designer with more than twenty years experience in visual communications. This includes being a producer, production designer, and art director for several Emmy® Award winning and nominated television productions, television networks, and award winning motion pictures. Orlando’s contributions to the entertainment world can be seen and heard on more than 400 productions worldwide.
story_txt:
Welcome to Pollyanna's Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood: A Survival Guide Against the Cynicism and the Hypocritical. Phew, what a title. I will do my best to make sure this book earns it.
ABOUT “POLLYANNA,” AND THE CAMPAIGN
Pollyanna’s Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood: A Survival Guide Against the Cynicism and the Hypocritical, written by Emmy® Award Winner Orlando Delbert, is a true-to-life preparatory tale of what to expect when attempting to make it in Hollywood. A straightforward and unapologetic offering of real-life stories and events designed to steer the reader through the many pitfalls that everyone encounters.
Whether someone dreams of becoming a blockbuster director, an award winning actor, a platinum-selling recording artist, or any of the hundreds of other professions needed to be part of a Hollywood project, the foundations for success are the same. ‘Pollyanna’ makes it clear that talent alone is not always enough to succeed.
“Very few people that come to Hollywood stumble into success and prosperity without some kind of price to pay,” said Orlando Delbert. “Many people don’t even have a realistic plan when they arrive and honestly believe they will be discovered based on hubris or good looks alone.” Leaving trivial gossip at the door, Delbert offers an honest guide to reinforce the importance of planning, nurturing your inner strength, and becoming resilient enough to succeed.
If you think you have the talent, drive, and dedication to make it in Hollywood, then this book is for you.
CLICK HERE to read an example of the book: The great façade of a perceived reality.

WHAT THE FUNDING IS FOR
The first draft of “Pollyanna” has been completed and is in need of a final pass. Our editor has done a great job, but we feel there should be one more set of eyes to go through and make one final set of notes for possible revisions if needed. Funding will be for:
            • Additional Manuscript preparation and formatting
            • Copy-editing and proofreading
            • E-Conversion and delivery
We also need to assemble a marketing campaign. This will involve a marketing strategy that includes:
            • Press Releases
            • Video Promotions
            • Video Testimonials and Reviews
            • Online Presence including Social Media and Blogs
            • Additional artwork
Depending on the money that is raised, we may be offering a paperback first edition in the future.
WHAT YOU GET FOR CONTRIBUTING
As a contributor, you are part of a project that could help reduce hardship, including saving individuals from being sexually assaulted or raped, becoming homeless or left for dead. “Pollyanna” hopes to impact the many individuals desperate to become famous that lack life experience and the resilience to truly succeed.
You are also PRE-ORDERING a first edition of Pollyanna’s Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood: A Survival Guide Against the Cynicism and the Hypocritical before the official release planned for March 2013. The book will be available as a digital download either as a PDF that can be read on mobile devices, as well as on your desktop computer, an EPUB file for most mobile devices, or a MOBI file for Kindle. 
THE IMPACT
The beta readers have all agreed to the importance of “Pollyanna” as a tool, not only for success in the trenches of day-to-day life in Hollywood, but also for our personal lives as well. “Pollyanna” offers true stories that are seen daily in and around the entertainment industry. There are many toxic and predatory individuals taking advantage of the young and naïve. The book offers a brutally honest perspective of a side of “the biz” that few know exists!
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
            • Check out the official webpage: www.otkmediagroup.com
            • Preorder your copies today and spread the word
            • Tell others about “Pollyanna” and this campaign
            • Enjoy the book
REVIEWS

“I only wish I had this when I went to LA my first time all those years ago. Honest, poignant and wholly true. The "real" Good, Bad and the Ugly - The L.A. Manual.”
Visual Effects Supervisor Frank Rosowski.

“He doesn’t pull any punches (nor should he) when it comes to the ‘source material’ of life in the Hollywood trenches. His total honesty is refreshing in a sea of many sharks that populate the Hollywood landscape with their half-truths and lies just to get what they want out of the unsuspecting neophyte.”
Film Director and Producer Wendell Hubbard.

“It automatically gets you hooked. (A) book that will engage a wide audience, from students eager to jump into it -- to the people who have been there and done that -- and everyone in between.”
Founder and Artistic Director of ‘Circ X’ Diana Lozano.

“Mr. Delbert lays it all on the line and pulls no punches when it comes to dishing the dirt on Hollywood’s entertainment industry. He does so without coming off as being bitter or broken himself.”
Filmmaker Deana Becker.

“This universal book isn’t just for Hollywood; it can be used across the board for your personal life.”
Assistant Director Tharian “Ty” Dunn.

“This book is a must have for anyone ever considering going into show business! Orlando Delbert has written an amazing account of his journey through a side of Hollywood we never knew existed. Pollyanna's Tear Soaked Battlefields of Hollywood has earned its place on my bookshelf.”
Ariel Nadav.

Orlando’s contributions to the entertainment world can be seen and heard on more than 400 productions worldwide.

story:
Hi!  I'm Raina Kellerman.  I am an adjunct instructor in history at Mount Aloysius College, and working on writing a book about women who worked in arsenals during the Civil War.  I am a 2007 graduate of Edinboro University and a 2009 graduate of Indiana University of Pennsylvania, with my bachelors and masters in history.

The idea for this book came about five years ago when I was in a grad school class about my favorite time period since childhood, the Civil War. We were to write a paper about some aspect of the war.  I wrote about an incident I had heard about in passing with the Allegheny Arsenal exploding.  The neighborhood of Lawrenceville, where it stood, is roughly 45 minutes from me.  So it was only natural for me to want to dig more into something local and almost unknown.  Then in my research, I found that there were many more women working in arsenals, and many more dying. In a time when it was frowned upon for a "lady" to be working outside the home, many women and children were hired to work in arsenals to roll and fill cartridges.  This could be very dangerous because the littlest spark could set off the black powder with which they were working.  Explosions could kill or maim a person, sometimes beyond recognition.

Why is that so important and why should we care, you ask?  For one, the fact that many women and children worked in sizeable numbers, and in such dangerous conditions, is little known.  On September 17, 1862, 78 workers - mostly women and girls - died at an explosion at Allegheny Arsenal in Pittsburgh in the worst civilian disaster in the war.  And that wasn't an isolated incident...on March 13, 1863, about 50 workers died in an explosion at the Confederate States Laboratory on Brown's Island in Richmond.  And on June 19, 1864, 21 workers died in another explosion at the Washington Arsenal in DC.  So many workers, whether or not they realized it while trying to support their families in the absence of male breadwinners, died working for their country.  And that is the aim of my book: to make sure these unsung heroes are recognized for their contributions. 

I have expanded my book somewhat past the original length of the paper, but I still have a ways to go in finding as much as possible about this topic.  Many primary sources are inaccessible online, so I would have to go to the Library of Congress or National Archives or what have you to gain access to these.  And if I want to use a photograph from someone else, I need to get the necessary permission and possibly pay fees in order to do so.  But my problem is like that of many: I have another job besides my adjunct one, and sometimes even those two are not enough to pay the bills, let alone travel or think of publishing my book.  None of that is free, unfortunately.  But with the help of people who want to read about something they had never heard of, I would love to make this happen!

 

Each and every person who pledges any amount towards making this book become a reality will get a mention in my acknowledgements.  For certain amounts, you will get more...

story:
What is it?


Before starting university, I wondered a lot about what might happen to my life. I thought that I might live in a shared and colourful apartment with a lot of strange and interesting people. I thought that I might drink a lot of alcohol and forget everything the day after. I thought that I would list my lovers and compare mine with my flatmates’ …to win a condom!

Actually, some of these things happened for real!  Other things that happened to me in those three years of university, I couldn't even have begun to imagine. To find out all the delicious details you will just have to read on.

So, I started to write a blog about my adventures and now I am writing an e-book. Just because the best and most important aspect of university education is not the lessons you learn in the classroom but the lessons you learn from the greatest teacher of all….life itself and all its wonderful (and not so wonderful ) experiences.

It’s no ordinary e-book. It’s funny, it’s educational, it’s amusing, it’s true, it’s an emotional rollercoaster ride but above all, it's a survival manual for students.


Why?

I need your support to achieve my aim of publishing my e-book. . I'd like to publish it on my own because I believe that a book should be written and promoted by the same person. I believe that helps readers to appreciate more the hard work that has gone into its production.

My e-book is not just a narrative about university life style; it'spart story, part manual for students. 

When I chose to go to university, I knew so little about that world; I wished I could have known more and been better prepared. I think it could be useful to learn more about that particular world and about what you might face in that period of life.

This is a nice way to not be scared about university and to face it with curiosity and anticipation.


Do you like it? So, join me!

If you like the idea of this project, then please support me to raise the modest funds I need to get this manual out there for you. Please do use the links on the right of this page. Just buy me a virtual coffee! Here, it’s just a quarter of the cost of a Starbucks coffee – an absolute bargain!

But we live in a time of austerity, so if you don't have money, no problem. There are other ways to help me and be part of the project:

1. You can share the video. It's a very short video. Your friends can watch it in less than one minute. Maybe somebody will appreciate it!

2. You can tell me what you think about the e-book. Feedback is very important and if you have an idea, a suggestion or even a criticism, then please do pass it on to me at 

vitadauniversitaria@gmail.com.

3. You can tell me your own story about your university life. It would be cool to learn more about other peoples’ experiences!

4. You can follow me on Twitter at my account @LaVitaAllUni. Yes, I know, it's in Italian, but soon it will be in English too!

5. You can love me! Ok, I'm just joking! =)

story:
What is Game Plan?

Here’s the blurb:

Ella Parker seems to have everything: great friends, an awesome family and a star position on her high school basketball team. The only thing missing is a boyfriend and that changes once she catches the eye of Sam Cleveland. With Sam by her side Ella has her perfect life. But when a drunken night results in an unwanted pregnancy, her perfect life is turned upside down and she’s faced with an impossible decision.

Katherine Frayne has always wanted to be a mother. But with the last results of her in vitro pointing to no baby, she thinks there’s no hope. Then her husband Danny suggests they adopt. At first Kat is resistant, but she soon realizes that it may be her only chance at being a mom.  

Honest and sometimes heartbreaking, Game Plan follows Ella and Katherine as they both navigate their lives amidst tough decisions that not only affect them, but those they love the most.


Here’s the deets:

Game Plan is author Natalie Corbett Sampson's debut young adult novel. As an adoptive mother herself, this was a very personal story for her to write. And that definitely comes across in the telling. One of the reasons Fierce Ink Press was so drawn to Game Plan was the way that Natalie wrote her characters and described what they were going through. We could tell that she had a vested interest in this story being told. So we immediately had a vested interest in the story being read.

Game Plan is a young adult contemporary novel that we just know readers will fall in love with.


Why Support Game Plan

There’s really nothing better than supporting the arts, is there? Well maybe cute puppies helping you to support the arts. Or cupcakes. Really yummy cupcakes.  But the arts — and books — make the world go round. By supporting our Game Plan campaign, you get the chance to not only opt in to some super fun swag (everyone NEEDS a Fierceling) but you also help to support an author and an indie publishing company.

What You’ll Get

Besides our undying gratitude? You’ll get the chance to pre-order the amazing Game Plan from debut author Natalie Corbett Sampson plus some fierce swag depending on what level you opt in to. There’s also the chance to score a developmental writing critique from the folks behind Fierce Ink Press.


Where Your Money Goes To

Here’s the breakdown:

  • Cover design: $500

  • Editing and proofing: $600

  • Print run for book launch $160

  • Marketing and Promotion: $800


If we surpass our goal? Yay for all of us!! And the additional funds will go towards marketing and promotion.


How You Can Support Our Campaign

Help us spread the word and the love about our campaign by sharing it on Facebook and Twitter and telling all your friends about it.

story:
What is Uprise?

Uprise is a movement of young adults innovatively ministering to their peers, working to promote the creation and enhancement of young adult ministries, and increase young adult involvement and membership in local churches.


Our Impact

We minister through relationships, discussing issues relevant to young adults. We've held several cafes, worship programs and gatherings. We also maintain a blog at uprisemovement.blogspot.com. Each post comes out of a personal experience and highlights what was gained out of it. We reach Adventist and non-Adventist alike, building relationships with them and pointing them to Christ and it pays off. Even with our limited resources we’re making an impact. Check out the video above. 

Our Need

On January 6-8, 2012 we'll host our first winter retreat and to have the biggest impact we want to reduce the cost of our retreat from $88 to $30 for the first 30 who register. The cost will include all retreat activities, meals and lodging. We also want to sponsor up to seven young adults who can't afford to pay to attend the retreat. In addition, the funds raised will allow us to launch an improved website/blog and apply for 501(c)(3) status. Not only will your donations help us reach more young adults in our current projects but give us a step up financially in future projects. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share our campaign.

story:
Our Story

My name is Monica Castillo, and I'm the senior film critic for a humble college magazine, the Quad. You know, for kicks and giggles, and sleepless nights. My quest is to expand our coverage beyond the cloistered confines of New England. I plan on providing a college student's insight into one of the premiere film festivals in the world, South by Southwest.

I threw in my application to SXSW just for the hell of it. Well, surprise! They accepted me, and I got my press pass. Cue dance sequence!

Bad news has since brought me back down to earth. The Quad is run by student volunteers with no funding from the school, and my parents, unimpressed, are not donating to the cause. So I've emptied my savings account in order to get this once-in-a-lifetime chance.

But now my pockets are bare. I need the help of faithful readers and benevolent do-gooders such as yourself.

Help send me from Boston to Austin!


The Impact

Help make my dreams come true! You'll also get a unique youthful insight into the SXSW Film Festival. It'll be a one-woman showdown with tons of events, lots of ground to cover, and a city I've never seen. I've got my laptop, a camera, and video equipment ready to go. You can follow my coverage on the Quad’s twitter feed and at buquad.com. All I need now are funds in order to help keep me fed and off the streets of Austin.

We need more college voices in today’s media. There are plenty of established critics attending festivals to just report on the movies they see. But film festivals are an experience, one that readers should get to learn about. What better way to report to a college audience than with a fellow, wide-eyed college student?


What We Need & What You Get

The damage:

Plane Ticket: $339

Hotel (before tax): $375

Transportation: ~$50

Feed Me (Please): ~50

Estimated amount I'll probably go over anyway: $814

Experience: Priceless

 

But, I won't leave you empty handed. You'll be handsomely rewarded with hundreds of tweets, dozens of blogs, and the best analysis a 20-year-old college kid can give you. Sort of like this:


The Sundance Shorts Shine Again

http://buquad.com/2011/01/31/sundance-shorts-is...


Keeping the Reels Fresh at the BU Cinematheque

http://buquad.com/2011/01/30/bu-cinematheque/


Queue Your Netflix with Class(ics): “Mr. Smith Goes to Washington”

http://buquad.com/2010/11/29/queue-your-netflix...


Double Feature: “Inside Job” Review: “Business Ethics” is a Joke

http://buquad.com/2010/11/08/double-feature-ins...


With many movies premiering including Jodie Foster's "The Beaver" starring Mel Gibson, and Jake Gyllenhaal as the lead in "Source Code," you will want someone who knows their movie stuff to give you an opinion (or at least a first impression). Plus, you’ll get all the photos and video you would ever want to see without actually being there, all for the low price of a donation.

But that's only if I can get there!!!


Other Ways You Can Help

Read our site at buquad.com. Give monies. Get Quad love.

story:
"Troikapocalypse" is the name of our book that's trying to explain our current economic crisis. It's a mix of the word "Troika" (the three big kahunas staving off disaster, the International Monetary Fund, the European Commission and the European Central Bank) and "Apocalypse", the End of Times.

Short Summary

Hi, our names are Rita Costa, Gary Dougall and Ines Costa. We are the authors of the relatively obscure book "Damn it". We are currently writing a book about the hard economic times that have befallen Europe recently. We need your help!

We are not economists, we are normal people who watch way too much CNN and believe humour is the best remedy at times like this. 

We will explain the recession in a semi-serious way. We will advise you on job searching, CV building, how to save money, etc.

Some of the chapters finished (we have written about 100 pages so far) are:
- Saving Money
- An Idiot's Guide to Job Hunting
- How to become a Mortuary Agent
- Who Should We Blame
- Is Crime The Answer
- Yay You're a Geek
and many more!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Help us make our book come true. We will mail out and email advanced copies of our book in printed format and ebook format weeks before we release it. We will self-publish it.

We need funds for an ISBN, editing costs, cover design, printing costs and marketing.

You can either donate or pick one of the perks available here ------------>

 

The Impact

We have an inside view on what it means to live in Europe in 2012. Maybe it can help you or a friend, wether you live in Europe or elsewhere!

Our objective is to publish a book that will help people with handy tips on how to survive this crisis. These will include tips on how to save money, find a job, get organized, deal with crisis depression, etc.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our page with your friends!

 

New - Additional benefits of donating

There are a load of things we may be able to help you with, see the updates section for what we might be able to assist with to thank you for donating!

story:
What You'll Get

Building Cincinnati covers news relevant to the built environment in the region's urban core, including the City of Cincinnati, Northern Kentucky's river cities, and the region's first suburbs.

Among the content you will find:

  • Coverage of development projects, including renderings, groundbreakings, ribbon-cuttings, and dedications;
  • Photo updates of construction projects and urban photography essays;
  • Coverage of transportation projects, including highway, transit, freight, and port activity;
  • Coverage of public meetings, such as City and community councils, the Cincinnati City Planning Commission and the Historic Conservation Board;
  • Commentary and opinion from people working in relevant disciplines;
  • Requests for proposals (RFP), requests for qualifications (RFQ), and invitations to bid (ITB);
  • Events and exhibits related to architecture and the built environment; and
  • Access to exclusive real estate listing information and market trends.
When launched this spring, Building Cincinnati will be a subscription service priced at $8 a month.  Between five and ten articles a month will be available for non-subscribers, free of charge. To view the products offered as perks, please visit: http://www.cafepress.com/buildcincy

What I'll Get

Funding raised through this campaign will go to:

  • A redesigned website, content management system, and web hosting;
  • LLC filing materials and a state filing fee;
  • Photo hosting
  • An upgraded cell phone and plan for live tweeting, Facebook, Google+, Instagram, and instant updates;
  • A new camera to replace my six-year-old dinosaur with numerous "dead spots";
  • A new voice recorder and microphone;
  • Membership in the Online News Association;
  • Payment to freelance contributors;
  • Future sponsorships;
  • Business cards, travel expenses, and other incidentals;
  • Taxes; and
  • Indiegogo fees and gifts.
Any remaining funds will be used to support me while I perform the arduous task of transferring every page from Blogger to my new host/CMS, fix all of the broken links, and test everything out before going live.  It will also help me through the first couple of months after launch, due to all of the free months of subscriptions racked up by you contributors!

The Impact

A September 2013 survey revealed that 34 percent of Building Cincinnati readers use the website for professional purposes.

These readers come from a variety of disciplines, including:

  • State and local politicians;
  • Urban planners and engineers;
  • Architects;
  • Residential and commercial developers;
  • Residential and commercial real estate agents;
  • Contractors and members of the building trades;
  • Funders;
  • Community development corporations;
  • Peers in print journalism, radio, and television;
  • Environmental and sustainability organizations;
  • Transportation advocacy groups;
  • Arts groups;
  • Affordable/fair housing advocacy and development organizations;
  • Chambers of commerce and business associations;
  • Preservation advocates; and
  • CONCERNED CITIZENS LIKE YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, I completely understand.  But you can still help!  If you have a few seconds, please feel free to share this campaign with the people you think might be interested in this service.

Building Cincinnati has long been a labor of love.  Now is the time to make it financially viable.  I thank you for your readership and your contribution.

Kevin LeMaster, Editor and Publisher, Building Cincinnati

The New Norm: Breaking Old Assumptions

Parkinson's disease is a degenerative neurological disease. The idea behind the New Norm is that we all face "new normals" everyday. This 90 page paperback book provides simple and practical insights on how to thrive throughout life's journey.

The book was started by Mike Oltersdorf and was finished by his son Dan when Mike's physical and cognitive symptoms progressed to a point where he was no longer able to write. Your help will make Mike's dream of sharing his message with the world a reality.

The Book: 

  • Experience the relationship and legacy passed down from a father to a son..
  • Learn simple but powerful lessons pulled from the lyrics of Beatle songs.
  • Take away specific action steps and tools to help you to define your purpose and thrive as you live the New Norm.

The Mission:

  • Share hope and inspiration
  • Provide resources for the New Norm message to continue to be shared.
  • Support local and national Parkinson causes. We are proud to be partnering with the National Parkinson Foundation by donating proceeds to support their mission: "to improve the quality of care through research, education and outreach."


www.Parkinson.org

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  1. What we need: The funding goal is $7,500, which will provide resources for the publication and distribution of the book.
  2. What you get: In addition to knowing you are helping to make Mike's dream a reality and you are helping to share a powerful message, here are some of the perks:
  • Be among the first to receive a copy of the New Norm!
  • Get books for yourself, for friends, or for us to donate to others who will benefit from it.
  • Get personalized, signed copies from Mike
  • Signed 8x10 photos of Mike Oltersdorf.


Signed 8x10 photo of Mike Oltersdorf


The Impact: Everyone Has a Broken Wings Story

By participating, you are making a real difference in the lives of those who need it, and you are providing needed resources to help Mike Oltersdorf continue to spread his message of hope.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? Here are some other ways you may be able to help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about the New Norm! We would love to get this message out to as many people as possible. Please share with your networks and with any media contacts you may have.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Follow us on Facebook and sign up for our mailing list for ongoing updates.

“Growing up "white" and "becoming black" gives Goller-Sojourner a powerfully unique position to talk about the strange racial ruptures in our culture—he has lived on at least two sides of the many-sided divide and can describe its contours more accurately than most anyone.”Brenden Kiley, The Stranger

The Project:

Hi and thanks for stopping by. My name is Chad Goller-Sojourner.  I am a Seattle-based writer, performer, transracial adoptee, and the creator of two solo performances: Sitting in Circles with Rich White Girls: Memoirs of a Bulimic Black Boy and Riding in Cars with Black People & Other Newly Dangerous Acts: A Memoir in Vanishing Whiteness. Most recently I was featured on NPR’s Weekend Edition Sunday, in segment entitled: “Growing Up 'White,' Transracial Adoptee Learned To Be Black.”

I plan to complete, publish and promote my new book,From Lutefisk and Lefse to Cornbread and Collards: Narratives, Essays and Interactive Exercises in Transracial Adoption. Each chapter opens with narratives taken from the above referenced memoirs, followed by expository essays. Essays which, among other topics, explore and address the paradoxical relationship between transracial adoptees and something I like to call honorary white privilege. A privilege based on parentage rather than personhood, and known to vanish quickly upon the adoptee leaving home an act which often leaves the transracial adoptee ill-equipped and saddled with a handicapped and fragmentary racial identity.

In the third and final section I present a series of Interactive Exercises, providing both concrete tools and best practices as they relate to adoptive parents and transracial adoptees. For the adoptive parents, raising transracial children, for both this world and the one they will one day age into. For the transracial adoptee, creating a world where conflicting experiences can be claimed, transformed, and accepted for what they are: the building blocks of our unique identities.

As the number of transracial adoptions continues to rise, the voice of the adult transracial adoptee becomes all the more important. Currently, the vast majority of transracial adoption literature is written by white adoptive parents. And while this is an important lens, when it comes to creating and navigating a healthy racial and ethnic identity, one where whiteness is the background, it is the adult transracial adoptee who is the expert. For many of us older adoptees, we are also the expert when it comes to taking on our adoptive parent’s racial and ethnic identity, only to see our honorary white identity and privileges vanish upon leaving home. Thankfully, it no longer has to be that way. With your financial and promotional assistance, “From Lutefisk and Lefse to Cornbread and Collards,” can serve as an important, necessary and relevant resource for transracial families. So what do you say, can we make this happen?

“With white parents came with white neighbors, friends, classmates, relatives, privileges, and experiences. And with that came witnesses, white witnesses, white witnesses more than willing to vouch for me, go to bat for me, stand in the gap for me. And should the police have killed me. Why it would be they who spoke from my grave for me. Have you any idea what that’s worth?”

Testimonials On Why This Matters:  

“I am a white adoptive mom to two black international adoptees. Resources about transracial adoption are typically written by adoptive parents. This book will provide the critical insight of an adult transracial adoptee. It is precisely what I need to help my children grow up secure and confident in both their racial identity and their identity as adoptees.”

“I am a white mother of an African American boy and I have found your other writings and input so helpful to me. I am desperately seeking more insight from you, as an adoptee yourself, who has lived this experience, so that I will have a better understanding of what to do, what NOT to do, how to understand things better, how to address things, how to help my son to be the most comfortable and well-adjusted child he can be, within the limitations of this family. I can't change my race - but I CAN change a lot of other things -and THAT is what I need to learn more about. Your experience is so meaningful and is priceless - and is very rare to find anywhere else.”

“Any parent whose adopted transracially, or who is thinking about adopting transracially, needs to hear Chad. I wish I could have many years ago. (White mother of an Asian man.)”

“As a white mother to an Ethiopian daughter and a Haitian son, your insight is invaluable. You have a unique way of challenging us to think critically, see the perspectives and experiences of our black sons and daughters, and move beyond our fears and discomforts so that we can be better parents and allies.”

“For years after leaving home I carried an old family picture; tucked it directly behind my driver’s license. Where the latter went the former followed—sometimes whispering, sometimes shouting: “I am not the Black Man you think I am.”

How I’ll Use Your Contributions:

Writing a book is tough enough, preparing that book for publication even tougher. Then there’s the whole self-publishing and marketing aspect. Your contributions of $7,900 will be used to cover: Development/Copy Editors, Cover Art/Book Designer, Printing, Binding and Distribution, E-Book Formatting and Digital Conversion, Digital, and Brick and Mortar Marketing. The good news: I’ve done similar projects before and am quite good when it spending money wisely and getting the best return for my buck. My sophomore solo performance: Riding in Cars with Black People & Other Newly Dangerous Acts: A Memoir in Vanishing Whiteness, premiered to rave reviews, and served as the catalyst for not one but two university fellowships. I also created and premiered my first solo performance: Sitting in Circles with Rich White Girls: Memoirs of a Bulimic Black Boy, on a shoe string budget and went on to tour it for three year.

How You Can Contribute:

1) By making a financial contribution via PayPal* or Credit Card. Any amount helps. In fact, if 250 people donate $32 dollars, we will meet our fundraising goal.

2) Spread the word: tell your friends, family, coworkers, listserv, everybody. It’s as easy as posting the Indiegogo Campaign link on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, or wherever you think interested people will see it. Finally, “Like” and promote our From Lutefisk and Lefse to Cornbread and Collards: Narratives, Essays and Interactive Exercises in Transracial Adoption Facebook page.

* Want to contribute to via PayPal, but don’t not have a PayPal account? Follow the steps below. 

  1. When you get to the PayPal screen, you'll see up top "Choose a Way to Pay"
  2. Select the second option: "Pay with a debit or credit card"
  3. Complete the form - PayPal accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express
  4. Deselect the checkbox that says: "Save this information with a PayPal account"
  5. Click "Review and Continue" to continue with a payment using a credit card
  6. Click on the "Continue Without Logging In" link

story:
Behind the Horns

I'm Jason Mankey, I'm a Pagan writer and lecturer.  If you read the Pagan Blogosphere with any regularity you've probably run into one of my articles at Raise the Horns over at Patheos Pagan.  If you are a Pagan festival goer we might have crossed paths as well, I do all kinds of presentations on Pagan History and the Horned God.  


I love what I do and I certainly didn't get involved with this for financial reasons, but going to festivals and writing about Paganism gets pretty expensive.  Just flying to a festival on the East Coast costs five hundred dollars round trip, and then there's eating and hotel expenses too.  (A trip to ConVocation in Detroit starts at about 900 bucks between airfare and hotel, and all of that's before I've even had a pint of cider!)  Festivals (which are often cash strapped themselves) don't generally cover my expenses either so it all adds up fast.  


Sometimes just putting a workshop, lecture, or blogpost together gets expensive.  I pride myself on actually doing the research necessary to write (and speak) intelligently about the subjects I share with Pagandom.  Scholarly books are not cheap and the amount of money I spend on research materials adds up quickly.  None of that even factors in the sheer amount of time many of these projects take.  I wish I could knock a new workshop out in a matter of hours but it's usually a matter of months!  Even the shortest blog posts take me a minimum of two to four hours to put together.  

Why Help Me?

That's a tough question.  Maybe you want to donate some cash because you enjoy Raise the Horns or like my workshops.  Perhaps you want to support one of the hardest working guys in all of the Pagan Blogosphere (that would be me).  I've been giving my all to greater Pagandom for the last several years and I want to be able to continue to do that without worrying about bouncing a check.  

I write and talk about things that very few others touch in Pagandom.  If history, the Horned God, and Led Zeppelin are important to you then I'm your guy.  I also do some terrible karaoke when the opportunity presents its self, why would you want to deprive the Pagan circuit of that tragedy?    


This won't all go for hard cider will it?

None of it will actually.  All of this is to help me with hotel and travel expenses for the PantheaCon and ConVocation festivals and to possibly pay for a few research materials.  All of these experiences eventually end up online too, so if you donate but aren't a festival goer you'll still get some good out of it.  


Perks!?!
I've actually figured out a way to include a few perks in this fundraising campaign and my parents and I both agree that they don't totally suck.  A shout-out by me has the potential to be seen by over 20,000 people a month, as do any blog links that come my way as a result of this campaign.  I'm a great speaker at festivals (so I've been told) because I'm well prepared and usually outrageously funny.  Having a drink with me or getting a story out of my blonde head isn't the worst way to spend a day.   

Thanks

I know that not everyone is going to be able to float me a few bucks, and that's OK. Times are tough and there are many other equally deserving folks out there, but if you can't donate and still want to help then please share this link, or share my posts on Raise the Horns.  Those of us who write and speak in public love to be read and heard, so pass this along.  


If you've made it this far in my snake-oil spiel I'm impressed!  I would have given up several paragraphs ago.


Thank you all so much.


Bright Blessings,

-jason
