story:
Why This Book?

I'm a Mother of 4, the youngest of which is severely autistic/ blind/ and developmentally disabled. Raising him hasn't been the difficult part.  He's great!  What's been hard has been dealing with all the assholes!  He's 14 now and you can
read about all the assholes he and I have run into, evaded, or told off in my
book "Autism and Assholes".  I'd love it if you read my book!  I'd love to make you laugh! I'd love it if I gave you something to relate to.   I'd really love it if you'd tell someone else!

If you know someone who is affected by Autism or a parent of an autistic child.  This is a book they can relate to.   The book tells it like it is about the daily life of a parent raising an autistic or disabled child.   Parents around the world struggle in silence as their world narrows down to a 24 hour a day struggle for a life that most people take for granted, especially the assholes.  

By funding this project you are helping bring out a lot of humor and a good dose of straight talk about life as a parent of an autistic child.   Sometimes you need to feel like someone is in your corner or at least someone understands what you go through, this book does just that.

 

About the Author

What you read in this book is my life.   As you can imagine, a child with serious disabilities requires an enormous amout of care and I have poured my life into him.   This is my first book and I hope it will not be my last.  I enjoyed writing "Autism and Assholes" and there could probably be 30 more chapters about assholes since the book was "finished".   

I need your help to bring "Autism and Assholes" to it's full potential and be able to market the book.   Thank you in advance for your support.

 

The Perks

$5 - Personal Acknowledgement

A personalized thank you on facebook and twitter for your contribution and an a posting on the "I'm Not An Asshole Board" on the new website.

 

$15 - e-Book Contributor

With this perk you will get an e-book copy of "Autism and Assholes",  listed as a contributor to the project in the e-book, and personalized thank you on twitter and facebook and listing on the "I'm not an asshole board" on the website.

 

$25 - Printed Paperback and e-book

You will receive an autographed printed paperback version of "Autism and Assholes" along with e-book copy and listed as a contributor to the project in the e-book.  Also a personalized thank you on twitter and facebook and listing on the "I'm not an asshole board" on the website.

Please add $15 for international shipping

 

$50 - Contributor in Print

You will be listed as a contributor in the print version of "Autism and Assholes" and receive a personalized autographed paperback copy, the e-book copy of "Autism and Assholes" where you will also be listed as a contributor to the project and personalized thank you on twitter and facebook and listing on the "I'm not an asshole board" on the website

Please add $15 for international shipping

 

$100 - T-shirt Bonus Contributor

You will receive a custom "I'm not an asshole donkey t-shirt" in the size of your choice, 2 personalized autographed copies of the book and you will be listed as a contributor in the print version of "Autism and Assholes", the e-book copy where you will also be listed as a contributor to the project and personalized thank you on twitter and facebook and listing on the "I'm not an asshole board" on the website

add $15 for international shipping

 

 

Usage of Funds:

Despite the wonders of self publishing, bringing a book like this to market so that someone actually knows it exists takes a lot more money than I have.   I asking for your help to finish, publish and promote this book.  Here is the budget for the book and website project.

  • Professional Editing - $500
  • Reformat Book for epub (it has some issues currently) - $250
  • ISBN & Copyright - $300
  • Cover design - $500
  • Marketing - $2000
  • Low Cost Book Tour $2000
  • Website design - $1500 (domain name already aquired)
  • Printing copies - $2500

If the campaign does not reach the total we will utilize what funds we do achieve to push forward with the project.

We would like to achieve more than our goal and look to bring more humorous, heartwarming and asshole stories to our print and website projects. 

 

Isolation

Parents of disabled children often feel like they live on a lonely island where know one understands them or their children.   Their only weapon is an under the breath "asshole" to the latest offense.  

The more people who learn through humor and blunt conversation of the trials and tribulations of us parents of autism, the better our lives and our childrens lives will be, and maybe just a few less assholes in the mix.

You can help make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this campaign and Autism and Assholes and don't forget you can use the Indiegogo sharing tools on this page.

Thank you for your support

story:
The alphabet has come to life!  Meet the Letter Beasties!  From the Alien A to the Zombie Z, all the letters have been masterfully transformed into lovable little creatures. Letter Beasties are so much fun, kids won’t even realize they’re actually learning their ABCs.  Educators, parents and child development experts agree that these entertaining cartoon characters help children learn the alphabet faster, easier and with better memory retention.  Plus, everyone else just thinks they're cool.

  RON NOBLE is an Emmy Award® winning animation director who has been creating children's animation and illustrating kid's books for two decades.  He's overjoyed to share his new Letter Beasties cartoon creation through this campaign.  By regaining publishing control of his book, Ron can finally offer hardcover, glossy page, 7 x 10 inch, keepsake quality copies of the Letter Beasties at a great rate directly to you!

This amazing book is already written, illustrated and has received stellar reviews from parents, kids and critics.  All that's needed is funding from fans like you to get the new books printed so they can be available to everyone.  To see more about the book check out: www.LetterBeasties.com

 

By donating to the new printing of the Letter Beasties book you'll up your awesomeness, you'll get awesome PERKS and best of all you'll be helping to launch the entire Letter Beasties brand!  From animation to toys, games, plushes, bed sheets, you name it, it's all in the works and will all happen thanks to your support.

STRETCH GOAL  -- If we raise more than the $11K goal, the additional money will go toward funding a Letter Beasties Game App. If we hit $20,000 then every contributor to this campaign will get a huge discount off the Beasties Game App once it's made.

**Please share the campaign link, with your friends, family and anyone who would love to support the Letter Beasties!**

Be a part of the magic!....BE ALL YOU CAN BEASTIE!

The campaign will run for 30 days to raise the $11,000 needed to print the books.  Then it takes 2 months to have the books printed and shipped to us.   During those two months we will also produce the additional Perk items for you. Then Ron will sign all the "signature" items and we'll mail your full Beastie packages at the end of Sept. 

** If the $11K goal is reached earlier during the 30 day campaign, we will begin book production even sooner, which means you will receive your package possibly 1-3 weeks earlier than scheduled.  So the faster the goal is met, the faster the books will be in your hands.  Let's make it happen!

 


 Besides getting a big Beastie thanks from us and the satisfaction of knowing you're funding the next great ABC brand, we're offering super-cool extras to everyone who contributes!

Choose any category below by clicking the perk buttons on your right.  If you would like to contribute without claiming a perk, click any button and choose the "no perk" option.  Thanks for the love and support!

Any questions at all please email us: Info@LetterBeasties.com

For more deatils about any of the individual perk items, scroll down past the list below.


Here are the specifics about each Letter Beasties campaign perk. Please email us with your Perks options details (such as shirt size, color, Choice of Beastie to be printed, sketched, etc.) at Info@LetterBeasties.com.


SIGNED POSTCARD

 

 You get a Beastie THANKS postcard signed by the author at all levels of support.

 

BEASTIE BIB

The Official Letter Beasties Bib!  Printed with the Letter Beastie of your choice...Look at the A to Z poster to view all 26 of the Beasties.


LETTER BEASTIES BOOK

Here it is!  Hardcover, casebound, 7 X 10 inches, full color, glossy page Letter Beasties book, signed by the author...A true keepsake!  Ideal for all kids (primarily 1-6 years), but so fun and innovative it appeals to the kid in all of us. 

 

A to Z POSTER

Letter Beasties A to Z Wall Poster (16 X 24 inches).  Perfect mix of learning and entertainment great for classrooms, bedrooms or any playroom!

 

T-SHIRTS

Pick the Letter Beastie you would like custom printed on the style, size and color T-shirt of your choice. See the examples below:

Baby Shirts Sizes: 2T, 3T, 4T, 5T, Small Youth (6-8 yrs old)

Baby Shirt Colors: White, Pink, Blue, Black

 

Women's Shirts Sizes: S, M, L, XL

Women's Shirt Colors: Pink, Blue, White, Black

 

Men's Shirts Sizes: S, M, L, XL

Men's Shirt Colors: Black, Blue, White

 

CANVAS TOTE BAG

Letter Beastie of your choice printed on Blue 100% Cotton Canvas Tote Bag

(20”w x 14.5”h x 4.5”d)   Bag weighs 12 oz.

Extra-long web handles (color: natural) reinforced at stress points

 

FRAMEABLE PAPER PRINTS

Ultra-Premium Giclee Paper Print  (16 x 20 inches - with a 1 inch white border). Hi-Res, suitable for framing.

Choose the Letter Beasties A to Z  OR  The Letter Beastie of your choice with your custom name added to the top.

 

CANVAS GICLEE PRINT

 

Canvas Giclee (16 X 20 inches, 1.5 inches deep) - Satin Finish

Choose the Letter Beasties A to Z  OR  The Letter Beastie of your choice with your custom name added to the top.

 

Tell your kids to invite over all their friends for a Letter Beasties drawing party!  Ron Noble (Author-illustrator) will come to your party and draw Letter Beasties for all the kids there, teaching them how to draw the Beasties as well. 

Every child at the drawing party will receive a large Letter Beastie drawing, along with a free signed Letter Beasties book (up to 20 children)!

Ron has drawn for kids on a tour of McDonald's Playplaces in Arizona and the Orange County Book Fair Illustrator's stage.

**You could make it a party for several kids birthdays to maximize the value.**

*Ron will travel to your party for free within a 50 mile radius of Santa Monica, CA 90404.  Outside of this radius Ron is happy to travel for a drawing party, but his travel expenses will need to be worked out with the contributer and added to the initial $1000 donation.

story:
Broken Silence is my personal narration of my life; it’s compelling yet its gut wrenching at most.  It’s my way to voice what I have experienced as a survivor of many things that most are not able to speak of.  It is my personal duty to share what I overcame and how I was able to gain back my life and shift the gears of empowerment to benefit not only myself but to many other victims out there.  This is definitely a memoir of my harrowing experience in child hood trauma of sexual abuse and my life as a sex-slave in the trafficking scenario here in the United States.  You may have read about me in articles and other places, but if you want to know the truth everything about my life then look no further.  In the articles you may have read about me, certain details were changed due to editorial standards and also because I was not ready to tell the whole story in full.  Now I have the chance to bring my voice to life.  Broken Silence is not your ordinary survival story of family abuse, but it goes beyond the trust realm of our society involving corruption from certain officials and opens a new door of realization of our economy that I was forced to be involved in.  This is my detailed story of how I became a Naturalized Citizen in the United States, shaking the very hands of President Ronald Regan in 1984-1985 and nearly ten years later I had fallen victim into enslavement through the people who are responsible to keep American citizens safe from harm. 

            My documents were destroyed and I couldn’t go to a city hall and ask for a birth certificate, because I wasn’t born here, I would have to go through Immigration and Naturalization Services (INS), which refused to assist me in regaining my papers back.  I had to go through ongoing obstacle course just to claim that my residency in the United States was legal. 

            Where my traffickers weren’t your ordinary hoodlum from the Bronx in NY or some low life Pimp in the Urban areas.  These men and women were extremely powerful and very established.  What makes this story so prevalent is the fact that we refuse to face the truth that the people we put our faith into the justice system are the same people that controls the revolving door of the Human Market.  This book will take you step by step through the scenario of my experience as a vulnerable target to the being the ultimate threat of the ultimate truth.  This will also correlate how family dynamics of child sexual abuse or domestic violence plays a huge part of how a victim can be “chosen” to be enslaved into Domestic Trafficking.  Many of you may have or have not heard of the term, “Human Trafficking”, most of you may have thought of the term at one point or another, that it must’ve been some international issue that it doesn’t exist in our American soil, well the truth is about to shock you. 

            Broken Silence is my story of courage, triumph and integrity of how I managed to escape the horrors of the daily abuse and torture of Human Exploitation, recant over 10 years later to seek peace and serenity of the years that were robbed from me.  Allow me to take you on a journey into my world, most may shock you and may even disgust you, but at least you will know the truth.  I hope you will enjoy reading this book as I have enjoyed sharing it with you.

story:
Engines of Empathy

In a peaceful world where empathically empowered technology runs on positive emotions, some people are prepared to resort to violence to maintain the tranquillity.

After her toaster has a psychotic breakdown, Charlotte Pudding finds herself caught up in what might possibly be the greatest conspiracy in history. Running for her life with a grandmaster of sarcasm, the race is on to discover the secret of an antique desk that is the key to the mysterious origins of Empathic Energy.  With mystical monks, villainous corporations and a shocking revelation about R.A.B.I.T.S, Pudding is on a quest to find patchouli oil, uncover the truth, and (if it’s not too inconvenient) save the world.

Twitter#: #EoE

By contributing to this project you will help cover the cost of:

1. Editing and proof reading by Cohesion Editing Services

2. Cover Design by David Naughton-Shires

3. Formatting and typesetting for ebook and print editions by themadformmater.com

4. Shipping and handling for review copies and promotion.

This is my 3rd book and my first time seeking crowd-sourced funding for the costs that I, as a self-publisher, have previously absorbed.

(And yes, I am planning a sequel!)

story:
In 2008, I emailed my family with a plan. I was going to fundraise by asking my family and their friends to chip in a little bit of money so I could fly to Ohio to get out the vote for Barack Obama in the days leading up the election. I hoped I could raise enough to pay for a round trip air ticket for myself, knowing that Obama supporters in the area were willing to let me sleep on their couch while I was out there. Instead of asking people to give money to the campaign, I asked people to give money to me, so I could turn those donations into tangible action, putting it towards helping me get people to the polls and not towards the attack ads arms race.


In the end, thanks to the magic of email forwarding, I got little checks from dozens of people (including people I had never heard of, frankly), and actually raised enough to buy tickets not only for myself, but also for my former college roommates to join me in Ohio. Together we knocked on hundreds of doors for the Obama campaign, raising awareness and excitement, and helping people get the facts about their polling place, its hours of operations, and how they could get there to do their civic duty. We even combated the false rumors flying around in some low income areas about voting being delayed until Wednesday - a tactic intended to disenfranchise certain types of voters (not sure exactly where the rumor was coming from, I should say).

I know a lot of you don't have the same level of enthusiasm this year as you did in 2008, but this election remains vitally important. While I don't think Romney is as poor of a candidate as McCain (and Bush, obviously), he is still not what this country needs in my view. Given his statements and his somewhat extreme VP selection, it sounds like his likely social and economic policies will do nothing to correct what I believe is a shocking and unfair growth in income inequality in the country - in fact, his policies will likely exacerbate this problem. Internationally, he has also shown himself to be disappointing on his recent foreign excursion. I don't think he's a fool, or an incompetent person, or a tax evader, but he is most certainly not the man who belongs in the White House.

So I am emailing you to ask you to consider making a small contribution - whatever you are willing and able to spare - to help me fund another trip to a key swing state in early November, for myself and as many of my friends as I can convince to join me.

Thanks so much for considering me, and my effort.

Syon Bhanot

Who am I?: So here's the full spiel - apologies in advance for too much information: I went to Princeton University and graduated in 2006. I was politically active there, and spent the summer of 2004 serving as the Canvass Director for the DNC office for the John Kerry campaign in Santa Barbara, CA. I managed a staff of about 30 canvassers and grassroots organizers involved with get-out-the-vote and fundraising campaigns there. After Princeton, I worked for a year in Kenya for the International Rescue Committee, a development organization working with refugees, before starting a Masters program in Public Policy at Harvard's Kennedy School of Government. I graduated from that program in 2009, but stayed on at Harvard as a PhD student in the Public Policy PhD program, where I currently study behavioral economics, decision making, and public sector economics. I have also spent time consulting for the World Bank and UNICEF during his time as a PhD student. Besides all that, I love sports, music, movies, and my dog Humphrey (who is also a Bark Obama fan... sorry).

story:
Summary

From as far back as I could remember the journal was a part of our lives. Almost nightly, as my brother and I got ready for bed, you could find our mom sitting in a quiet corner, a lit cigarette in one hand and an ink pen in the other. As she sat there pouring her thoughts and emotions down on paper we’d change our clothes, brush our teeth, crawl into bed and then yell, “Good night Mom!”, she’d yell back “Good night!”, “We love you!”, “Love you too!”, “See you in the morning!”, “See you in the morning.”, and as we would fall asleep she would write about her day.

The journal was originally intended as a gift exclusively for me and my brother, however, as the years passed she started talking about finding a way to share our story. A couple of times she started trying to type the thousands of hand-written pages, but the emotional toll was too much for her to relive. Now that the journal has been passed down to us, we are determined to fulfill our mom’s wish and share her journal.

As you can see we are looking to raise a minimum of $1450.00. Our intent is to secure enough funding to produce our first year of the “Kendra’s Journal” podcast. This includes buying a digital audio recorder, microphones and other necessary equipment, as well as website and media hosting needed to produce a podcast. We are only looking to raise the minimum amount needed, but should this amount be exceeded, lease know that every dollar raised will contribute to the project. We are dedicated to producing a high quality program that will be free to anyone wanting to listen. Our ultimate goal is to produce 50 podcast episodes in the first year.

Thank you for visiting our page and please share with anyone and everyone you think might be interested. Thank you again!

Mat & Phillip - Kendra’s boys

PS – To our family, yes, this can count as a birthday/holiday gift.

story:
THE EXCERPT IS OUT!!!! 

READ IT HERE

 

"Read along as novelist Sheila Nicole Renva designs a unique world where an artist's creations live and breathe in a fast moving and unpredictable story."

I wrote Sketch in November, 2011. The story grew from a childhood game I would play where my artwork would come to life and then grow into a whole world. Sketch is a teenager with the ability to bring her art to life, but it doesn’t stop there.

She stumbles into a whole city of people like her, musicians who can control people’s emotions, actors who can make you believe absolutely anything, and writers who bring whatever they write to life. But soon, she will learn about the hidden consequences that come with these gifts.

Being a published Author has always been a cherished dream of mine, but I need your help. But without your contributions and your help, none of this will be possible. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

All the money you donate to us will go to publishing the book and distributing it! It is an edifying, creative story, that stimulates creativity in young adults and promotes adventure and the value of life. 

 

The Impact

This whole endeavor will be funded solely by you and your contributions; without your help, this project cannot succeed.

  • Sketch is the first book in the Ink to Ash series, a new fantasy series for young adults.
  • The vision is to create a new story for a new generation of young readers.
  • In the same vein as J.K. Rowling’s massively successful Harry Potter series, the Ink to Ash series strives to emphasize imagination’s role in the battle of good against evil.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help! Here are some more ways that you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Sketch!
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this page with friends and family!

 

Thank you all for your support and your encouragement!

 

SYNOPSIS

Seventeen-year-old Artist, Sketch Sterling, is kidnapped by a mysterious young man with an ominous past who moves her from the everyday world she knows to the world she wants to know more about. Carmen, a hidden city where Art lives, breathes,  and walks the streets alongside the citizens. In Carmen, words crawl off pages to become reality, and people live out their Talents with results both humourous and deadly. As she learns to live in a place where books jump from shelves to visit each other and Street Performers bring sidewalk art to life, Sketch must sort through the complexities of normal life in an abnormal place, while also determining who is friend and who is foe. Screams in the night, confrontations, secret meetings, and statues with attitude all come together for a fast moving and unpredictable story.

Now a student at Artifex, The School of Unusual Arts, where Talents attend classes with titles like “Caging Creations” and “Inspiration & Manipulations”, Sketch begins to discover the dark side of creativity colliding with creation as her growing skills become a necessity for her continued survival. 

With Talents Creating without restraint, living pieces of Art that fade over time become bitter and unpredictable. Carmen’s oppressive Government strictly enforces laws with harsh penalties, destroying Pieces of Art considered dangerous to the city and putting artistic Talents on trial. So, in such dangerous times, why is Sketch suddenly drawn to put herself in such an incredibly dangerous situation? Now, as her reputation disintegrates and her relationships unravel at the seams, Sketch is sorely tested when the Council summons her and she must now rely on the same man who kidnapped her as well as her own raw, untested creativity. 


©Sheila Nicole Renva 2012

 Need to Contact the Author?: Shewalkswithwings@gmail.com

SIDENOTE ON DONATIONS! ---If you pledged for a phone call make sure to message your phone number to the Sketch The Novel on Facebook page so we can reach you =] Thanks!

story:
The Need

Think about wedding ceremonies you have been to. How many have been interesting and enjoyable? The most common answer I get from couples I marry is “None.”

Do you know...

  • why you need 3 colors for unity sand — not the 2 that come in the sets?
  • how to make unity candles stay lit outside?
  • the 3 ways to include your guests during the ceremony?
  • where to seat parents who are divorced and can’t be civil?
  • how to doubly honor your parents if both sets are still married?
  • how to deal with an uneven number of bridesmaids and groomsmen?
  • a way to honor the bridesmaids and groomsmen during the ceremony — not just at the reception?
  • why you should minimize the gap between the end of the ceremony and the reception? And how to entertain your guests for free if you can’t?
  • Why shade is so important at outside weddings?
All will be answered in the e-book!
 
There are 2.1 million weddings in the U.S. every year. That’s a lot of boring ceremonies. There is a big need.
 
 

The Solution

This e-book — "UNboring Wedding: How to Make the Ceremony the Best Part of Your Wedding Day" — is out to change that. I will show couples — with videos, photos and illustrations — how to make their wedding ceremony personalized, romantic and, yes, fun!

And there will be couples’ love stories — how they met, how they fell in love, how he proposed — between every chapter. Those are fun and funny.

 

Why I am Uniquely Qualified

 
I am a full-time wedding minister in the Chicago area. I marry 150 couples a year. I sit down with nearly 100 couples a year (those who choose my top-of-the-line full service ceremony) to plan out their ceremony (and get their love story.) I want to take all that knowledge and experience and help not just 100 couples a year but 1 million!
 
 

Watch the Video

It is 8 minutes of me telling you about the project with a bonus 5 minute video of me sharing a couple’s love story
 
You will find out
  • what I know that couples don’t know, that most officiants don’t know.
  • why I need $5000 to make this e-book.
    • $1000 to hire wedding party -- bride, groom, bridesmaids, groomsmen, ring bearer, flower girl, etc. -- to make video.

The Need
Think about wedding ceremonies you have been to. How many have been interesting and enjoyable? The most common answer I get from couples I marry is “None.”
Do you know...

why you need 3 colors for unity sand — not the 2 that come in the sets?
how to make unity candles stay lit outside?
the 3 ways to include your guests during the ceremony?
where to seat parents who are divorced and can’t be civil?
how to doubly honor your parents if both sets are still married?
how to deal with an uneven number of bridesmaids and groomsmen?
a way to honor the bridesmaids and groomsmen during the ceremony — not just at the reception?
why you should minimize the gap between the end of the ceremony and the reception? And how to entertain your guests for free if you can’t?
Why shade is so important at outside weddings?
All will be answered in the e-book!
 
There are 2.1 million weddings in the U.S. every year. That’s a lot of boring ceremonies. There is a big need.
 
 

The Solution

This e-book — "UNboring Wedding: How to Make the Ceremony the Best Part of Your Wedding Day" — is out to change that. I will show couples — with videos, photos and illustrations — how to make their wedding ceremony personalized, romantic and, yes, fun!
And there will be couples’ love stories — how they met, how they fell in love, how he proposed — between every chapter. Those are fun and funny.
 

Why I am Uniquely Qualified

 
I am a full-time wedding minister in the Chicago area. I marry 150 couples a year. what I know that couples don’t know, that most officiants don’t know.

story:
Picture This!

Around the world people are starting to question authority on a scale never before seen. The Occupy movement, the Tea Party, climate skeptics, 911 Truth Movement the list goes on. They all have something in common, our system is stretched to breaking point, financially, spiritually, socially and politically and something has to change, has to give. Philosophy has often provided ideas for change throughout history and every major political and spiritual movement has had some kind of philosophical counterpart.

Authority is being challenged within academic Philosophy as well, as it is in many other academic fields. The Academy is stuck in outdated ideas and ways of doing things. Change is happening faster than the usual university system can comprehend. New ways for philosophical ideas to be produced and spread are required, and IndieGoGo is surely one of those.

My name is Justin Holme. I studied philosophy at Cambridge University in the UK, at St. Edmund’s Colledge, and graduated with an MA. It was great. The environment was great, the teaching was outstanding, the resources we had were first class in every way. There was one thing missing though and that was fire. A fire for the truth, for creativity and therefore ultimately for the type philosophy I wanted to do.

The academic brand of philosophy seemed to be less concerned with truth and new ideas than it was with choosing a side, often in what seemed a meaningless or irrelevant debate, and then sticking to it doggedly. In this way a young philosopher could join one ‘team’ or another within a particular philosophical battle and expect support at least from one side. Those who wanted to just follow truth where it leads were either attacked by both sides or even worse ignored!

Worst of all if someone stood up and claimed that the whole ‘battlefield’ being fought over was itself irrelevant, that it was a philosophical desert leading to nowhere, they would be strongly attacked by all concerned. Unfortunately this is the reality of much of academic philosophy today and only outside of it can anything much be changed to make it more relevant and more useful. At least this is my conclusion.

However the institutions for this new approach to philosophy are limited. Most journals and publishers are also very tied up in what amounts to another moribund academic institution like so many others many of us know all too well I’m sure. There are a few journals which will publish work from new philosophers, and I have had around ten small and large pieces published in Philosophy Now, the largest circulation philosophy magazine, including one of the essays for this book. I have also had work published by New Humanist, also to be included in the book, and many articles are under consideration at this time. Also the text of two well received talks I gave to the ‘Immoral Sciences Club’, a philosophy students association at Cambridge, are included. Two pieces have been specially written to help to introduce the book and the subject to the reader. However there are really only very limited outlets for philosophy aimed at the interested public.

Magazine articles I thought would be a way forward for someone outside the philosophical establishment to gradually get their work and ideas known and perhaps eventually have enough material for a book. After quite a few years and sending out many articles, and having many of my best ideas published without any payment, I started to think books are the way to go. There is only so long that someone can do the work they love and feel they ‘should’ do without some reward other than the work itself, and perhaps making some contribution to the discussions. Also a book can have a lot more impact if it gets picked up by a few influential critics or even just through word of mouth.

This is where IndieGoGo and you come in. Convincing a publisher that there is a market for work outside the philosophical mainstream, often even critical of it, is not easy to say the least. They know full well that someone who is perhaps going to try to undermine whole areas of ongoing philosophical wrangling is not going to be popular, and then nor are they. Also many publishers make a good profit from supplying volume after volume on subjects the general public will never hear about or care about. Is it any wonder that the public has lost some respect for philosophy, just when it might well be needed the most!

With your support this book can be launched and promoted to the point where the ideas it contains cannot be easily ignored. If through IndieGOGO I can show some of the many open minded and brave publishers, that are out there, that there is a market for this kind of work and an interest, then this could open the door for other projects for myself and other thinkers who have something to offer beyond the usual.

My goal is to reach 1000 copies, hopefully about half of which will be hard backs, by the 31st of January 2012. The electronic books will be sent out in February and the hard backs by the end of March or April.

I hope you will read the few attached samples here and be interested enough to help launch my first book and perhaps a real change in the way philosophy is done.

Thank you.

 

Table of contents (followed by two of the articles mentioned above and links)

 

What is Philosophy?

 

What is Metaphilosophy!? (based on a talk at Cambridge) (introduction to how we do philosophy and why).

 

A Brain in a Box

 

The Chicken and the Egg (Chicken). (New Humanist) (see below)

 

Animal Rights

 

Hume on Causation (Cambridge Immoral Sciences Club)(see below)

 

Technology Stop!

 

The Simulated Self (Philosophy Now)

 

The Philosophy of Climate Change (be warned quite sceptical!)

 

Various smaller pieces and explanation (Philosophy Now)

 

The Second Guess Module (about freewill and consciousness)

 

Results based ethics and their problems.

 

Is the world ‘real’. (the big one!)

 

Sample texts:

The Chicken or the Egg 

 An age old question and conundrum has finally been answered. What had seemed like some kind of eternal paradox has been shown to be only a myth, and it is so simple. 'What came first the chicken or the egg?' has been asked over a pint of beer, or of a curious child, millions of times over the centuries. 'Chicken ...' they might answer, '...because you need a chicken to lay an egg'. Ahha but where did the chicken come from. Well now the answer is found and no one can be asked again. The egg came first.


It is so simple, any evolutionary biologist will tell you that eggs evolved long, long before chickens were even dreamt of. For instance turtles, which have been around for 100s of millions of years longer than chickens, also use eggs in their reproductive cycle.
 

Ahhha you say, Mr. Clever Philosopher, you have misunderstood the question entirely. It is not just any egg that has to be proven the former, it is a chicken egg only that counts. The question should really state 'What came first the chicken or the chicken egg?'.

 
Right let us really define the question. With chicken we mean the common farmyard animal, pieces of which add substance to our Friday night Vindaloo curries, and with 'egg' we mean the egg that is laid by the female of that species? Then I say the answer is chicken. The chicken came first.
 

Oh brilliant you may say. Anyone could answer this question with two guesses, there are after all only two answers.
 

Ahha I would say but this is a different and altogether better defined question. Also some might say that chickens and eggs popped into existence simultaneously, if they did not believe in evolution by natural selection, but in the biblical account of creation, taken literally.
 

You might well say; No, I believe in evolution, or at least something like the theory, and before you get really obscure I believe in linear time. In other words things that happened in the past, as we normally refer to it, happen 'before' things that happen in the present or in the future.
 

OK, I say, then let me take you back to the past to prove my claim that the chicken must have come first. Way, way back we pass through the mists of time to a field long ago before the time of chickens.


Now you're getting facetious...
 

In fact just before chickens evolved. Down below we see on the plain two animals that look a bit like chickens but they are in fact their immediate ancestors in the evolutionary chain. We will call them Chickenosauruses.
 

Couldn't you be bothered even to do a little bit of research?
 

Just after having something to eat, and before settling down for the night, they decide to try to create another little Chickenosaurus.
 

Oh my, this is getting heated!
 

But something is wrong ... as the sperm and egg meet there is a mistake that will be replicated in every cell. It will be no Chickenosaurus that matures within the Chickenosaurus-egg but a horrible mutant.
 

A chicken!?
 

Yes, you got it, but from a Chickenosaurus-egg. In fact she is a hen who will go on to lay a chicken egg when she is mature.

 
Maybe. Anyway can we go back to the discussion on linear time, there really is no proof for it you know!?

Brain in a Box

Philosophers have debated the possibility that the world is an illusion, ever since there were thinkers that can be called the name. The French philosopher René Descartes, of ‘I think therefore I am’ fame, was one of the first to describe the problem clearly. He postulated that there might be an evil demon that controlled all his sensory inputs and could therefore delude him about everything, except maybe himself. Today’s philosophers are more likely to talk in scientific terms, of a mad scientist controlling a virtual-reality machine that we are plugged into. The problem is how can we know this is not the case?
 

If it is the case that the universe is an independent reality, or a common-sense reality as we normally think about it, how could we tell this apart from an extremely well generated simulation? There might even be quite severe shortcomings of the virtual reality, but we would be so accustomed to them that we would be unlikely to see them as such. With no other ‘true’ reality to compare this one with, it would seem impossible to notice such shortcomings. All we can really know for sure is that something exists, and that something I call ‘me’.
 

So in the universe we are thinking about there is definitely me and someone, or something else, which is generating what I perceive as reality. Rather than labelling that something as a ‘mad scientist’ or ‘evil demon’ I will use a more neutral word, the Generator. I think the Generator also deserves the use of capitals as in this universe It would be the equivalent of God. It has, presumably, created this simulated reality, It controls it to a very fine degree and I am essentially totally in Its power. Also why should I assume that It is evil or mad, certainly there seem to be many bad and even evil things in this reality but there are many good and beautiful aspects too.
 

From my own point of view the Generator appears to have treated me quite well and fairly, maybe there is even a hint of love there. If It was evil or mad surely my life would have been much different, not something that seems to have been leading me to greater self-awareness and empowerment but something more like the traditional view of hell, or a living insanity. No, I see a world that generally seems to make rational sense, in which I can see most of my misfortunes have been created by my own actions, or inactions, and where I have experienced much pleasure and joy.
 

So it seems unfair to label the Generator as evil, at least not yet, plus I don’t really want to believe that the being who has total control of my experience of the world, and who seems to be my only companion, is evil or mad. On the other side it seems difficult to really believe It is doing this all for my benefit, as I have suffered some injustices, accidents and other things that would not seem necessarily to be for my benefit.


Of course all of this is a kind of binary universe, the Generator and I. Maybe my reality is controlled by hundreds of other beings, millions or none. Perhaps the Generator and myself are the same being. This would seem to be more likely as it does not require that I postulate this incredible other being. The only thing I really know exists is me, so maybe I generate reality, and hide this fact from myself. Perhaps I am trapped within my own fantasy and out there, if I could only let it go, is a true reality waiting, or perhaps not.


If I am indeed all that exists then maybe I have been forced to create a reality to escape crushing loneliness, isolation and boredom. One can imagine a consciousness all alone in the void and darkness wanting to do just that, assuming It didn’t have the means to create a ‘real’ reality, which would surely be preferable. In fact I may have just started seeing swirls of light in the darkness, indistinct shapes and started ‘hearing’ noises or voices, and that was just the beginning of everything I now perceive as existing.
 

If all this was true then in fact my current mental state may be due to a long process of fantasy creation, where I have ended up with a very coherent virtual reality which basically does work. I am rarely bored, often feel that I am with others, have projects that interest me, and it even feels like I am becoming somehow better. Perfect, the illusion is so strong that I can even write an article on this fact without it feeling at all illusory, so what’s the problem?

 
Well with the single-being universe I can’t see a problem. I am probably doing the best I can to cope and will probably continue to do so (not only that, but I already capitalise ‘I’ so that is sorted out). After all what would be the choice; darkness, loneliness and boredom? I think fantasy is a much better alternative.

 
On the other hand the binary universe looks even better, just the benefit of not being completely alone makes up for ambiguities or imperfections in the Generator. Also it explains how such an apparently puny being, such as I appear to myself to be when I examine my own thought processes, manages to generate such an incredible place. After all can it be that the same creature that, on the one hand, can’t work out how to use some functions on his mobile-phone, is capable of generating all of reality, so the binary-universe looks more likely again.
 

However there exists the possibility that the binary universe could be worse than the ‘I’ universe. Maybe the Generator has just been lulling me into a false sense of security, so that when the rug is finally pulled from under my feet, the fall will be so much more sadistically satisfying. In other words the fact that the universe seems reasonably benign and predictable could be just temporary.
 

Maybe this dramatic change in reality has happened many, many times in the past and the Generator has arranged for me to forget this terrible fact. Perhaps It uses the illusion of birth and early childhood, which does seem a bit unreal, fuzzy and a long time ago, to hide the past. There does however seem to be a more likely scenario for the binary universe, and one that is much more appealing anyway.
 

Maybe the Generator was at one time the only being, as in the ‘I’ universe, but instead of falling into fantasy, or after long periods of fantasy that It eventually tired of or escaped, It decided to try creating a genuine other being. I am Its first prototype companion, which would explain some of the mistakes that I see as injustices and suffering. Obviously the suffering of others is unreal and therefore is only there as instruction, or support for myself, and tells me nothing about the goodness or otherwise of the Generator. However what if others are not illusions purely for my benefit?

 
Perhaps the Generator, realising that it had the capacity to create other beings decided that It better create more than one. It could be the case that in the past It started with one, or just a few beings, and this did not really work out well. These prototypes were able to realise they were alone, or very few, in the universe and suffered because of this. On the other hand they may not have been entirely what the Generator wanted or, after creating them, It had a grander vision. It saw the possibility of creating a whole other genuine and rational reality into which would spring consciousness largely from itself. Just a ‘little’ Big Bang, of exactly the correct type, and everything would lead from that.
 

Not only would this have the advantage of creating a whole range and variety of others but they would have a certain independence from the Generator. Within this separate reality they could interact with each other and would not have to face the same problems of loneliness and boredom, or general lack of anything, that the Generator Itself had suffered. Given time these beings would develop and grow, and many, if not all, would mature to the point where they would be genuine companions to the Generator. This would be perhaps what could be called the Common Sense Universe, which largely agrees with how we normally think of it.

 
All these scenarios have one thing in common; it is better to believe in a good Generator whichever universe is in fact true. If the ‘I’ universe is the case, then the belief in a separate Generator, would increase the illusion of companionship and security, which would help the fantasy. In the binary-universe I, being the only subject of every whim of the Generator, had better believe that It has my interests somewhat at heart. The alternative is really not worthy of consideration, if taken seriously.

 Continued in the book.

No, I see a world that generally seems to make rational sense, in which I can see most of my misfortunes have been created by my own actions, or inactions, and where I have experienced much pleasure and joy. So it seems unfair to label the Generator as evil, at least not yet, plus I don’t really want to believe that the being who has total control of my experience of the world, and who seems to be my only companion, is evil or mad. On the other side it seems difficult to really believe It is doing this all for my benefit, as I have suffered some injustices, accidents and other things that would not seem necessarily to be for my benefit.Of course all of this is a kind of binary universe, the Generator and I. Maybe my reality is controlled by hundreds of other beings, millions or none. Perhaps the Generator and myself are the same being. This would seem to be more likely as it does not require that I postulate this incredible other being. The only thing I really know exists is me, so maybe I generate reality, and hide this fact from myself. Perhaps I am trapped within my own fantasy and out there, if I could only let it go, is a true reality waiting, or perhaps not.If I am indeed all that exists then maybe I have been forced to create a reality to escape crushing loneliness, isolation and boredom. One can imagine a consciousness all alone in the void and darkness wanting to do just that, assuming It didn’t have the means to create a ‘real’ reality, which would surely be preferable. In fact I may have just started seeing swirls of light in the darkness, indistinct shapes and started ‘hearing’ noises or voices, and that was just the beginning of everything I now perceive as existing. If all this was true then in fact my current mental state may be due to a long process of fantasy creation, where I have ended up with a very coherent virtual reality which basically does work. I am rarely bored, often feel that I am with others, have projects that interest me, and it even feels like I am becoming somehow better. Perfect, the illusion is so strong that I can even write an article on this fact without it feeling at all illusory, so what’s the problem? Well with the single-being universe I can’t see a problem. I am probably doing the best I can to cope and will probably continue to do so (not only that, but I already capitalise ‘I’ so that is sorted out). After all what would be the choice; darkness, loneliness and boredom? I think fantasy is a much better alternative. On the other hand the binary universe looks even better, just the benefit of not being completely alone makes up for ambiguities or imperfections in the Generator. Also it explains how such an apparently puny being, such as I appear to myself to be when I examine my own thought processes, manages to generate such an incredible place. After all can it be that the same creature that, on the one hand, can’t work out how to use some functions on his mobile-phone, is capable of generating all of reality, so the binary-universe looks more likely again. However there exists the possibility that the binary universe could be worse than the ‘I’ universe. Maybe the Generator has just been lulling me into a false sense of security, so that when the rug is finally pulled from under my feet, the fall will be so much more sadistically satisfying. In other words the fact that the universe seems reasonably benign and predictable could be just temporary. Maybe this dramatic change in reality has happened many, many times in the past and the Generator has arranged for me to forget this terrible fact. Perhaps It uses the illusion of birth and early childhood, which does seem a bit unreal, fuzzy and a long time ago, to hide the past. There does however seem to be a more likely scenario for the binary universe, and one that is much more appealing anyway. Maybe the Generator was at one time the only being, as in the ‘I’ universe, but instead of falling into fantasy, or after long periods of fantasy that It eventually tired of or escaped, It decided to try creating a genuine other being. I am Its first prototype companion, which would explain some of the mistakes that I see as injustices and suffering. Obviously the suffering of others is unreal and therefore is only there as instruction, or support for myself, and tells me nothing about the goodness or otherwise of the Generator. However what if others are not illusions purely for my benefit? Perhaps the Generator, realising that it had the capacity to create other beings decided that It better create more than one. It could be the case that in the past It started with one, or just a few beings, and this did not really work out well. These prototypes were able to realise they were alone, or very few, in the universe and suffered because of this. On the other hand they may not have been entirely what the Generator wanted or, after creating them, It had a grander vision. It saw the possibility of creating a whole other genuine and rational reality into which would spring consciousness largely from itself. Just a ‘little’ Big Bang, of exactly the correct type, and everything would lead from that. Not only would this have the advantage of creating a whole range and variety of others but they would have a certain independence from the Generator. Within this separate reality they could interact with each other and would not have to face the same problems of loneliness and boredom, or general lack of anything, that the Generator Itself had suffered. Given time these beings would develop and grow, and many, if not all, would mature to the point where they would be genuine companions to the Generator. This would be perhaps what could be called the Common Sense Universe, which largely agrees with how we normally think of it. All these scenarios have one thing in common; it is better to believe in a good Generator whichever universe is in fact true. If the ‘I’ universe is the case, then the belief in a separate Generator, would increase the illusion of companionship and security, which would help the fantasy. In the binary-universe I, being the only subject of every whim of the Generator, had better believe that It has my interests somewhat at heart. The alternative is really not worthy of consideration, if taken seriously. Continued in the book.
